name: A Cappella and Beatboxing Society (UMACABS)
description: UMACABS (UoM A Cappella and Beatboxing Society) is an inclusive and friendly society made up of people who love to sing. We are non-selective and have singers of all abilities and talents. 'License To Trill', 'Sedoctaves', 'Tone Deft' and 'Here Comes Treble' are our 4 A Capella groups which perform in our Winter and Summer Showcases, as well as some public events. In addition, we also have 'Alvarium', our competition group (formerly known as 'Fantastic Beats and Where to Find Them') who represent Manchester University at the National A Capella competition, the VoiceFestival UK.   For all information on our upcoming Showcases, events and auditions, join our Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/groups/UoMACapella/ To check out our videos, here is our Youtube Channel: www.youtube.com/channel/UCOJQNItOcWTSd-Gat0oaBNW

name: Access All Areas Projects/Volunteers
description: Access All Areas is the newest volunteering arm of the Students’ Union.  We support any student-led project which aims to tackle some of the barriers young people and adults might face in terms of university access and participation.  You can volunteer with our project leaders in schools, colleges, the university, and in the local community! Not only that, we have an awareness group open to anyone who wants to learn more about the issues linked to university access and participation. Upcoming events this year include Consider Postgrad , movie nights, pub quizzes and our very first national conference.   Click JOIN GROUP to sign up to our mailing list to keep up to date with what's going on and to get involved.  Visit the volunteering hub to sign up to current Access All Areas opportunities.   Follow...  Katie SU Barnes on Facebook Access All Areas page on Facebook @AccessMCR on Twitter @UOMAccessAllAreas Instagram  accessallareasmcr@outlook.com  Volunteer hours can be counted towards your Manchester Leadership Award, or can be printed on your degree transcript if you volunteer 10 hours or more with us.

name: Accounting Society Manchester
description: Welcome to Accounting Society!  We, Accounting Society Manchester, are a student-run organisation that strives to enhance your employability and build the link between you and desired employers. Aside from the career aspects, we provide social opportunities, such as our annual Welcome Dinner, for like-minded students to connect and share their ideas with each other. Stay tuned for our events and recruitment news on our channels, and get involved! For further information, please feel free to contact one of the committee members shown below. Contact Details President: Jay Cao (jie.cao@acctsocmanchester.co.uk) Vice President (Career): Jia Xuen Chok (jiaxuen.chok@acctsocmanchester.co.uk) Vice President (Social): Alex John (alex.john@acctsocmanchester.co.uk) Secretary : Jess Muck (hiuying.muck@acctsocmanchester.co.uk)   Facebook Group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/UMAcS - Join us! Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/UoMAcc/ - Like us! Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/uom_acctsoc/ - Follow us! LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/accountingsocietymanchester - Follow us! Wechat Page:

name: A Christ's Friends
Active Anthropology
description: The Active Anthropology society aims to make Anthropology a fun, interesting and engaging subject to both those familiar and unfamiliar with it alike. Social Anthropology is a great subject but often times it's hard to understand, or people just don't know what it is, or even if you do know what it is and you study it you find the theory gets a bit too dense and boring. That is why we are here to bring back to the subject some needed fun and vibrancy! We are going to be  holding events across the year which will simultaneously help you better understand and engage with the subject, have fun with other like-minded students  interested in anthropology and to test your Anthropological skills! Anyone is welcome so come along and see what Anthropology is really about. Like us on Facebook here for pictures, updates and more! https://www.facebook.com/UoMAnthropologySociety

name: Active Anthropology Society
description: Anthropology is the study of people, societies, cultures, and everything in between! Anthropologists are a friendly bunch, and the Anthropology Society is a wonderful space both for budding anthropologists and anyone interested in this amazing discipline. We are a small but enthusiastic society, welcoming people from all kinds of backgrounds. We organise and attend exciting and stimulating lectures on a wide range of themes, as well as film screenings and great socials. In the past we've held all sorts of fun events, such as pub quizzes, debates and talks with guest speakers. Join our society and we can guarantee you'll have lots of fun, make great friends and have your eyes opened to some fascinating insights about people, places and cultures around the world.  We're a very open and inclusive society, and would love to hear from you. If you have any questions, comments or ideas for future events, please get in touch: https://www.facebook.com/UoMAnthropologySociety uomanthrosoc@outlook.com @uomanthrosoc

name: Actuarial Society
description: We aim to provide more opportunities for our members to deepen their understanding of the actuarial industry, ultimately promoting the actuarial profession as a possible career path to all students with numerical background from across the university.  The society aspires to develop business acumen and a strong commercial awareness among its members, alongside the development of key actuarial skills and strong industry connections.  Given our small cohort of actuarial students, we aim to tighten the bond of those studying actuarial science and those who are also interested in actuarial science, so as to create a more inclusive and friendly environment for these like-minded students. To achieve our goals, we will be organising throughout the year a range of events such as presentations by industry professionals, workshops, alumni events, mock assessment centres, networking events and also exciting socials for our members!  If you are eager to learn more about the actuarial industry and what the role of an actuary entails, join us now! Join our Facebook group to get updates on future industry events and socials: facebook.com/groups/ActuarialSociety Follow us on Instagram: @uom.actuarialsociety If you have any questions please contact us at: uom.actuarialsociety@gmail.com

name: Adventist Students on Campus (ASC)
description: ASC is a christian society that caters for the spiritual, social and practical needs of students at the University of Manchester and the wider communities.  We aim to share the gospel, health and the three angel's messages. Our mission is to reach the student population of Manchester with the good news of the gospel, the Love of Christ, and present day truth using Christ's method.   ACTIVITIES INCLUDE: 1. Weekly meetings and sharing of faith (FREE food)  2. Healthy cooking classes 3. Social events 4. Sporting events 5. Monthly discussion forum 6. Bible Seminars   HOW TO CONTACT US Email:  manchester.a.s.c@gmail.com Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/Manchester.ASC

name: Aerospace Society
description: Aerosoc is a society run by aerospace engineering students and aims to bring together students from all disciplines who share a passion for aerospace and aviation. As a society we aim to:  Stimulate interest in aerospace.   Provide networking opportunities with professionals in the aerospace industry. Initiate aerospace related projects and scientific research.  Organise social events and international trips for members and promote related techinical tours and lectures/seminars.   For more information; Visit our website www.aerosoc.org  We welcome you to Aerosoc!

name: Afghan Society
description: The University of Manchester Afghan Society aims to raise awareness about Afghan culture and tradition. In addition, to create a community where we aim to unite all the Afghan and non-Afghan students. Show to the students the other side of Afghanistan other than the War and the political clashes. Join and like the offical Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/uomafghansoc/   For more information please contact:- Salahudin Akbari Email:- salahudin.akbari@student.manchester.ac.uk

name: African Caribbean Medics Society
description: An inclusive society with the aim to establish a community and a sense of belonging amongst students of African and/or Caribbean heritage, to support students and help manage the challenges faced whilst studying vocational courses. Email: UOMACMS@GMAIL.COM Twitter: @UoMACMS https://twitter.com/UoMACMS Instagram: @uom_acms

name: African Caribbean Society
description: 'ENHANCE, ENGAGE, EMPOWER'   We are the African Caribbean Society of the University of Manchester.    ACS exists for all races & ethnicities. Our aim is to invoke appreciation for and enlighten those amongst the student population and wider community, about the rich heritage of African and Caribbean nations in an informative but stimulating way for all to share. In addition, we exist to promote growth both personally and professionally for the African and Caribbean student community.   The ACS is also a platform for African and Caribbean students at the Manchester universities to come together, educate their peers and encourage cultural appreciation through a variety of events.   ACS is headed up by an executive committee comprising of a wide range of students from all faculties with different African and Caribbean backgrounds. Members are the foundation of the ACS therefore membership is encouraged and we welcome everyone to join. Membership provides a network and a stronger rapport within the society.   We trust that for however long you are in Manchester to study, you will enjoy the role of the ACS in university life!   For more information please contact our comittee Secretary: Neso Ebenebe acsmanchester18@gmail.com President: Jesy Kamale Luyengi president@acsmanchester.com Vice-President: Ines Adeogun-Phillips vice-president@acsmanchester.com   For regular updates...  Follow us on Twitter - @ACSManUni  https://twitter.com/ACSManUni  Follow us on Instagram - @Acsmanchester  https://www.instagram.com/acsmanchester/  Add us on Facebook  https://www.facebook.com/acsmanchester  Follow us on LinkedIn  https://www.linkedin.com/company/university-of-manchester-s-african-caribbean-society/about/

name: Ahlulbayt Society
description: The Ahlulbayt society aims to propagate the light of Islam, the Holy Qur'an, the Prophet of Islam and His Progeny (Peace be upon them). Our name is derived from the ‘Ahlulbayt’, who are the beloved family of the Holy Prophet of Islam Muhammad (Peace be upon him and his holy household). Our aims are to unite individuals, irrespective of social or ethnic backgrounds. Through this, we encourage justice and peace.  In addition, we aim to create a platform for interfaith dialogue and bringing about unity regardless of faith, race or background. “A person is either your brother in faith, or your equal in humanity” - Imam Ali (peace be upon him) In light of this, the Ahlulbayt society strives to use the University platform to create dialogue, discussion and free exchange of ideas. Through this, we endeavour to facilitate the understanding of Islam and its philosophy, and show how this encompasses every aspect of our lives, including politics, economics and spirituality. Our events range from talks by expert speakers, informal discussion circles, social gatherings and sporting events.   Contact us on: manchesterahlulbayt@gmail.com   Visit us at:   Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/manchesterabsoc Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/manchesterabsoc/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/ManchesterABSoc

name: AI and Machine Learning
description: No description

name: AIESEC in Manchester
description: Join the most passionate youth organisation in the world! "AIESEC is a global youth-led organisation striving to achieve peace and fulfilment of humankind's potential by activating leadership qualities in youth through learning from practical experiences in challenging environments." Being a part of AIESEC is like joining a massive community of globally-minded young leaders. People who want to grow their own potential while contributing to something much greater than themselves. We give you immediate responsibilities so you can learn by doing, step outside your comfort zone and experience both success and failures amongst a supportive community. If you're keen on activating your potential and contributing to a mission that changes the world, then we're looking for you. We can’t promise that it'll be easy, but it sure will be worth it.   MEMBER EXPERIENCE Compliment your studies as a volunteer with AIESEC. You'll quickly be given responsibilities to run YOUR local AIESEC entity on campus.  By getting actively involved in the day-to-day running of AIESEC, you will develop your communication and business skills while growing your network of contacts. As a member, you will:  benefit from induction conference and training to prepare you for the role be given a role of responsibility inside one of the teams attend weekly team meeting and local committee meeting (with all teams on campus) have the opportunity to attend national conferences and training events have the opportunity to progress and become a team leader  have the opportunity to go on an exchange project with increased benefits as a member                   Find out more about our programs and how to join our organization                                                              AIESEC UK Web Page                                                AIESEC UK Facebook Page                                                                                                            AIESEC (UK) Ltd - 29-31 Cowper Street - London - EC2A 4AT. Registered Company #01206976. Registered Charity #274779

name: AikiBudo
description: AikiBudo is a new UoM society specifically looking at the study of Japanese bokken and Jo (weapons). Training will be in Iwama tradition as taught by Morihiro Saito Sensei. The club has been formed by staff and students from the University of Manchester as a non-profit club.  WEAPON TRAINING (BUKIWAZA)  The main aim of the society is to train students in Japanese weapons Bokken (wooden sword) and Jo (wooden staff) once a week. The teaching will be provided free by a member of Staff from UoM who holds a Sport England recognised teaching certificate. We will also invite high-ranking International teachers (Sensei) to run high profile seminars. We usually train every Thursday between 20:15 and 22:15 but dates and times may vary - please check our facebook page.   Each individual gains different things from practice. Some enjoy the martial, physical and technical aspects of one of the most sophisticated martial arts ever developed, while others engage more with aspects of concentration and moving meditation. It is a personal journey with many possibilities. If you wish to study Taijutsu there is an affiliated Iwama Club running two nights at the Sugden Centre. For more information find us on Facebook or get in touch through the Manchester University Student's Union website   https://www.facebook.com/aikidoalivemanchester/  https://www.facebook.com/AikidoAliveLondonDojo/  https://manchesterstudentsunion.com/groups/aikibudo

name: Aikido
description: Welcome to the Aikido Society!   In our society we practise and promote Aikido. We hold various socials and have a strong sense of community spirit with all our members. Aikido is a great way to have fun and de-stress and meet new friends. So come along and give it a go!   Some info on what Aikido is all about:   Aikido is a Japanese martial art that is focused on self defence, involving locks, throws, grabs and strikes. Aikido uses the Attacker’s power against them, finding strength through the calmness of mind and body. It is renowned as a non-aggressive yet highly effective martial art and we practice in a non competitive and friendly training atmosphere. As well as improving balance, posture and coordination, Aikido also develops your sense of awareness and keeps you fit! We are associated with the Mason Street Dojo and our doors are always open to new members!   Check our Facebook group for the latest updates on our training times and location: https://www.facebook.com/groups/aikidosociety/  https://www.facebook.com/AikidoYuishinkaiManchester/   Interested? Just come along in loose fitting clothes and join in. No previous martial arts training needed.   For more information about Aikido have a look at our websites or send an email or come and ask us personally. We’re always happy to spread the word about Aikido!   Contact us on: aikidosociety@gmail.com   Visit us at: https://www.facebook.com/groups/aikidosociety/ https://www.facebook.com/AikidoYuishinkaiManchester/ https://www.facebook.com/KSKAikido

name: Alliance Manchester Business School (AMBS) Horizon Society
description: AMBS Horizon Society is a postgraduate society for postgraduate students studying in Alliance Manchester Business School, who share the common goal of building the networks and skills required for success in the modern business environment. The objective of the Society is to help students get the most out of their time at AMBS. Our aim is to enable current Postgraduate AMBS students to develop the networking skills required for success in business and social environments as well as providing students with the opportunity to meet others from various cultural, academic, and professional backgrounds. The Society aims to achieve this through bringing together Postgraduate AMBS Students at range of exciting events over the course of the year.

name: ALPHA KAPPA PSI
description: The world's oldest and largest co-ed business fraternity with:  - 240,000 members   - 90 alumni chapters   - 2 U.S Presidents   - 36 Fortune 500 Presidents   ...  For more information please visit:  Website: http://www.akpsimanchester.co.uk/ Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/AKPsiManchester?fref=ts

name: Ambitious Abroad
description: No description

name: Amnesty International UMSU
description: "It is better to light a candle than to curse the darkness" - Peter Benson, founder of Amnesty International   Amnesty International is a global movement which campaigns to protect human rights all over the world. We are a group of individuals seeking justice on behalf of those to whom it is denied, speak up for those who are silenced, and support those who fighting for their human rights. In Manchester this means campaigning, we do letter writings, creative campaigns, demonstrations and anything we can think of to get information out there about human rights violations and show that we will not stand for it. We also fundraise for Amnesty international, supporting them in their vital research, and host film nights and discussion groups.    We are ordinary people standing up for humanity and human rights.    Contact us on: manchester.uni.amnesty@gmail.com   Visit us at: https://www.facebook.com/groups/2217050391/

name: Anglotalk Society
description: Anglotalk Society

name: Anime Society
description: For further details about events, screenings and general discussion, visit us at: http://www.facebook.com/groups/muasociety/ The Manchester University Anime Society is the official society for the viewing, enjoyment and promotion of the best animated television programmes and films from Japan, doing so for over a decade now. We find that anime has such a vast wealth of exciting and enthralling experiences to offer, which shouldn’t be overlooked. Thusly, our goal is to challenge that disinterest, whilst providing a welcoming atmosphere to everyone and getting people interested and excited about anime. We host weekly screenings showcasing the very best from a broad range of genres; from visceral action to thought-provoking science fiction and from heart-warming family movies to sweeping fantasy adventures. Through a vote at the beginning of the year, we select a number of series to play through each screening and combine them with spectacular movies to make for unique and memorable events. Aside from the screenings, we organise meals out, pub crawls and indulge in karaoke; the other most prominent Japanese export. There are also cosplay parties during the year, where you can dress up as your favorite character (or not) and dance the night away to ear-pleasing J-Pop and J-Rock tunes. Membership is free and it is a terrific way to meet like-minded people interested in other cultures, new experiences and just having all-out fun.

name: Arab Society
description: The Manchester University Arab Society is a society in which we encourage the diversity and enhancement of knowledge of the different Arab cultures. As well as that we aim to provide a comfortable yet sociable atmosphere for not just students from Arab Countries but those wishing to mix and know more about how people of Arabian descent interact and their rich culture, including the different colloquialisms within the languages, the food, the music, the clothes and many other things. Visit us at: https://m.facebook.com/mcrarabsoc

name: Archaeology Society
description: Join the Archaeology Society for fun and interesting experiences, a great group of friends, a good laugh and a drink! As well as the usual society drinking socials, we offer a wide range of unique opportunities both within the university and in the local area.   Events and other activities include:   > Research seminars, led by academics on a range of relevant archaeological topics > Artefact handling sessions, where you will get to handle and learn about real archaeological artefacts > Trips to museums, cities with archaeological significance, and monuments. Potential future trips include the Liverpool World Museum, the British Museum, and a Christmas time visit to York! > Other cool experimental archaeology stuff - ever wanted to try your hand at flint knapping or pottery? Now's your best chance... > Volunteering opportunities, advertised by us whenever we see them - any experience in the field that's available in the area, you'll be the first to know. > Loads of fun socials that don't just involve alcohol, like laserquest and film nights (potentially at cool locations like the museum)! > But, we also like to get drunk too!       Join our facebook group! It's basically our social hub - anything archaeology related gets posted here by members and committee alike.        Our dedicated committee members are always available to email if you have any queries and we'll get back to you within a few days!

name: Archery Society
description: Set up in 2018, the archery society is new in the University of Manchester and welcomes both new and experienced members. We hold socials throughout the year and have both free shooting and coached training sessions. Beginners on the taught course need not pay for membership. Experienced archers - please do not pay for membership until our coaches have cleared you to shoot at your first session. Join our Facebook group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/358326414645522/ Sign up to our mailing list: http://eepurl.com/gEL0z5

name: Ashburne Hall & Sheavyn House
description: Ashburne & Sheavyn JCR, a student committee who are elected to run activities and events in halls to benefit residents.

name: Astronomy Society
description: The Astronomy Society is aimed at anyone, from any course, who is interested in learning a bit more about what's out there. We do stargazings every Thursday utop the Schuster Building. We visit various observatories, invite guest lecturers from all across the country, go on camping trips and so much more! The best way to find out about what's going on is by following us on social media! @astrosoc.uom - Instagram https://www.facebook.com/astrosoc.uom We look forward to meeting you! :)

name: BA Econ Society
description: Being a part of a society, and specifically the society of your course will enrich your student experience, enhance your career prospects and create a lively social network with other fellow BA Econ students. Who are we?  We are the largest course society at the University of Manchester responsible for those studying social science courses.  If you will be studying Economics, Politics, Accounting, Finance, Business, Sociology, Criminology, Development or Social Anthropology; then this the perfect society for you!   What are we aiming to do this year?    We are here to help BA Econ students to get to know one another and foster a community.  Creating a network for BA Econ students by holding social events throughout the year, providing career advice and networking.  Enriching the general student experience through sports events, charity fundraisers and trips.  For more information please contact: President: Prasham Sheth Email: prasham.sheth@student.manchester.ac.uk

name: BA in Social Sciences Society (BASS)
description: The BASS Society aims to create more events to meet new people, get career advice, form study groups and have a point of contact for any other course-related queries! We want to create spaces where BASS students can come together from a diverse range of subjects and topics and meet people from numerous branches of the Social Sciences School. If you have any questions about any events or ideas don’t hesitate to get in contact with us!

name: Baking Society
description: To interest more people in baking. Have group events to showcase members baking and help them improve their baking skills. Email: uom.bakingsoc@gmail.com Like our Facebook page and join our Facebook group for more info.

name: Balkan Society
description: The Balkan Society unites together students who share the common love for the region.  We aim to share the knowledge of the unique cultures of the Balkan countries across University students and encourage diversity. We want to create a community within the society where all of us feel invited and united. Our aim is to represent Balkan students by promoting our beautiful culture, food, and traditions through various events, informal meetings, and workshops. Stay tuned for one amazing year filled with fun and parties!  For regular updates: Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/uombalkan/ Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/uom.balkan/ Email: uombalkan@gmail.com

name: Ballroom and Latin Society
description: At Manchester Universities Ballroom and Latin Society (lovingly known as MUBLS) we teach the 10 dances of Ballroom and Latin including cha cha, waltz, jive, and quickstep. Come and join over 200 students in one of the most fun and outgoing clubs at Manchester University! We welcome dancers of all levels - you do not need any previous experience to become a member. Do not worry if you'd like to have a go but don't have a partner - you'll dance with many different partners during our lessons! With weekly classes, private lessons, and individual practice, every member can learn new routines and improve their technique at their own pace. At MUBLS you can look forward to:  - Dancing competitions, including Nationals in Blackpool  - Performances  - Award-winning ”Strictly Come Manchester”  - DanceFest Tour in Spain  - Salsa socials  - Unique workshops  and much more! Classes are held every Sunday (£4 for members and £5 for non-members).  Membership costs: £15 per year, £9 per semester The goal of MUBLS will always be to allow all its members to enjoy Ballroom and Latin dancing to its fullest potential, and we will actively look for new opportunities to help them improve. If you want to get in touch, you can find us on:  Facebook - @MUBLS  Instagram - @mubls_  or you can email us at mublscommittee@gmail.com. Happy dancing!

name: Baltic Society
description: The UoM Baltic Society seeks to increase the awareness of Baltic region and introduce it to other students. Whether you are from Baltics or not, our academic activities and socials are open to everyone! We organise  Lectures, roundtables and debates (with guest speakers) on Baltic politics and culture Fascinating socials Engaging cultural lessons and workshops  You can easily find us on Facebook and see our website for upcoming events and news. Kohtumiseni! Uz tikšanos! Iki pasimatymo!

name: Bangladesh  Society
description: University of Manchester Bangladesh Society is one of the largest Bangladeshi student bodies in the UK. It is an integral part of Manchester Students’ Union and one of the oldest societies here. This Society is dedicated to all the students of the University of Manchester, it itakes pride in promoting Bangladeshi culture and heritage in the UK and also build cultural bridges with other groups of students from all over the world. Like us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/BSS.Manchester   Join our Facebook Group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/211126298901125/

name: Barbershop Singers
description: Do you love to sing? We're the chorus for you! Come and sing in 4-part harmony!   Join Now! - And then just turn up to the rehearsal!  (It's really that easy!)   We rehearse every Friday evening at the Student’s Union from 17:30 – 20:00 *All members will meet in Room 2.5 (top floor) every Friday*   Come and join one of our rehearsals and find out all about singing in perfect 4-part harmony.  We guarantee that when you hear the music we create, you will want to join and sing with us.    Visit our Website      Like our Facebook           Watch our YouTube   Manchester University Barbershop Singers (MUBS) is a student run, national award-winning singing society. We have choruses for male-voices, and female-voices* that specialises in singing 4-part barbershop harmony. Neither chorus requires you to audition, and no previous singing, or musical experience is required.   We are an award-winning society, having won several awards in national competitions! Check out our website to find out much more about us.   Although we are a University of Manchester society, we are open to everyone, including students from other local universities, and colleges.   So come along and experience what MUBS has to offer!   We rehearse every Friday evening at the Student’s Union from 17:30 – 20:00 *All members will meet in Room 2.5 (top floor) every Friday*   Contact our Secretary for more info, general enquiries, or even to sign yourself up! mubssecretary@gmail.com         *Nonbinary, genderqueer, and otherwise identifying singers are more than welcome to join whichever chorus is most comfortable for them. We do our absolute best to accommodate everyone in terms of their vocal range. Members of the committee, and music teams, are happy to help in any way that they can with any issues.

name: Baseball and Softball Society
description: Have you ever wanted to try something different? Softball is one of the only sports at the University of Manchester that is gender inclusive. We welcome everyone of all abilities, even if you have never even picked up a ball before.

name: Belly Dancing Society
description: The Belly Dance Society aims to teach people the beautiful art of oriental dances. It is a great workout for the entire body, as well as a fun activity and an easy way to meet new friends! Whether you're looking to try something new or fancy yourself as the next Shakira, with our fun classes and lively socials, Belly Dancing Society could be perfect for you! People of all levels and universities (as well as outside university) are welcome! Beginners' classes are on Wednesdays, 6-7pm @ Dance Studio of the Trinity Sports Centre, Cambridge St, Manchester M15 6HP (Google Maps link HERE) ***term time only***  For information about advanced and summer classes, please check our Facebook page! Only £4 per class or £15 for 5 classes   Don't hesitate to contact us:   Email: uombellydancing2014@gmail.com   Like and follow our Facebook page for the most recent updates: https://www.facebook.com/uombellydance/    For performance enquiries please contact our President Jade Ajagun-Brauns on Facebook or email: jade.ajagun-brauns@student.manchester.ac.uk

name: Bhangra
description: UoM Bhangra Society

name: Blockchainers
description: University of Manchester Blockchain Society Checkout our website: www.blockchainers.uk Despite the vast potentials that blockchain and distributed ledger technology (DLT) have in improving various sectors of life, there are still mixed levels of its understanding. This society is created to help with that issue.  Join us as Blockchainers if you want to improve your knowledge, blockchain developer skills and support for blockchain applications and ideas. There are developers who want to research, non-technical Blockchainers interested to know more about how it works, cryptocurrency investors, blockchain and DLT entrepreneurs. Everyone interested is welcome to become part of The Blockchainers, as we are all here to learn together and help each other regardless of previous knowledge and experience.   Opportunities: -Regular Block_Session ( learning session, also for chat and discussion) -Regular Tech_Session ( for developers to learn with our experienced team about blockchain ) -Regular events and workshops -Regular newsletter -We have our Blockchain_Pub on Slack to chat anytime too. Members get what they put into it, but once you become one of us, we will send out newsletter to keep you in the loop!   Become Blockchainers to be part of the first Manchester student Blockchain community and the 4th in the nation!

name: Board Games Society
description: We are a friendly and informal society for those who want to get together with friends and play social games.   The society is open to everyone, whether you are a board game enthusiast or a complete beginner we would love you to join!

name: Boxing
description: Boxing

name: Boycott, Divestment, Sanctions
description: The BDS campaign opposes anti-semitism, islamophobia and any forms of racism as strongly as we oppose the oppression of the Palestinian people. For more than 67 years, Israel has denied Palestinians their basic rights and implemented a system of apartheid and settler-colonialism over the Palestinian people. Israel has stolen land, built Jewish-only settlements, expelled Palestinians or corned them into ghettos, surrounded by walls, military watchtowers and checkpoints. Half of the Palestinian people continue to live outside Palestine as refugees, denied their right of return to their homes, simply because they aren't Jewish. Israel is only able to maintain this system of settler-colonialism and apartheid because of the international support it receives from governments and companies across the world. In 2005, the Palestinian civil society called for the international community to Boycott, Divest and Sanction (BDS) Israel as a non-violent means to pressure Israel into complying with international law and the basic principles of human rights. As students, staff, alumni and funders of the University of Manchester, we refuse to allow the university to support Israel's war crimes and to take a stand and follow their claims of "Social Responsibility". We demand that the university stands for peace, and stands in Solidarity with Palestine

name: Bright Futures Manchester
description: With branches in more than 50 universities, Bright Futures Society is an industry-leading consultancy in the fields of graduate recruitment, graduate scheme implementation, internships, on-campus engagement and improving graduate employability. The society organizes a lot of unique and useful events such as mock assessment centers, interviews, presentations, workshops, trainings, career insights and many others, which give a deeper insight into companies’ requirements to perspective employees. The main aim of Bright Futures Society Manchester is to create a better relationship between companies and students and improve students’ network and employability.  We bring together students from all faculties at the University of Manchester, catering for all degree disciplines. Bright Futures Society works closely with large recruiters such as Barclays, Ernst & Young, Accenture, Deloitte, KPMG, RBS, Rolls-Royce, TESCO, PwC, Nestle, Siemens, Vodafone, Teach First, etc. For more information about the society please email: bfmanchester.contactus@gmail.com Facebook group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/244515808993019    Facebook page: http://www.facebook.com/BrightFuturesManchester Website: http://groupspaces.com/manchesterbrightfutures    http://www.brightfutures.co.uk   Youtube channel: http://www.youtube.com/user/BrightFuturesNT

name: British Asian Society
description: Hello there! Welcome to the British Asian Society. Our goal is simple. We are a social society that seeks to bring together people of an Asian background - regardless of faith or nationality. We have three aims:  To hold great social events for our members. To provide a platform for those of Asian background, British or otherwise, to socialise with one another.  To celebrate British Asian culture, and teach it to those around us.  Either join here, follow us on Facebook, Instagram or Twitter (@britasiansocmcr), or send an e-mail to britishasiansociety@gmail.com to be added to our mailing list. We hope to see you at our events!   Peace, love and ladoo, The BAS team

name: BSc Economics Society
description: The BSc Economics Society is an academic society at the University of Manchester aimed towards students and alumni of the BSc Economics course, as well as other courses.   We aim to:   - Build a platform for our members to interact, bridge the gap between all year groups and make long lasting friendships.   - Encourage engagement in current affairs and current national and international economic discussions.   - Support and advise our members helping them to prepare for their careers and gain a competitive advantage in job market.

name: Buddhist Society
description: The aim of the Manchester University Buddhist Society is to provide an opportunity for those who wish to learn about Buddhism, however much or however little they already know. The Society is not confined to any particular school, and is interested in theoretical and practical aspects of Buddhism.  Whatever the interest everyone is very welcome! e-mail manunibuddhistsociety@gmail.com Facebook group Manchester University Buddhist Society   Throughout the academic year we offer the following activities: Meditation Sessions Weekly mediation sessions.  Venue and times vary depending on the season so please make sure to join our Facebook group here or send us an email to manunibuddhistsociety@gmail.com to add you to our mailing list.   Invited Speakers Throughout this year we will also be inviting external speakers to come to the University to give talks on Buddhism and meditation, and we will be arranging trips to different Buddhist centres, so be sure to keep your eye on our Facebook page!   Retreats and trips to Buddhist centres Trips to Buddhist centres, such as the Manchester Buddhist Centre in Northern Quarter, Manchester centre for Buddhist Meditation in Chorlton, Kwan Um Zen centre in the Peak District and more.   Greater Manchester Buddhist Convention We are involved in organising the Greater Manchester Buddhist Convention (GMBC), which will be held on Sunday 29th of September at the Manchester Buddhist Centre in Northern Quarter. This will be an interesting day of talks and classes aiming to increase the communication between different Buddhist traditions and university students. For any updates please make sure to join our Facebook group here or send us an email to manunibuddhistsociety@gmail.com to add you to our mailing list

name: Cancer Awareness in Teenagers and Young People Society (CATS)
description: CATS is dedicated to promoting awareness and early diagnosis of cancers in young people. Whether it's events, fundraisers, or talks we're here so that teenagers and young people know what signs to look for and when to go and get themselves checked, potentially saving lives. Now a Charity that is also in several other universities around the country, CATS wants all young people to know the 5 key signs of Cancer (Fatigue, Weight loss, lumps and bumps, unexplained pain and changes in a mole).  If you'd like to get involved, then get in touch at cats.manchester@gmail.com or on our Facebook page: CATS Manchester. You can get involved with us as much or as little as you like, there is no commitment.  We look forward to meeting you,  The CATS Team. www.facebook.com/CATSmanchester

name: Cheerleading with UMC
description: About us   We are the University of Manchester Cheerleaders! We love to stunt, jump, tumble and cheer on our fellow sports teams at Manchester along with competing at national level competitions. We cater for all ability levels. UMC consists of our game day squad who cheer on our fellow Manchester University sports teams (open to anyone, no auditions required) and several competition teams including all girl, co-ed (mixed gender), pom dance, urban cheer and stunt teams (try outs required).   New to cheerleading?   if you’ve never done cheer before don’t let that hold you back! Come and have a go, we know you’ll love it and there will be lots of guys and girls in the same boat as you learning the basics. Even the most skilled cheerleaders have to practice the basics of cheer so our freshers training sessions are a perfect oppertunity to learn the skills required for our try-outs in October 2018!   Cheered before?   If you’ve done cheer before then you’re in for a treat! The beauty of UMC is that we have cheerleaders of all levels. In May 2018, our Elite squad competed in a stunt group compteition ranging from levels 1-4. Our team founder and coach (who is also a qualified judge with UKCA) Kathryn Adamson and Cat Hayward are exprienced level 3, 4, 5& 6 competitors who will be sure to push your skills to the next level!   How can I get involved?   Here at UMC you can choose in what ways you’d like to be involved. For example:   - I want to be a UMC cheerleader, but I don’t want to compete   If competing isn’t your thing then not to worry. We hold monthly open practices where you can learn basic cheer skills as well as different stunts for use at displays and sports matches we cheer at.     - I’m only interested in stunting and gymnastics, I don’t want to dance or wave pom poms   Do you want to throw people in the air, learn to tumble and learn advanced stunt sequences? Then UMC Stunt team is the place for you. We focus on pushing our gymnastic skills and undertaking strength training to create jaw dropping stunts. This is not for the faint hearted - stunt team members must be fit, dedicated and strong to pull off our demanding stunt sequences!   - I want to do everything UMC related including competitions   Our competition squad, UMC Elite, holds try outs in October. We plan to compete at a minimum of three competitions throughout the academic year. If you want to further all aspects of your cheerleading skills, be part of a great team and push yourself with a bunch of like-minded people then Elites is the place for you. In addition, being a part of UMC Elites will assist you if you are interested in becoming a member of the UMC committee in 2019/20. As being involved in all aspects of club helps to build your ‘UMC CV’ ready for committee elections which take place after the Easter break.   Try out information   Try outs for our competative squads will be held in October. NO previous experience is required. The most important quality of those trying out for UMC Elite is a dedicated and positive attitude. If you’re someone who will be at every training session and will work hard, these qualities will outshine those with higher skills who are less dedicated, so come and have a go!   What will I have to do at try outs?   Only those who have joined the society and paid their membership fee will be eligible to try out for any of our competition teams. Try outs are made up of five main categories:   1) Dance   Our Choreographer and Pom Captain Erin will teach you a small section of dance at the practise sessions prior to try outs. Bear in mind the more sessions you attend, the more chances you will have to learn the dance.   2) Jumps    You will be asked to demonstrate some jumps such as a toe touch, pike and hurdler. These will be taught during our Freshers welcome sessions.   3) Motions    You will be asked to perform a short cheer so we can see your cheer motions in action. Again this will be demonstrated at sessions prior to try outs.   4) Flexibility   You will be asked to show how close you are to left, right and middle splits. You will be asked to show any other stretches you can do such as a heel stretch, scale, scorpion, bridge and bow & arrow. If you can’t do any of these it is not a problem, so don’t let this list put you off coming! You will have plenty of time to learn these skills, we just like to know the flexibility level you are currently working at.   5) Tumbling   You will be asked to perform a dive forward roll, cartwheel (one handed if you can), handstand and round off. Don’t worry if you have never done gymnastics before, we will take this into account the most important thing is that you are willing to try. Remember you will have the opportunity to learn the basics at fresher’s training. If you have other tumble skills to demonstrate we would like to see a round off back hand spring, backwards and forwards walkovers & a standing tuck back.   Most importantly just remember to enjoy yourself! Performing with a smile is a sure way to draw the judges’ attention to your performance! We have chosen people at tryouts with ZERO tumbling ability and undeveloped flexibility because their positive attitude to hard work has shone through during training sessions. Don't worry if you’ve not yet got the skills - prove you’re dedicated and you’ll be sure to make a place on the team. GOOD LUCK!    Want to know more?   Keep up to date with all things UMC on our facebook page! Just search for the University of Manchester Cheerleaders. You can also check out our website, www.purpleandproud.co.uk, twitter @umc_cheer & Instagram @umc_cheer. We look forward to hearing from you!   Cheer love, UMC Committee 2018/19 x

description: Welcome to the University of Manchester Chess Club! It doesn't matter if you are a beginner, a club level player or even a strong GM, if you want to play chess in the university, you are in the right place! Our aim is to promote chess in the university, and to play competitively against other universities.  The University of Manchester Chess Club organizes a variety of events throughout the year, including:  Weekly chess sessions Beginner lectures Simultaneous exhibitions from our top players Friendly matches against other universities Termly Rapid and Blitz tournaments  For more information please join our facebook group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/uomchessclub/

name: Children's Hospital University of Manchester Students (CHUMS)
description: C.H.U.M.S - Children's Hospital University of Manchester Students.  About Us Who are we? We are a medical student organisation who spend Wednesday evenings at the Royal Manchester Children's Hospital playing and interacting with the kids.   Our goals For the student  It will be fun! Give Medical Students hands on paediatric experience.  Improve students’ communication skills with the children/parents Students will be able to reflect on their experiences and add this to their portfolio Improves students CV  For the children  Make their time at the hospital more enjoyable Make the hospital less scary Break up their day and give them something to look forward to Give parents a break to allow them to get away Happier patient = Quicker recovery time  For the hospital  Improve patient satisfaction    Our Committee: Co-Presidents - Abbie Gartland & Laura Rico  Vice President - Tarryn Saidel  Social Media - Tess Angus  Treasurer - Sameerah Khan  Social Secretary - Ollie Biggs  Session Leads - Jake Hancock, Usman Nasir, Hannah Roberts, Michaela Vernon & Hannah Wong   Social Media: Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/CHUMSuom Instagram: @teamchums   Please don't hesitate to contact any of us if you need anything!   Alternatively, you can contact our Consultant Supervisor Dr Davis at Naomi.Davis@mft.nhs.uk   All the best, The CHUMS team

name: Chinese Christian Society
description: Manchester Chinese Christian Society (MCCS) is a student fellowship in the Manchester Chinese Christian Church (MCCC).    We are a group of Mandarin-speaking Christians from Mainland China, Macao, Hongkong, Indonesia, Singapore etc. Here we share our faith of Christianity, the mysteries of life and the truism of love. Here we also sight to enable more people to know our Savior, Jesus Christ.    In MCCS, Bible study sessions (Mandarin) will be held regularly. Different topics of talk, games, sports and other recreational activities are also held to know each other better. We are completely open to the public, no fees nor any memberships are required, and in MCCS we welcome you to join us, whether you are religious or not and it does not matter what your religious background is.   We welcome every single one of you to join us, making here a great place for you to be in Manchester.    We currently hold a regular weekly 18:30 gathering at the University of Manchester, University Place 5.206 (Subject to change) to provide a place of faith for Manchester Mandarin speaking students and academics.    Follow our WeChat public account to get updated: 曼城华人基督学社  (Pinyin: man cheng hua ren ji du xue she)

name: Chinese Students and Scholars Association
description: Chinese Students and Scholars Association in Manchester (CSSA-MAN) was established in 1982 and is a non-political, non-religious and non-profit organization, which organises, sponsors and supports various social activities among Chinese students and scholars in Manchester. CSSA-MAN is committed to developing unique and attractive programs and activities locally in Manchester. This enables Chinese students, scholars and other ethnic individuals interested in China to experience and enjoy a richer, fuller and more successful life in Manchester.

name: Chinese Studies Society
description: Welcome to the Chinese Studies Society!   Are you interested in Chinese culture?  Are you a Chinese student and would like to learn/practise English?  Are you a UK/international student and would like to learn/practise Chinese?   Our society welcomes anybody who would like to explore Chinese culture, including food, film, music and festivals! We also provide the opportunity for Chinese students to meet and socialise with students from the across the UK and all over the world. Our society includes those studying Chinese Studies at the University of Manchester, arranging study sessions and language exchange for Chinese students wanting to learn English, and other students to learn and practise Chinese!     Networking and friendships between Chinese and UK/international students   Regular socials and get-togethers to enjoy Chinese culture   Learning about China and Chinese culture   Support for those studying Chinese Studies   We look forward to seeing you soon!       Official Society Facebook Group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/UoMChineseStudies/

name: Choir And Orchestra Society (CAOS)
description: What is CAOS? The Manchester Universities' Choir And Orchestra Society (CAOS) is a social, non-audition music society that exists to provide enthusiastic musicians of all ages, genders, and backgrounds a space to come together and perform music to a good standard, simply because they enjoy singing and/or playing together. Our musicians are of a wide variety of abilities, and we welcome members at any point in the year, even if you haven't sung or played your instrument for a while!  We aim to perform two concerts per year, but we also organise a variety of social events across the year, including our hugely popular Blackpool day-trip (Semester 1) and our annual Residential weekend (Semester 2). Our rehearsals are every Tuesday during term time, and will take place at St Chrysostoms Church (4A Anson Rd, Manchester M14 5BG) at the following times:  CHOIR: 18:00 - 20:00  ORCHESTRA: 20:00 - 22:15   How do I get in touch?  - Visit our website at www.caosmanchester.co.uk  - Join the Facebook group at www.facebook.com/groups/caosmanc  - Like and follow our Facebook page at www.facebook.com/caos.manchester  - Contact the Committee on chair@caosmanchester.co.uk

name: Christian Union
description: Welcome to the University of Manchester Christian Union! What is the UOMCU? We are a group of Christian students at the University of Manchester with one aim: to give every student an opportunity to hear and respond to the message of Jesus Christ. We meet regularly on Tuesday evenings and hold events where the Christian message is explained from the Bible in a simple and approachable way. Hall groups meet every Friday all across campus and there are regular prayer meetings throughout term. How to contact us There are loads of ways to find out more about who we are and our events: Facebook - facebook.com/UoMCU Instagram - instagram.com/uomcu Website - https://uomcu.com  Email - uniofmcu@gmail.com

name: Citizens Society
description: Teaching the skills to lead winning campaigns Citizens Society is the first of its kind in any university - modelling the principles of Citizens UK, home of community organising. Community organising is democracy in action: winning victories that change lives and transform communities. It's about turning normal citizens - and normal students - into leaders, and turn the world as it is into the world as it should be. We do this by developing an understanding of how power works - and how to bring diverse communities together around clear goals and well-researched strategies, to wield people power of their own to transform the world into a more just place. This is politics without parties, this is democracy in action. Last year we won the campaign to get the University of Manchester accredited as the UK's 5000th Living Wage employer - that's right, a student campaigning society that wins! This year we have three campaigns - one focused on-campus, and two branching out into the wider community. We will also be organising training sessions so you can learn the skills to build powerful, winning campaigns. All our campaigns will be sharing a major training day on October 3rd where we will be learning how to build networks for change. Listening Campaign We are launching the University's first Listening Campaign, where we ask students what they think needs to change about our SU, the University, and around the city. This is a great networking opportunity if you're a fresher or living away from halls! #MisogynyISHate We are fighting to get GM Police, and the country at large, to recognise misogyny as hate crime. After our well-attended rally last year and our recent attendance at the national Law Commission review into hate crime, we are continuing to network with women's organisations in Manchester to build the power base for this campaign and embark on further actions. Rusholme Sponsors Refugees Our team is working with local schools, churches and residents in Rusholme to settle a refugee family in the area. Like us on Facebook

name: Cognitive Neuroscience Society
description: Are you fascinated in how the brain works? Do both psychology and neuroscience interest you?  Then CogSoc is the right place for you! Here you can discover more about the brain and the mind while meeting new people with similar interests. By becoming a member of the Cognitive Neuroscience Society you will be able to take part in a variety of social and cultural events, and get help and support throughout your time at the University of Manchester.   Join now or get in touch:       Like us on Facebook!        Send us an email (cogsocuom@gmail.com)

name: Comedy Society
description: The University of Manchester Comedy Society is for students who love comedy. Whether you are a fan, a writer, a performer or all of the above, we are the society for you. We will organise performance nights where you can show your stuff, be you a total newcomer or a seasoned veteran. We also have weekly meetings to sharpen your writing, performing or imrpov skills. If you're interested in trying your hand at some comedy, or you just fancy watching us make fools of ourselves, come along and have some fun!   Also to keep up to date with all our events, like our Facebook group! https://www.facebook.com/mucsoc Or, should you need to contact us via email we can be reached at: uomcomedysociety@gmail.com

name: Computer Science Society (CSSoc)
description: CSSoc, short for Computer Science Society, seeks to represent and provide events and socials for students of the School of Computer Science, whilst also avoiding the traditional stereotypes associated with computer science.  This is done through holding competitions and quiz nights (past prizes have included iPods, hundreds of pounds of Amazon vouchers), a no expenses spared ball (previous venues including the Hilton and the Palace Hotel) and even more events planned for the coming year!  More than that, if anyone wants to get involved and get some support running their own event they think would be of interest to our members, we are more than happy to give the support you need, be it through organisation or running it. Although we are focussed on computer science students, everybody is welcome to join in any events. We have built up some great links with graduate employers over the last few years and actively encourage informal networking sessions for those interested in careers in the computer science industry. Our current sponsor is Credit Suisse, who we manage events on campus for. We also manage the merchandise for the School of Computer Science. We're also here for those who just want to have a good time, maybe find out about some new things and generally just enjoy university life! Contact us on: info@cssoc.co.uk  Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/cssoc.man  Website: www.cssoc.co.uk  Twitter: https://twitter.com/cssoc

name: Contents Creators
description: Hey there! MUCCS (Manchester University Content Creators Society) is a place for students who are trying to accomplish something through creating content, whether that be a blog, YouTube channel, podcast, freelance writing or anything else of that nature. This can be an existing hobby/project or one you are interested in pursuing. The society aims to inform members of tips and tricks to improve marketing of their project/business (how to utilise social media). We want to help members add value to their content and connect with others also trying to accomplish something! We will run monthly meet up events and socials as well as expert talks on a range of subjects ad hoc!

name: CoppaFeel!
description: N/A

name: Crackchester
description: The one and only cyber security society at The University of Manchester. Our goal is to raise awareness on today’s security issues and focus on providing knowledge not available through any course modules. We regularly organize workshops and CTFs. For each topic, we have an introductory workshop, where everyone is welcome regardless of their information security background. For those, who want to take a deeper look at the topic, we present a second - more practical - workshop. On CTFs, we partner with several different companies to bring you a wide range of exciting InfoSec challenges and to provide the optimal hacking environment to solve them. Come for the food, stay for the fun 😉 Join our Facebook group, where we discuss information security news and issues. People with non-computer science subject backgrounds are also welcome!

name: Creative Writing
description: Enjoy writing? Or simply want to give it a try? Then join us! As a society we bring together writers to share their work, learn from others and simply have fun. We run fun workshops every Friday from 4-6pm during the semester where we write together, experiment with different styles, and have fun with writing exercises. We also try to vary our socials between a relaxed night a the pub and alcohol friendly and daytime socials too. In the past we have hosted several spoken word events which has been a great way to explore the spoken word scene in Manchester and to dip into what it means to perform and share our writing (publicly). Please contact us with ideas too as we're always open to trying new things out. Our facebook group is https://www.facebook.com/groups/454110951444006/ Our society email is cwsblogsubmissions@gmail.com See you soon!

name: Criminology Society (MUCS)
description: MUCS is the law school's Criminology society - our aim is to bring together any student studying Criminology as well as students who have an interest in the criminal justice sector. As an academic society, we aim to offer opportunities to learn new things in the field of criminology. MUCS brings in guest speakers from a range of criminological and legal areas. In recent years, we have conducted workshops with one of Wales' Chief Firearms Officers and even an ex-offender from the Strangeways Riots. This year we will strive to deliver talks that are just as engaging and interesting.   Our aim is to create a sense of community amongst Criminology, Law with Criminology and Sociology and Criminology Students. Members from all years will be invited to our socials, along with friends from other courses. This is how the social calendar for the year is looking so far:  Meet and Greet  Bar Crawls Cinema visits Christmas meals Foodie nights Charity Bake Sale Escape! event Police officer ride-along End of exams celebrations End of year meal    Membership is £1 all year and will grant you discounted access to academic talks, society events and the end of year formal. All the money received from memberships, donations, end of the year formal and other fees for events will go to a proposed Criminology linked Charity. You can propose the charity you believe is the most appropriate, and it will be added to our list.   Once you've gotten yourself signed up, be sure to stay up to date with us on social media! Facebook - www.facebook.com/MUCSpage Criminology Freshers Page - www.facebook.com/UoM-Criminology-Freshers-2017-18-128935794392194/   If you have any questions, please contact the society President or Vice President: loredana.duca@student.manchester.ac.uk ojnharman@googlemail.com

name: CrossFit Team
description: The Sport of Fitness. Strong body! Strong mind!    The University of Manchester CrossFit Team is now starting its third year and takes the place of the already established “Fit & Lift” society.    CrossFit is a sport designed to improve your health and overall fitness levels, to make you stronger, faster, and more conditioned. The sessions are based on constantly varied functional movements, usually performed at high intensity. It involves the core movements of gymnastics, weightlifting, powerlifting, running and more. This sport creates worlds fittest, but is perfect for any individual who wants to improve their own level of fitness and wellbeing, both physically and mentally. CrossFit is also brilliant accessory training for other sports, and will no doubt help you improve your performance in these areas.    We call our society a Team because of the way in which this sport helps create a sense of community, and motivate and support each other in and outside the Box (gym). However, other than just training, the CrossFit Team reflects all aspects of a University society. Our aim is to bring the community outside the gym, with socials and nights out, and to link our members to the numerous activities that the Student Union offers like climbing, hiking, sailing, surfing if people desire. Based on the number of subscriptions and if people want to, the society will also try to organize a trip during the second semester.    People of all fitness levels can benefit and enjoy these CrossFit sessions. The training sessions are scaled to each individual, and you can chose to do only what you are comfortable doing. The main aim being simply to support each other one workout at a time and to try and all get fitter together. You are free to train just to keep healthy or to compete in CrossFit events or in any other sports.    We will be trained by a qualified CrossFit coach in the CrossFit Central Manchester Gym. Lessons will be twice a week on Sunday (13:00) and Wednesday (16:00) and cost £5 per lesson pay as you go, or £35 for 8 sessions. The lesson times could be changed if it suits the majority of people.     For any doubts, do not hesitate to contact us on facebook! We would love to see you at the taster session on Wednesday! https://www.facebook.com/groups/583828551662718/   Here's a link to the gym's fb page and a little vid about CrossFit and the gym itself!  https://www.facebook.com/pages/Crossfit-Central-Manchester/43442472770   What is CrossFit?https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mlVrkiCoKkg   #GetInvolved  Thanks guys!
