name: Dance Society
description: Welcome! The Dance Society is a student run society at The University of Manchester, although we also happily welcome students from across Manchester, including Manchester Metropolitan University, RNCM and The University of Salford. We have classes for all abilities in Ballet, Tap, Jazz, Contemporary and Street. We also have intermediate and advanced teams in these styles along with Lyrical and Wildcard which compete in Nationwide Competitions, including our own (which is one of the biggest in the UK!). We also put on a Christmas and Easter show during the year, so everyone has the chance to perform! It's never too late to join, just turn up to the classes you're interested in.  Please check out our website for more information, or our social media for updates about classes and events! Website: uomdancesociety.com Facebook: The University of Manchester Dance Society   Twitter: @UoMDance Instagram: @uomdance YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/c/uomdancesociety Awards Arts & Media Society of the Year 2018/19 Arts & Media Society of the Year 2017/18 Best Event - Manchester Dance Competition 2016/17 Society of the Year 2015/16 Arts & Media Society of the Year 2015/16 Arts & Media Society of the Year 2013-2014

name: Darts Society
description: To provide a society for those who share an interest in playing darts first and foremost, and have an interest in watching darts. The society would run a couple of meetings a week for games between the society members to take place. Further-a-field, the society would play other Universities in a league format that is already up and running around the country, and would compete at the UK Universities Darts big Weekender, to try and be named the best University Darts team. When the yearly Premier League Darts comes to the Manchester Arena, the society would aim to arrange a trip to go and watch for those who wanted to attend. Above all, our society would like to arrange an event against Manchester Met University and add it to the varsity series, and hopefully make it an event which could be spectated in one of the Student Union venues.

name: Debate Mate Society
description: No description

name: Debating Union
description: Interested in foreign affairs, economics, feminism, politics or philosophy? The Manchester Debating Union is a society, which encompasses universities across Manchester.  The MDU runs competitive debate training; improving your knowledge of current affairs and gaining confidence speaking in public. We send teams to competitions across the UK, Europe and the World. Debating teaches you to look at any issue from all sides. All our training events are held in University Place at 5pm for the start of our training sessions – beginners are welcome at any time of the year!   Our membership fees vary to account for different levels of interest: -       £10 for training sessions only for a year -       £15 for training and entry to intervarsity debating competitions for a year -       £35 for training and competitions for the whole of your university course   To keep up to date on all of our events during freshers, join our group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/mdunion/ and like our facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/ManchesterDebatingUnion/?fref=ts     For any further queries contact us at: chair@mdu.manchester.ac.uk   Visit us at: Website - http://www.mdu.manchester.ac.uk/ Facebook Group - https://www.facebook.com/groups/mdunion/ Facebook Page - https://www.facebook.com/groups/mdunion/ Twitter - https://twitter.com/#!/mdunion

name: Dermatologist Soc (DermSoc)
description: No description

name: Disabled Students' Society UOM
description: Welcome to the Disabled Students' Society!    We are a group of disabled students at the university, trying to create a fun, accessible place for disabled* students to socialise, campaign and access useful information together. We plan to hold regular social and informational events throughout the year, so make sure to join and/or follow us on Facebook and Twitter. Please get involved, we're always on the lookout for new members, and definitely get in touch if you're thinking of helping us run this! We could always use more help to make things a success.  The society is open to all self-defining disabled* students, and our informational events may be open to everybody. If you want to bring a non-disabled friend to our events, that's fine, we just want to make sure we're creating a space which is accessible and safe for self-defining disabled students in particular.  We'll endeavour to make our events as accessible as possible, and make our event descriptions as thorough as possible. Please let us know if there's anything we've missed, or anything we could do better, we always want to hear from you! Disabled* = Disabled Student's Society UoM recognises the hardships around getting formally diagnosed, and so welcome self-defining disabled students, as well as those with long term mental and physical illnesses/disorders etc   Committee: Chair: Syd King (He/They) Secretary: Weronika Matczuk (She/They) Treasurer: Evelyn Sharrock (She/Her) Social Secretaries: (1) Charlotte Maxwell, (2) OPEN Publicity & Communications: (1) OPEN, (2) OPEN Campaigns & Society Fundraising: (1) OPEN, (2) OPEN Inclusions Officers: (1) Charlotte Maxwell, (2) OPEN Welfare Officers: (1) OPEN, (2) OPEN   Please contact us/ follow us at:  Email: disabledstudentsuom@gmail.com Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/DisabledStudentsUOM Facebook Group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/disabledstudentsUOM/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/uomdisabledsoc

name: DisneySociety
description: Disney Society

name: Dogs Unleashed
description: Come and join the University's most animal-loving society! Partnering with local Manchester Dogs' Home, we take our members to the centre to volunteer onsite with the charity's rescue dogs: helping to walk them and to look after their wellbeing.   We also run a number of off-site fundraising trips and trips to events run by both us and MDH.  If you're an animal lover, would like to volunteer outdoors or would like to support an amazing cause, then sign up and volunteer with us!  For more information, get in contact with us through Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/dogsunleashedatuom/) or through email (dogs.unleashedatuom@gmail.com)

name: Drama Society (UMDS)
description: Hello and welcome to the University of Manchester Drama Society (UMDS)!   We are a society that brings together student actors, writers, directors, producers and creatives to create some of Manchester's most vibrant fringe theatre. Our mission statement is to provide opportunity, diversity and inclusiveness. We offer multiple performance opportunities throughout the year, producing around 20 shows during the academic year, plus scratch nights and creative workshops.   In the first semester we have our Autumn Fringe. We welcome submissions of all kind; published plays, new writing, works-in-progress, devised work or something else entirely. Let your imagination run wild! Part of this season is the Freshers’ Play, a show comprised entirely of first years. Our second semester is our in-house fringe festival, the MIFTAs. Around eight plays are staged and judged by a selected panel, with awards presented at our annual Drama Ball. After Easter is The Shorts season where original short plays are showcased back-to-back, a great chance to try your hand at writing. Finally, the Society takes up two shows to the Edinburgh Fringe Festival every year where members have the opportunity to experience the biggest, most exciting arts festival on the planet.    Alongside these, we have a large variety of socials and fundraisers throughout the year, including HIVE, our informal scratch night, bringing you further opportunities to showcase work throughout the year.    Anyone interested in creative team roles can submit themselves to The Pool. If your application is successful, you will be allocated a show to work on that seems a good fit for you and your interests. Have no fear, however! Unsuccessful applicants first time round will be considered from the pool for future productions.    We’d love to have you join the society so please click the link above to get your membership. If you have any questions, please don't hesitate to email secretary.umds@gmail.com.    Follow/like us on social media:  Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/uomdramasoc/  Twitter: @UoMDramaSoc  Instagram: @uomdramasoc

name: Duke of Edinburgh's Award Society
description: Our society is dedicated to helping our members primarily complete the Duke of Edinburgh's Gold Award - whether you have already completed a Duke of Edinburgh's award, have already started completing your Gold Award or are looking to begin your Award journey, this will be one of the most valuable experiences you will gain throughout your time at university, using the experience in job applications to achieve your career path. We aim to inspire, guide and support students in their self-development as they volunteer, acquire new skills, engage in physical activities and complete an exhilarating expedition so as to ultimately achieve the widely recognised Duke of Edinburgh’s Award. For students who have already completed their Award, we also offer the opportunity to allow you to support other students in the completion of their award and get an experience of what it's like helping to run a DofE Award scheme. 2019/2020 Committee:  Chair: Caitlin Fotheringham Treasurer: Tia Jobbins Secretary: Josh Bugden  Inclusions Officer: Immie Davies  Get in contact with us either through our email or social media, all questions are welcome:  Society e-mail: uomdofe@gmail.com Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/University-of-Manchester-Duke-of-Edinburgh-Award-Society-108299390570915/ Facebook Group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/337824796282937/  And don't forget to join us on Facebook to keep up to date with the society!

name: Eastern African Society
description: Welcome to the University of Manchester Eastern African Society!   Our mission is to bring together Eastern Africans in the University of Manchester thus solidifying the Eastern African presence on an international platform. We hope to enrich the quality of life, promote patriotism and welfare and strengthen unity amongst members; the East African community, Swahili speaking community and friends of the Eastern African society. Additionally, we aspire to make all East Africans studying in Manchester active participants in the society. We will achieve our mission by:  Providing a forum for information sharing in the areas of culture, language, educational, economical, health, social and legal issues. Providing a forum for discussions about important issues related to our countries of origin and to promote their positive values and culture. Providing opportunities for networking and social interaction.    Our vision is to disintergrate counterproductive walls of isolation. The more people that cooperate with one another, the greater the development in worldwide technology, culture, wealth, and overall well-being. Today, to be a citizen of the world is to be open-minded toward all cultures, nations, and beliefs, a concept that is now almost a standard and is highly beneficial to the human mind. We therefore seek to unite our members and instil a virtue of togetherness between themselves and other global citizens. The core functions of our society include; organizing social activities, promoting our traditions and culture and promoting East Africa as a personal investment destination.   How do we aim to do this? In furtherance of the objectives, the society stages talent shows and competitions for the promotion of East African culture and integration in general. Additional support and focus is being given to the promotion of social activities through fundraising techniques that subsidise our operational costs such as membership fees. Our future projects wil include environmental and sustainable energy aspects such as tree planting to promote ethical awareness amongst our members to inspire service in the public interest. We will also assist in the academic purpose of being in University by organising group study sessions in the library to increase the morale of our members.   Where do we see ourselves in 3-5 years' time? As a reputable society within the Students' Union, with a wide variety of sponsors, and engaging in different outreach charity projects that can positively impact our native countries.   For more information... Find us on Facebook at http://www.facebook.com/EasocManchester Follow us on Twitter at http://twitter.com/EasocManchester

name: Ecuadorian Society
description: Welcome to the Ecuadorian Society at the University of Manchester. The Ecuadorian Society aims to bring together not only people of Ecuadorian origin, but everyone with an interest in our culture and way of life. We have lots of exciting socials, and also academic events, planned for this upcoming year. Our goal is to bring a flavour of Ecuador to you guys here in Manchester, to enable you to get an accurate image of what our country is truly like. We hope to see many of you getting involved with this new society, it will be a fun and informative experience for everyone involved.   You can find us on Facebook and keep track of our activities: https://www.facebook.com/UoMEcuadorianSociety/ If you have any queries please contact us to: ecuadoriansocietymcr@gmail.com   La University of Manchester Ecuadorian Society (UMES), es una agrupación de estudiantes Ecuatorianos a nivel universitario quienes buscan ser un referente nacional en Manchester por medio del impulso de actividades culturales. La asociación está conformada en su mayoría por estudiantes becarios cursando estudios de pre grado y post grado en distintas disciplinas. Fue fundada en agosto del 2014 por un grupo de jóvenes con inquietudes socioculturales quienes buscaban formas en las cuales se dé una vinculación entre el conocimiento adquirido en la universidad y la realidad nacional. Actualmente en el 2015 está conformado por una red de 70 estudiantes en diferentes niveles de cursada en la universidad de Manchester. Misión: Crear un espacio dentro de la sociedad Universitaria para integrar a los estudiantes Ecuatorianos fortaleciendo y promocionando espacios de nuestra identidad nacional. Visión: Ser un pilar que vincule a los estudiantes y su conocimiento a la realidad nacional por medio del desarrollo de proyectos en distintas disciplinas, logrando así reforzar y reposicionar la identidad cultural a nivel internacional. Puedes seguirnos en Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/UoMEcuadorianSociety/ Si tienes alguna pregunta sobre la sociedad puedes comunicarte con nosotros a: ecuadoriansocietymcr@gmail.com

name: Electrical and electronic engineering basketball team
description: Electrical and electronic engineering basketball team

name: Electrical and Electronic Engineering Society (EEESoc)
description: The EEESoc organises extracurricular activities for students in the University of Manchester School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering. The society aims to provide wider networking opportunities to students within the school, offering CV workshops, social events, team-building activities, company visits and sponsored presentations. EEESoc is committed to contextualise the role of Engineering and Technology in current global issues and enhance the employability of students within the school. For more information please contact: http://www.facebook.com/eeesoc

name: Emergency Medicine Society
description: No description

name: Emirati Student Society
description: Welcome to The Emirati Student Society!  We strive to remove barriers between people of different nationalities and raise awareness of the local culture, customs, and religion of the United Arab Emirates. We will be hosting various events such as the UAE national day.

name: Enactus - Entrepreneurial Action Through Us
description: Do you want the chance to gain work experience and develop your skills in an entrepreneurial way via networking with amazing global partners such as Amazon, HSBC, Visa, Asda and so many others, whilst helping people in the local community? If you answered yes, then Enactus Manchester is perfect for you! Enactus is a global student-led organisation which develops and implements social enterprise projects with the aim of giving students a chance to use their degree skills as well as their business acumen to help empower others. Enactus Manchester currently runs five projects:  Speak Up - an established social project which equips migrant parents in Manchester with English Language skills. Blossom - a social enterprise which works with refugee women to create and sell craft products.  EmpowerMEal - a social enterprise which works with marginalised women to help them create a business where they will sell healthy meals to students. Next Step - a project which will empower homeless people with the skills they need to seek employment. Innovation team - an innovation pool created by Enactus Manchester to develop new projects; this year we will be focalised on the environment and social business opportunities with international reach.  Enactus Manchester is always looking for passionate individuals to grow our projects.  Contact Us: If you are interested in joining Enactus Manchester or want to find out more about our work please email us at enactusmanchester@gmail.com or find us on Facebook (Enactus Manchester) and Instagram (@enactus_manchester).

name: Engineering: Volunteering and Outreach Society (EVO)
description: The Engineering: Volunteering and Outreach Society (EVO) is a social responsibility orientated society that runs our own outreach projects, creating and delivering engineering activities to young people in order to generate an interest in engineering. In addition, our society runs and signposts students to other volunteering projects that give you the opportunity to put their degree knowledge into practice. We aim to ‘engineer a difference’ by connecting students with the wider community to address engineering challenges and promote the study of engineering. To achieve this, we will be coordinating a student-led outreach team that will design and deliver engineering demonstrations and activities to local schools. We will also approach companies and community organisations to seek and help with any engineering challenges they face, whilst offering students the opportunity to put their knowledge and degree into practice. Please find our Facebook, Instagram and website below: Website Facebook Page Instagram

name: Engineers Without Borders
description: We are a group of engineers at the University of Manchester who are a part of a wider organisation called Engineers Without Borders-UK (EWB-UK).  EWB are a young person-led charity that focuses on removing barriers to human development through engineering. Their programmes provide opportunities for young engineers in the UK to learn about technology's role in development. By taking part in activities, and with the support of the EWB-UK community, EWB members are making a difference to people's lives around the world.  The aims of the Manchester committee are to organise outreach to local schools to promote engineering and awareness of international development issues; design and test projects; hold events, talks and research for members and to liase with the national organisation in order to work with other branches and to advertise and subsidise trips to training events across the country.  This year, EWB - Manchester are working on a wind turbine design and make project and are expanding rapidly while giving their members the opportunity to learn about and get involved with development issues. For more information... Join our Facebook group: http://www.facebook.com/groups/manchesterewb/?fref=ts Like our Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/EngineersWithoutBordersManchester If you have any questions that you can't get answered by contacting us through these ways, then drop us an email. Email: committee.manchester@ewb-uk.org

name: English Literature Society
description: To create a society for those studying/with an interest in literature that collates any literature related activity into one space. The LitSoc purpose is to inform students of all literary based activities that may be of interest, and to create a social environment where those studying at degree level are able to meet others with the same interest.

name: Esports Society
description: The Esports Society aims to promote grassroot esports in the university scene. We do this by entering our members into student only leagues such as the NUEL and NSE. We also host regular socials from casual meetups or viewing parties to bowling and other more organised events. To join our society, just click the "Join this group" button at the top of this page. Be sure to check out our Facebook group where we post our socials. As well as checking out our Discord server, discord.gg/UoMEsports, where we host tryouts and game nights.  We run tryouts for as many teams as we can create, so it doesn't matter if you're a high skilled competitive player or a more relaxed casual player there will be a team for you. The games we enter teams/players into are as follows:  League of Legends Counter Strike Global Offensive Overwatch Rainbow Six Siege Dota 2 Rocket League Hearthstone Magic the Gathering Arena Team Fight Tactics FIFA Battle Royales (PUBG, Fortnite etc.) Fighting Games (SSU, Tekken, MK11 etc.)

name: Estonian Society
description: To provide all Estonian nationals and their friends at the University of Manchester with a means of staying connected and socialising to celebrate Estonian holidays. Information about upcoming events can be found on our Facebook group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/650287981800741/ ; or our Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/EstonianSociety/?fref=ts   Big thanks to our sponsors of previous years:   Leibur    Olde Hansa    Audiitorteenuse OÜ    DHL Estonia

name: European Union of Women University of Manchester
description: European Union of Women University of Manchester     Make friends, have an active campus life, and help us raise money for Women's Aid Manchester! From bakesales and coffee mornings, to bar crawls and parties, you can help us in our efforts to fundraise for Women's Aid.

name: Expenses approval group
description: This is a specific group of people who can approve exepenses through the Student Expenses app.

name: Feminist Collective
description: At the Feminist Collective, we believe in the social, political and economic equality of all, REGARDLESS OF GENDER. As a society, we work to create networking opportunities for likeminded people; open up discussions around gender and politics in a range of fields; provide education around intersectional feminism; and campaign for a campus that is inclusive of people of all genders.  Importatntly, our society is an inclusive, intersectional one. No discrimination or harassment of any sort will be tolerated. Our events and our spaces are open and welcoming to trans people, people of colour, and sex workers.

name: Filipino Society
description: If you love Filipino culture, or are just plain curious as to what the Philippines is all about, come join Filipino Society!   What do we do?   We spread the word about the rich cultural heritage of the Filipino people through countless cultural events and gatherings - cooking lessons to make your own delicious Filipino food, trips to the events exported from those far away Philippine shores such as the famous Barrio Fiesta, film nights showcasing our greatest actors (their passion is intoxicating), conversational Tagalog (Filipino) lessons, Karaoke and much more! And, most importantly, you don't have to be Filipino to join in the fun!        Also join our facebook page!  https://www.facebook.com/groups/200577313410107/ Any questions? Email minty.domingo@gmail.com or message 'UoM Filipinos' on facebook

name: Filmmaking Society
description: UoM Filmmaking Society exists to provide a platform for aspiring filmmakers attending the university - be it a continuation of a long-term hobby or a first time interest - to meet, exchange ideas and create their own cinematic productions. The society aims to provide the means for groups of like-minded filmmakers to work together collaboratively, without a mandate beyond their own creative aspirations, by providing them with the necessary equipment, organisation and oversight to bring teams of people together to help actualise their creative vision. Taking submissions for original briefs/full scripts for 10-15 minute shorts at the beginning and end of Semester 1, the society selects 2 successful pitches per semester to produce and represent the society and university as a whole, and aims to take these projects through the stages of pre production, filming and post production, to be screened in a showcase at the end of the academic year. These films will be permanently showcased online through our YouTube channel, will be attachable to the portfolios of everyone involved, with respect to their role in the production, and eventually offered up for competition/festival submission by using the channels available to the society. Full accreditation will go to the creatives involved. Though the society can only commission 4 films per year to provide assistance with in production, all members of the society will be encouraged to get involved in the various roles associated with a real film project, and everyone involved will be officially credited. Producing these films will take us to various interesting locations and the opportunity for trips outside of the university will provides a unique social aspect. Outside of the main production activities, the society aims to communicate with eminent guest speakers to deliver lectures at various points throughout the academic year, organise diverse society socials like weekly film nights, and forge links with other university societies that tie in with film, such as the University's Music Society, in order to enhance the quality of our final productions. We hope that the society will provide exciting and varied activities for members throughout the year, as well as ultimately connecting each individual with the wider community of filmmakers and creatives present at the university.

name: First Love Society
description: First Love is a Christian faith society with the motto 'Love God, Love others'.  We offer an open and lively environment to explore Christian faith through our activities and the opportunity to meet like-minded students.  We are proud to be part of the First Love Churches network, an established and expansive network across the UK and internationally. This facilitates valuable socialising and development opportunities.        Activities We hold weekly meetings and a number of events throughout the year where students are challenged by biblically-based readings and discussions. Our meetings and events are open to all students, irrespective of faith or background. Our student members have opportunities to participate and actively use their talents in the society, such as by joining our music, choir, or dance groups, with the chance to perform in our meetings, at term events and at larger scale gatherings within the wider First Love network. We also aim to develop the leadership skills of our members.                  Events We value meeting together and sharing what we believe with others. Hence, our events aim to promote our society and make Christianity more accessible and relevant to the student community. These include outdoor community carnivals which have been successfully held in several major cities across the UK including London, Birmingham and Coventry. Other events include black tie balls, summer camps and Christmas and Easter holiday gatherings.  Social Media Keep up to date with us on Instagram and Twitter! Our events/meetings times and locations are regularly posted on these pages.  firstlovemanchester  instagram.com/firstlovemanchester/    @firstlovemcr  twitter.com/firstlovemcr                     We look forward to seeing you at one of our events or meetings!

name: Flight Simulation Society
description: Flight Simulation Society (FSS) is an exciting, Student-run engineering society, catering for all students, not just those interested in flying. It offers students the opportunity to design an aircraft from scratch and experience piloting their custom aircraft using a full motion flight simulator. The society also offers the opportunity for some of the members to take their design to the US and UK IT Flies competitions run by MERLIN flight simulation, to get a taste of what projects other universities and students design.  The Society also has a flight simulator building sector that shows members the building blocks of flight simulator design and allows them to help with the creation process and make simulators that the society use themselves. As well as hosting weekly socials to kick back and relax.

name: Francophone Society (French)
description: The Francophone Society reunites francophone students from across the world as well as students who are simply interested in the French language and cultures. Our aim is to provide an environment in which members can meet, develop friendships and enjoy the different cultures surrounding the French language. We organise the following activities:  French classes (beginner, intermediate and advanced) French discussion groups Cheese & wine nights Raclette evenings Crepes Film screenings Themed socials, bar crawls...  If you are interested in classes, e-mail us on manchesterfrancophone@gmail.com with the level you would like / your French study background and we will try to find a space for you, upon availability. Classes are rather informal, however we ask you to commit to them. They are capped to a maximum of seven students per group, so they should always fit in with your other commitments. The £3 annual membership gives you discounted entry to all our paid events as well as free classes for a year! Contact us:  E-mail on manchesterfrancophone@gmail.com       Join us on https://www.facebook.com/UoMfrancSoc/?ref=aymt_homepage_panel

name: Friends of David Nott Foundation
description: Friends of the David Nott Foundation We are a new student society at the University of Manchester, raising awareness of and fundraising for the David Nott Foundation. The David Nott Foundation was established in 2015 with the aim of educating surgeons and medical professionals with the skills to provide relief and assistance in conflict and natural disaster zones around the world. Through education, these surgeons can then teach others and improve both local healthcare and medical education in countries where need is most acute. We will be raising awareness of the work of the Foundation at the university and fundraising for them. The money raised goes towards teaching surgeons, many being from countries affected by conflict around the world. The teaching is done in two ways: firstly in London, at the Surgical Training for Austere Environments (STAE) course that David Nott teaches at the Royal College of Surgeons of England.   ‘Scholars are chosen for their commitment to humanitarian surgery and priority is given to those from resource-poor or conflict-afflicted regions. We pay for their course fee, travel, visas, accommodation and sustenance when they are in the UK.’ (David Nott Foundation).   The teaching is also taken out around the world with the Hostile Environment Surgical Training (HEST) course - ‘We have held three courses in Gaziantep, Turkey, for Syrian surgeons, doctors and midwives. We have also held courses in Yemen, Palestine, Iraq, Libya and Lebanon.’   We are an independent student group, not the David Nott Foundation themselves, however are working with the David Nott Foundation directly to raise awareness of their work amongst university students and hopefully help train even more doctors.   Follow us! Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/fdnfmanchester/ Instagram - @fdnfmanchester Twitter - @fdnfmanchester

name: Friends of Medecins Sans Frontieres (MSF)
description: Friends of MSF aims to raise both awareness and funds for the work Medecins Sans Frontieres carry out and to provide info for those interested in working for MSF. Open to everyone interested in humanitarian aid- you don't have to be a medic to be part of our society. In the past our events have consisted of film showings, fashion shows, fun runs and bake sales and we are always open to new ideas!  Email: msfmanchester@hotmail.co.uk Or visit the MSF website for more information: http://www.msf.org.uk/

name: Fuse FM
description: Fuse FM is Manchester University's student radio station. We first went on air back in 2001, and 13 years later we now broadcast from a brand new, professional quality studio from within the Students' Union. We broadcast online throughout the academic year and you can listen to live shows and podcasts on our website. We love our new home, but we need your help to sound great on air. If you want to get in on the action, you'd be more than welcome! We are constantly on the look out for new talent, so if you fancy yourself as a music journalist, producer, DJ, news reader, or think you have what it takes to host your own show, Fuse FM is certainly the place for you! Not only is Fuse FM a fun organisation to be part of, but we can help you if you are interested in getting into the radio industry. Past Fuse FM members have gone on to find work at the BBC and commercial radio stations.   Interested? You can look out for our stall at the Welcome Fair or send an email to stationmanager@fusefm.co.uk if you want to find out more.   Visit us at: Facebook- facebook.com/fusefmmanchester Twitter- @fusefm website- www.fusefm.co.uk

name: Fuse TV
description: No description

name: Gaming Society
description: As a society, our aim is to unite the gamers of Manchester and provide them with a free forum to play and discuss all manner of videogames together. Since our inception, the society has arranged tournaments, console nights, and many more socials including film nights, Laser Questing, Pub Quizzes, and Pub Crawls. We are open to people who play video games both casually and competitively and we provide both the consoles and games where we can, keeping as many events as possible free to our members. We also have many of our members bring their own handheld consoles. Our most popular events are our famous free Console Nights, usually in the Student’s Union, where we set up several consoles with a variety of multi-player games for anybody to grab a controller and start playing.  Our society is free to join. For more information on our upcoming events follow us on: https://www.facebook.com/UoMGamingSoc/ https://www.facebook.com/groups/UoMGamingSociety https://twitter.com/UoMGamingSoc https://www.instagram.com/uomgaming/ https://discord.gg/MSdr2QP www.steamcommunity.com/groups/gamingsociety

name: GEMS (Geology and Environment for Manchester Students)
description: Bringing together the students in the SEES department.  Creating events for Geology and Environmental Science students.

name: General Practice Society (GPSoc)
description: The General Practice Society in collaboration with the Royal College of General Practitioners (RCGP) and Manchester medical school, work to promote general practice as part of RCGP's national scheme. This means we can use the college’s network to bring to you the best associated with the speciality.   The need for medical students to be interested in general practice cannot be emphasised enough. A latest report in June 2014 by ‘Pulsetoday’ revealed that the number of GPs are down by 3% since 2009. Another report by them quoted that the number of medical students wanting to be GPs in 2013 was just 28% whereas 50% of registrar posts are for GP training.  We aim to remove the stigmas surrounding general practice and rectify this as a back-up career mentality. Not only do we want to attract more students towards the speciality but we also want to provide a platform for students who are currently interested in the speciality to get the best careers advice and have their questions answered.   Some of the proposed ideas for events include, but not limited to: inviting GPs with a special interest to talk through how they got to where they are and what their job entails, inviting GPs to talk through the implementation of the health and social care act 2012 and the role of the clinical commissioning groups as this remains a mystery for a lot of medical students. We also hope to put on some more interactive sessions such as discussions regarding ethical dilemmas faced by GPs in daily practice or NHS budget management.  We have a very enthusiastic committee excited for the year ahead, we look forward to seeing you at our events!

description: An essential part of the Geographical community as Manchester, MUGS aims to bring together Geographers from across the year groups to socialise and learn with events ranging from nights out and fundraisers, along with interesting speakers from across the world and 3 different sports teams- Football, Hockey and Netball. Come join us, in one of the oldest societies in Manchester, with a legacy behind it, and become part of the geographical community. Events running this year:  Charity quiz night GloBall, our annual black-tie event with a three-course  Lecturer research talks and departmental seminars Fortnightly socials Volunteering Royal Geographical Society Geography Ambassador scheme Mapathon, a humanitarian mapping programme. First year X Lecture meet and greet Netball, Hockey and Football teams Debates And so much much more!  Remember to check us out on social media to keep up to date with all things MUGS, UoM and Geography: Facebook: MUGS (@mugs1892) Twitter: @MUGS_1892 Instagram: @mugs1892 We can’t wait to have you on board as fellow MUGS this year!

name: Get Crafty For Charity
description: Are you interested in arts and crafts? Do you want to de-stress on a Wednesday afternoon? Then come along to one of our events! Our society hosts a range of sessions - clay sculpting, hama beads, painting, knitting etc. every two weeks in the Students' Union. We're also open to new ideas so feel free to give us suggestions! It is completely free to become a member and you can choose to go to whichever sessions you want. We will provide all the materials and if you dont know how to make crafts, we can teach you! Our society also takes part in the Newlife Foundation's Get Crafty Volunteer Programme, which involves raising money in fun and crafty ways for Newlife Foundation, a charity that supports disabled and terminally-ill children. If you would like to know more about our society and our upcoming sessions, join our Facebook group below: Facebook group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/UoMGetCraftyForCharity/ Twitter: @GCraftyCharity Instagram: @getcraftyforcharity Email address: uomgetcraftyforcharity@gmail.com

name: Gilbert & Sullivan Society (MUGSS)
description: MUGSS is one of the largest and most vibrant student musical theatre societies in the country. We sing, we dance, we act, we build our own set and do all of our own behind the scenes crew work. Every year we put on a Gilbert and Sullivan show in a real theatre, as well as a modern musical, giving both crew and performers the opportunity to work in a professional-level environment. In December this year we will be performing Jasper in Deadland and in Semester 2 we will be returning to our G&S roots with a performance of the Sorcerer. We welcome all levels of ability, talent and past experience, and guarantee all our members a place in the chorus, no audition necessary! We also have our own crew who create everything from sets to costumes and welcome anybody, especially if you've never done anything like this before. Rehearsals for our winter show take place on Wednesday evenings and at the weekend (keep an eye on our Website and our Facebook page) and anyone is more than welcome to give it a go. For those interested in becoming part of the crew, our more experienced members will be able to give guidance in set-building, costume and prop creation, stage-managing, and the many other jobs involved in producing a show. Again, you don't need any previous experience! We are a very sociable, open and diverse group of people and we warmly welcome anyone who wants to come and be involved, whether you want to get stuck straight in and get involved with putting on our shows, or even if you just want to socialise and come along to see what we are all about. For more information, please visit: Our website: www.mugss.org Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/mugss.shows/ Twitter http://twitter.com/mugss Email: committee@mugss.org / chair@mugss.org

As students of healthcare courses ourselves, we noticed that we do not often mix with students of other related courses, and we are therefore often not clear of other roles in the healthcare team.This uncertainty then carries on to the wards and leads to segregation and barriers in communication, which may prove harmful for our patients. We plan to generate socialising and learning together as a multidisciplinary team!  Thank you for joining us and help us bring together all healthcare students! We will e-mail you with updates about upcoming events throughout the year and other ways you can get involved with HEAL!   See you all soon!     Please also join us on facebook and twitter  https://www.facebook.com/groups/UoMHEAL/  https://twitter.com/UoMHEAL

A great way to keep fit, meet interesting people and visit beautiful parts of the country. Our trips are designed to have hikes for all abilities, so don’t worry about not being to keep up, whether you want to go up a gentle lakeside hill or scramble up an exposed Scottish peak. We also have a huge variety of weekly social events, plus our hikes and socials nearly always finish up in the pub!   Feel free to come along just once or twice, or join us every week if you want! You will find us in the Hive, upstairs in the SU, weekdays from 12:30 to 1:30 pm Monday to Friday in term-time. As well as the fun stuff, we organise careers events in order to assist people with making career choices and offer advice be it with their essays or module choices. We are happy to help with all aspects of university life for History students at Manchester.  To get involved with the society all you need to do is join our Facebook group (University of Manchester History Society) where we will be posting all the information you need about upcoming events. You can also follow us on Twitter (@UOMHistSoc), Instagram (uomhistsoc) or contact albert.jennings@student.manchester.ac.uk by e-mail.

name: Homeless Healthcare Society
description: The Homeless Healthcare Society is a student-led group at The University of Manchester. We are seeking to improve the care received by some of society’s most marginalised groups, particularly individuals experiencing homelessness. We are achieving this via three key steps.   Understand: Lectures and workshops delivered by experts working in these fields, such as support workers, healthcare staff and charities. Previous topics have been cases in homeless health, synthetic cannabinoids (Spice) and healthcare of sex workers.   Engage: We help direct students to volunteering opportunities, thus gaining useful hands on experience. This includes assisting a nurse-led clinic at a local homeless drop-in centre, but also directing people to the numerous other voluntary services in Manchester.   Improve: We are trying to change attitudes towards homelessness for all current and future healthcare staff. This includes awareness of patients’ rights to accessing care (no address needed for GP registration!) and the complex needs of these patients   If you would like to get involved, follow our Facebook page or email homeless.health.soc@gmail.com

name: Hyperloop Manchester
description: What is Hyperloop? The Hyperloop is a proposed high-speed transportation system in which specialized pods are accelerated through a low-pressure tube to achieve speeds near the speed of sound. The system is intended to provide a more cost-effective and faster mode of travel between cities separated by distances less than approximately nine hundred miles. First conceptualized in 2012 by Elon Musk, the tech entrepreneur leading numerous high-profile companies including SpaceX and Tesla Motors, hypothetical benefits of the Hyperloop include immunity to weather, lack of crashes, rapid speed, low power requirements, and energy generation for its operation.   The theoretical transportation system we call Hyperloop would transport people-filled pods or cargo-filled pods over long distances through steel tubes. Magnetic levitation and big vacuum pumps would do away with pesky friction and air resistance, letting those bus-sized vehicles zip along at speeds. It wouldn’t just be fast, Hyperloop could be cheaper and better for the environment than the planes, trains, and cars.   Three variations of the exterior design are currently being explored for vehicle pods. One pod design uses air bearings; this design relies on a system to create a bed of air for the pod to glide upon and is the basis of Elon Musk’s original Hyperloop idea. Another pod design uses magnetic levitation; this design was used by the winner of the “Best Overall Design Award”. The third design uses high-speed wheels for speeds under 100 mph and air bearings for higher speeds     Info about the Competition? The SpaceX tube track, enclosing an almost total vacuum, will eliminate air resistance. Sophisticated electronics and programming have been designed to ensure a stable ride. SpaceX announced the Hyperloop Pod Competition in 2015. The competition’s goal is to support the development of functional prototypes and encourage innovation by challenging student teams to design and build the best high-speed Pod. The first three competitions were held on January 2017, August 2017, and July 2018, and were the first of their kind anywhere in the world.   How to recruit students to our team? There will be an online registration form demanding students’ major, interests in Hyperloop, and their resume. Also, an interview will be made with candidate students.   Schools that we prioritize for application: MACE, Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Physics, Computer Science and Software Engineering, Business and Management, Industrial Design   How many students would compete in the team? Our team will be up to 40 team members. Hyperloop teams don’t include many people. The team will be divided into sub-teams.   What funding would we need? Business and management sub-team is responsible to find appropriate sponsorships and funding. We mainly expect to be funded from the University and sponsors.   The purpose? As the UoM students, we want to contribute our ideas by building a small-scaled Hyperloop model and highlight the name of the UoM in this important project. To do so, we would like to compete in the Hyperloop Competitions.   Contact: E-mail: hyperloopmanchester@gmail.com hyperloopmanchester@outlook.com Website: https://www.hyperloopmanchester.com/ LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/hyperloop-manchester Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/groups/479330085952236/

name: Indian Dance Society
description: Ever wanted to dance to some Indian Tunes? Well now you can!   The main aim of our society is to give the students of Manchester the opportunity to learn different Indian dance forms. We will hold weekly lessons for 2 different dance styles: INDIAN CLASSICAL DANCE (Bharathanatyam) and BOLLYWOOD/BHANGRA, which are both suitable for all abilities! The society has won the "BEST ARTS AND MEDIA AWARD 2014-15" and was also nominated in this category in the year 2013-14, which was the year IDS was formed!  Our society is open to everyone who enjoys dancing! Students from other Universities are welcome too!    For more info and any questions: Facebook - facebook.com/IndianDanceSocietyUoM  Gmail- indiandancesociety@gmail.com Youtube - youtube.com/IndianDanceSociety Instagram - @idsuom

name: Indian Society of Manchester
description: The Indian Society of Manchester is a voluntary, non-profit purely student-led organisation, registered with the University of Manchester Student’s Union. It was founded over a decade ago, and serves to promote the extravagantly rich Indian culture and heritage, and promulgate the essence of India within Manchester in order to build and sustain a community.  The society aims to endorse the intricate beauties of the diverse Indian culture amongst people of from all ethnic backgrounds. It strives to highlight the growth of India and it’s influence in the political, economic and social arenas at a global level and inculcate a feeling of pride, patriotism and affection for India and Indians within the University.      It was nominated for Best Society – Cultural & Faith for four consecutive years at the Students’ Union Awards in 2014, 2015, 2016 and 2017 along with nominations for India Week and Diwali Mela in Best Events in 2014, 2015 and 2016 respectively.  The society organises up to 20 events in a year, ranging from festival celebrations, cultural evenings, fundraising and charity events, sports tournaments, Bollywood club nights, social activities and educational events.  There are some things about home you can't do without, for everything else there's the Indian Society of Manchester!            This society is the perpetual sustainment of our innocuous dream, and we want everyone to be a part of this dream.             For more information please visit our website:  www.indiansocmcr.com   or contact us via  Email: indsocmcr@gmail.com Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/IndianSocMcr Snapchat: indiansocmcr Twitter: @IndianSocMCR Instagram: @indiansocmcr

description: Inline Skating Society! Do you skate or wanna learn? Ever heard of aggressive inline skating? Did you know that Manchester is home to some of the UK's best current rollerbladers? We'll also be chillin' and watch some VODs so give our facebook a follow to keep in the loop. If you've got any questions or wanna chat hit up our facebook :)  https://www.facebook.com/UMRS-University-of-Manchester-Rollerblading-Society-121684969219601/

name: Insightful Students
description: Manchester has a thriving research community from all academic disciplines- why not make the most of it by joining Insightful Students.  If you like taking part in research projects or want to promote your own research, this is the group for you.  Join up to get newsletters about upcoming surveys, focus groups, creative workshops and more.   Plus there are usually some brilliant freebies and prizes on offer for taking part. This group is organised by The University of Manchester Research & Insight Team.  We carry out research with the student community to make sure that the big decisions affecting student life in Manchester are better informed.  Current and upcoming projects: Student Life Survey  - £50 Trafford Centre or Amazon voucher prize draw, approx 10 minutes to complete, by Manchester SU Rate Your Landlord - £50 IKEA or Amazon voucher prize draw, 10 minutes to complete, by Manchester SU Student Faith Survey - coming soon Curriculum Diversity Survey - coming soon

We love to create events for all students to socialise and interact with each whilst having fun. From eating, drinking to even creating useful workshops for your future career paths - we want to create a community of support for everyone!

name: Islamic Society (ISoc)
description: • The Islamic Society is a student run welfare organization. It is responsible for providing services for students (both Muslims and Non-Muslims) and aids to improve the image of Islamic cohesion on campus. • The Islamic Society is dedicated in helping Muslims and Non Muslims on campus to develop academically, spiritually and socially. ; • The Islamic Society provides the social psychology and wherewithal for students to benefit themselves, the community, both nationally and globally in every sphere in life. • Furthermore, the Islamic Society is there to help promote a true understanding of Islam and Muslims on campus and in the wider community. This is achieved by creating an environment that would facilitate dialogue, mutual understanding and respect. • The Islamic Society endeavours to facilitate for the spiritual needs of all Muslim Students on Campus   For more information: manchesterisoc.com/contact   Join us!     Join Mailing list: http://www.manchesterisoc.com/join Facebook: www.facebook.com/manchesterisoc Twitter: www.twitter.com/manchesterisoc

name: Italian Society
description: The Society is formed by Italians studying at the Manchester University, Erasmus students coming from Italian Universities, English and international students belonging to the Italian Language Department and all those people within the University interested in the Italian culture, traditions and costumes.   The main aims of the Society are directed to promote and divulgate the best sides of Italy towards all the students of the University, as well as creating a small community of young Italians sharing the vibrant experience of living and studying in a different country. Thanks to the great enthusiasm built around this Society, we are able to offer many events during the entire Academic Year. We organise aperitivos during which both Italians and non Italians can chat and enjoy some quality food and drinks, movie nights where we show Italian movies with English subtitles so that everyone can understand, and nights out of various sorts (we often end up going to international parties!). We are also planning a Pizza Masterclass where real Italian pizzaiolos will teach us their art, and maybe an Aperol Spritz masterclass. On a more academic side, we run weekly Italian lessons for both beginners and more advanced learners; this is a great opportunity for anyone who is interested in learning more about our language and our culture, in a friendly and informal environment.    To keep in touch, do not hesitate to Contact us by email: italiansocietyman@gmail.com Join our Facebook group: University of Manchester Italian Society 2019/20 Follow us on Instagram: @italiansocietymanchester

We organise regular events such as pub social, clubbing, language exchange, Japanese lessons, etc. We also organise some Japanese seasonal events. name: Jewish Society
description: To provide a quality Jewish experience for every Jewish student on campus, regardless of affiliation. To provide social, educational, cultural and religious events and activities throughout the year. To be proactive and lead the way in volunteering and raising money for a variety of different charities.  To help students combat anti-semitism on campus.  To give students the chance to lead a society themselves and play a large part in the running of their Jewish society.   For more information please contact : Email - president@manchesterjsoc.com  Facebook - http://www.facebook.com/ManchesterJSOC  Twitter - http://www.twitter.com/manchesterjsoc  Website - www.manchesterjsoc.com

name: Just Love Manchester
description: Just Love exists to inspire and release every Christian student to pursue the Biblical call to social justice. Throughout the Bible we see thousands of verses speaking of God's heart for the poor and vulnerable. What if we saw an end to human trafficking? What if there were no more rough sleepers? What if Christian students were known for their outrageous generosity?  We meet to pray, learn about the theology of justice, fundraise for amazing causes, campaign against issues of injustice, and volunteer in our local community. JLM is led by a committee of students but the vision extends our family across each church and university in Manchester. Key events:  - Fortnightly prayer gatherings, Thursdays (7-9pm) @ various locations.  - Every Wednesday afternoon we go out into the local community and volunteer together e.g. at Barnabus with the homeless.  - We host one off events e.g. pub quizzes, acoustic nights, guest speakers.

name: Kabaddi Club
description: Manchester Kabaddi Club allows anyone to enjoy and get involved with the sport of Kabaddi.   We are open to everyone regardless of ability. We look to create a society which brings people together and helps strengthen all their abilities and improve weaknesses. It is also an opportunity for members of the club to take part in friendly competitions against other clubs from different Universities.

name: Kickboxing Society
description: Learn kickboxing, fitness and self defence, and gain confidence from the WKC Great Britain Coach. Our aims: To promote healthy lifestyle, teach about the martial arts and the philosophy behind them, train both body and mind. Create a friendly and supportive environment for people coming to sessions to be fit and healthy as well as to have fun. Provide opportunities for students to grade for belts several times a year.   Activities we take part in: Focus mitts and kicking pads are used in boxing and kicking drills to provide target but keep everyone safe. The sessions usually start with a warm up containing different cardio exercises, sit ups, push ups and other activities. These are followed by boxing drills and/or kicking drills. The content of the sessions vary, but usually follow this structure

We welcome anyone and everyone - we are here to unite K-pop fans through events and dance!   Make sure to like us on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/uomkpopsoc/ to check out more about our events...

name: Kurdish Society
