We want to bring kurds and non kurds from all backgrounds together to interact and appreciate our kurdish culture.  For information and updates about upcoming events follow our Facebook page @mcrkurdsoc and Instagram @manchesterkurdishsociety

name: Kuwait Society
description: Kuwait Society  Twitter / Instagram | @KW_UoM  Call/WhatsApp: +44 7380 375135 E-mail: k_uom@outlook.com   Our Services: - Introduction of Kuwaiti culture and heritage.  - Maintaining a sense of community to those studying abroad.  - Providing support to Kuwaiti students on issues that may be culturally sensitive.  - Accommodation advice and support.  - Arranging academic and social events as part of a peer-mentoring system to support performance in university. Examples of such events may include: trips, workshops, talks, study groups, and competitions in science, sport, and art. Additionally, gatherings may be set up for meals, celebrations, and religious observances by demand.  - Easing the transition/cultural shock for freshers.  - Organise volunteering opportunities.  - Enable and encourage students to have an active role in the university in addition to collaborating with other societies and organisations to achieve this.  - The society will consist of representatives of each course/faculty to our best ability.  - Provide a bridge of communication with the Kuwait Embassy and Cultural Office in regards to any concerns or support.   Membership benefits: - Discounts on all events by the Kuwait Society. - 15% exclusive membership discount at Al-Safa restaurant. - 10% exclusive membership discount at Ariyadh restaurant. - 10% exclusive membership discount at Beirut restaurant. - 10% exclusive membership discount at Ariana restaurant. - 10% exclusive membership discount at Olivita restaurant. - 10% exclusive membership discount at Al Taiba Bukhari restaurant. - 10% exclusive membership discount at Caspian restaurant. - 10% exclusive membership discount at Mail Boxes ETC. - 10% exclusive membership discount at Sweet & Salt nuts. - 5% exclusive membership discount at Islamic Life Shop. - Priority tickets for any limited seats events or trips.  You will be informed a week before an event is announced on social media to everyone else. **The Society is currently working on so many more advantages and exclusive discounts for our members. You will be informed of any new updates as soon as they are confirmed. To benefit from your exclusive discounts you will have to present the official Kuwait Society member card to the restaurant when paying the bill or to the Kuwait Society when booking a ticket for an event.

name: Labour Students
description: Manchester Labour Students (MLS) is the biggest Labour Students club in the country, and one of the biggest, and most exciting student party political organisations in Britain. Throughout the year we campaign, both on campus for issues concerning students, faculty, and employees of the University, as well as in the wider city of Manchester, the North West, the rest of the country, and even trips to help our sister parties win abroad. We host interesting speakers, ranging from front bench politicians to local community activists.   Contact: Sarah Cundy, Co-Sec of Manchester Labour Students (manclabstudents@gmail.com)

name: Latin American Society
description: Welcome to the Latin American Society at the University of Manchester!   La.Society hopes to become a welcome space for those students from all the different Latin American countries who might feel a bit isolated and might not seem to find people who share their same customs and interests, for those who might be having the time of their lives but would love to celebrate and exhibit their traditions, and for those who are interested in being part of this cultural exchange. Beyond becoming a big family in which anyone who would like to join will be accepted as a valued member, our society aims at becoming a network of Latin American students that create a space of linkage between the knowledge acquired at the university and the reality of Latin America. And not only a network of students, but also including Latin American members of the Manchester community. This year, we are glad to partner with EntreMundos, a Guatemalan NGO focused on the strengthening of local communities and the promotion of Human Rights and development on a national level (www.entremundos.org). If you're interested in volunteering with them, collaborating in our fundraising events and/or volunteering as a translator for their magazine (Spanish to English), send us a message on our Facebook page and we will give you more information.   You can enjoy discounts from our partners, once you get your la.society membership card:      All our activities are FREE for our members, but some of them will have a symbolic fee for non-members. Latin Party at Bliss - every Saturday (https://www.facebook.com/events/178968432835397/)  If you show your la.society membership card at the entrance of Bliss before 12am, you get free entry. If you do so before 1am, you get £1 off of your entry. Salsa Social MCR - every Wednesday (https://www.facebook.com/groups/1560842854143609/)  If you show your la.society membership card at the entrance, you get a 50% in your entry (usually £5 - £2.50 for our members) Bachatéame - Sunday (once a month) (https://www.facebook.com/events/263185734403342/)  If you show your la.society membership card at the entrance, you get £2 off (usually  £5 - £3 for our members) YTS Latin Dances Manchester (https://www.facebook.com/YTS.LatinDances.Mcr/)  All our events with this company are FREE for members.  YTS classes (including the socials afterwards) have a  £2 discount for members (usually  £8 -  £6 for our members).  If you only want to go to the socials, you get £1 off of your entry with la.society card (usually  £3 - £2 for our members) Discounts on Smile Adventures trips (https://www.facebook.com/smileadventuresuk/)  Every trip has different discounts subject to availability. We will be publishing them on our Facebook page. Our you can send us (or them) a message asking for any promotions on upcoming trips.     If you are willing to have the time of your life here at Manchester, the Latin American Society is an amazing opportunity you definitely cannot miss!   For more information: Find us on Facebook at - https://www.facebook.com/LASocietyManchester/ Follow us on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/lasociety_uom  Email us at - societylatinamerican@gmail.com

name: Lebanese Society
description: The Society is run by Lebanese people studying at the University of Manchester, and has members from countries all over the world who come together to share the rich and diverse culture of our beautiful country. Our aim is to promote the traditions, know-how and history of Lebanon through events which bring people together as a community. We want Lebanese people to have a sense of "home away from home" and non-Lebanese people to discover a festive way of life that is proper to us! Our events happen on a regular basis during the academic year. Don't miss our iconic Hummus Festival in March. And for the second year now we are organising a Lebanese Wine Tasting event (Wednesday 18th March - link on the society page) open to everyone - we hope to see you there!   If you have questions or just fancy getting in touch Email us : camillelorfing.lebsoc@gmail.com Check us out on Facebook (all the events are there): www.facebook.com/lebsoc.uom/

name: LGBTQ Society
description: Welcome to the Official University of Manchester LGBTQ Society's Webpage 🏳️‍🌈   Thank you for taking an interest in our society! Manchester has had a long timeline of LGBTQ+ history and is famous for its LGBTQ+ activism, nightlife and other social events! We as a society aim to support all LGBTQ+ students at university. Whether you would like to meet new LGBTQ+ people, get advice and support or volunteer, we can help and direct you with all of this and more!  We welcome all those that identify under the LGBTQ+ spectrum as well as allies. You are more than welcome to come if you feel like you don’t (or don’t want to) identify under a specific label – just be yourself!   Many students have felt nervous coming to the LGBTQ+ society for the first time, whether you are not out (or not out to everyone), come from a background that is not understanding or accepting, or are just nervous of meeting other LGBTQ+ students, we are here to support you and really do want to make you feel welcome. The society aims to provide a space where you can completely be yourself without fear of judgment, criticism or discrimination. We encourage you to come along and meet new people, the more people that come regularly, the better it’ll be for you!   What does the LGBTQ Society do? We organise a wide variety of social events, campaigns and activities for all our members, from club nights and bar crawls on Canal Street to non-alcoholic socials such as our tea cup crawl in Northern Quarter and regular coffee socials at the LGBT+ Centre. We aim to make all our events fully accessible. We also help facilitate involvement with campaigning about LGBTQ+ issues with the UoM LGBQ+ and Trans campaigns officers. If you are a postgraduate or mature student, please feel free to come as we have people of all ages who regularly attend. We have many postgraduates and mature students who join the society and we put on regular postgraduate and mature student only socials which have been very popular in the past. Please don't feel deterred from coming if you are a mature student, we have had students from all stages in university come to the society, there really is a mix! If you are an international student or are BME, you are more than welcome to come as we have members from many different backgrounds as well as our own BME group and you will be supported by our BME Inclusion officer. The society is for all LGBTQ+ students including those that have interrupted (taken a break from university,) it is what you make it!  Finally, there is the University of Manchester LGBTQ+ Mental Health Wellbeing Support Group run by the University of Manchester Counselling Service and the LGBTQ Society. This is a peer support group that anyone can drop in to, more information can be found here. On behalf of all the committee, we look forward to welcoming you to our events this year, if you're a returning student please don’t worry if you haven’t been to any events before, we have had many members who have come in their later years at university and have been glad they did! You are also welcome to come to our events at any time throughout the year so don't be put off if you're coming towards the end of the academic year, it’s never too late! If you do have any questions or concerns, please feel free to email us at uomlgbtqsociety@gmail.com we are here to welcome and support you ☺️🏳️‍🌈    UoM LGBTQ Committee 18/19: Co-ordination Officer: Georgia  General Secretary: Sean  Treasurer: Elias  Social Secretary: Edda  Events Officer (Open Place): Ruby  Events Officer (Women’s place): Milly  BME Inclusion Officer: Jiacheng  Disability Inclusion Officer: Role not yet filled  Campaigns and Fundraising Officer: Emily Wellbeing Secretary: Bridie   Social Media Pages:  Facebook: www.facebook.com/uomlgbtqsociety  Twitter: www.twitter.com/uomlgbtqsociety  Instagram: www.instagram.com/uomlgbtqsociety  Tumblr: www.uomlgbtqsociety.tumblr.com   UoM LGBTQ+ Mental Health Wellbeing Support Group: https://www.counsellingservice.manchester.ac.uk/lgbtq/

name: Liberty in North Korea: UOM
description: Liberty in North Korea: UOM

name: Liberty Park
description: A student committee who are elected to run activities and events in halls to benefit residents.

name: Linguistics Society
description: To encourage to exchange of language knowledge between students of different cultures, races and nationalities. To scale the wall that stands in the way of a simple international relationship whether business or diplomatic. To make language learning free, accessible and fun to all students who have their own language to share.

name: Lithuanian Society
description: Are you a Lithuanian student in Manchester looking to get to know your fellow countrymen?  Perhaps your Lithuanian friends were telling you about 'cepelinai' and 'šakotis', and you are curious to find out what on Earth those are?  Or maybe you simply want to experience the Lithuanian culture first hand? Look no further! LitSoc is here to unite all those with an interest in Lithuanian culture. Come join us at one of our events:  Regular socials – bar socials, movie screenings – you name it. Come along for a relaxed evening and get to know other people!     National food & holiday events – do you miss the ‘tinginys’ your grandma used to make? Fancy showing your culinary, artistic, and other skills? Join for a chance to share it with others!     Weekly quizzes – spend an evening with your friends with a chance to compete for prizes!     And much more..  Find all the latest news and information on our facebook page University of Manchester Lithuanian Society  Alternatively, get in touch with us by email

name: Live Music Society
description: The Live Music Society is dedicated to all aspects of live music performance. It aims to give students an environment in which to meet like-minded individuals who share a similar passion for music, and to present them with opportunities to perform in professional environments. This coming year will be the society's second since it was established, and will be featuring a variety of events including:  · Weekly jam sessions - to meet other musicians, learn new techniques and experiment with genres and styles of music.  · Trips to open mic nights, and other live music events around Manchester - learn the vast scene and meet with some of the people involved.   · Society gigs - the main aim is to give members the opportunity to perform in a professional setting, and we intend to put on two big gigs this year featuring individuals and groups from within the society. If you're interested in playing music, and want a relaxed environment to jam with others, come along to our Monday jam sessions!

name: Love for the Streets
description: No description

name: Madinah Society University of Manchester
description: As salamu alaykum! May the peace, mercy, and blessings of Allah be with you.    Welcome to Madinah Society, University of Manchester!    Madinah Society is a traditional/orthodox Islamic society which focuses on delivering islamic education to the muslim and non-muslim students. Our aim is to convey the message of Islam as delivered to muslims today through the islamic scholars of the past going back to the Prophet Muhammad (many peace and blessings be upon him).  Madinah Society offers such education in the form of weekly classes/seminars, monthly/bimonthly lectures and one-day courses. Charity and social welfare is also a focus as Madinah Society arrange regular homeless feeds, bake sales to raise money for active charities, as well elderly home visits.  Socialising with fellow university members is another integral part of Madinah Society, this is done through regular meet-ups for meals or outings to various social activities of which some include visits to ten pin bowling and the golf driving range etc. Madinah Society also arrange weekly football sessions and similar sport activities in order to maintain a physical and mental balance whilst studying at university.        To keep updated, check your inbox for email updates on events and classes throughout the year.    You'll also find us on: Facebook: facebook.com/madinahsoc Instagram: instagram.com/madinahsoc  Twitter: twitter.com/madinahsoc  Snapchat: madinahsoc Youtube: youtube.com/madinahsoc Email: madinahsocietymu@outlook.com    Wa alaykum as salaam,  Your Madinah Society Committee

name: Magic Society
description: Magic Society

name: MAGSOC (Mines Advisory Group Society)
description: No description

name: Mahjong Society
description: Welcome to the university of manchester mahjong society page.    Join our Facebook Page to stay up to date with events: University of Manchester Mahjong Society (UMMS)    For more information please post a message in the facebook group or contact: President, Markus Foo mahjongsoc.uom@gmail.com

name: Malayalee Society
description: This society aims to bring an array of cultural and social events related to the beautiful state of Kerala, located on the southern part of India. The University of Manchester is said to be the home of many Malayalees and by starting this society we hope to enlighten Manchester students with events that celebrate festivals such as Onam (festival of harvest,) Attukal Pongala (festival of offering) and Thrissur Pooram that are unique to Kerala. We also want to use this society for students as a means of making new friends, to deepen the understanding of our traditions, culture and language, Malayalam; and to explore various forms of art and dance such as Kathakali and Mohiniyattam, present within this state.

name: Malay Language and Culture Society (MALECS)
description: The Malay Language and Culture Society (MALECS) is a society which aims to introduce Malay Language, Literature and its heritage to UoM students. The Malay Language and Culture Society (MALECS) is dedicated in preserving the Malay heritage by organising activities such as Malay Debate Competition. The Malay Language and Culture Society (MALECS) is looking forward to diversify the activities by organising book reviews, public lectures, Malay Language and Literature classess and traditional games.  The Malay Language and Culture Society (MALECS) is collaborating with The University of Manchester Library to add books written in Malay into their collection.           Join us!            For more information: malecs.manchester@gmail.com          Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/MalecsManchester          Website: www.malecsmanchester.com

name: Malaysian Students' Society of Manchester (MSSM)
description: The Malaysian Students' Society of Manchester (MSSM) exists as a platform for Malaysians and non-Malaysians to interact and foster unity and goodwill through activities that showcases Malaysian culture. Run by a committee of 14, annually elected officers, who strive to provide a enjoyable and memorable experience for it’s members during their stay in Manchester, to foster good relationships, and offer assistance among members. We strive to be your 'Home Away from Home'.    Should you have any enquiries, please do not hesistate to drop us an email mssm.secretary@gmail.com.   Connect with us on all social media! Facebook Group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/the.mssm/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/MSSM_ Instagram: http://www.instagram.com/instamssm Website: http://mssmanchester.com/

name: Manchester Anaesthetics Society (UMAS)
description: Manchester Anaesthetics Society (UMAS)

name: Manchester Business Advisory Society
description: Welcome to Manchester Business Advisory Society! We offer pro-bono consulting services to emerging enterprises and charities in the Manchester area. To do this, we harness the potential of ambitious students who create tailored innovative solutions guided by expert mentors from the industry.  This year, we have two projects: one for a charitable organisation and another for an award-winning enterprise. Both will be running with five student-consultants in each. Our teams will engage in professional workshops from industry experts, which will better inform our integral members of what consulting really means and the process by which a project takes place. If you are interested in experiencing real-life management consulting and giving something back to the local community, this is the society for you! Like our Facebook Page for more information!

name: Manchester Cardiovascular Society
description: The student-led Manchester Cardiovascular Society organises events for those with an interest in cardiovascular medicine/surgery.

name: Manchester Catholic Society
description: CathSoc is an extension of the Chaplaincy, which exists FOR STUDENTS!  Our mission statement is encounter God in intimacy, embrace family and community, enrich knowledge and understanding of Jesus and His Church, empower people to mission. We care very much about building a community here in Manchester, and it’s through our mission statement that we hope to achieve this As a society, we run our own events: Our main weekly event is a student meal after the 7pm mass, so at around 8pm, every Sunday in the Chaplaincy (next door). We usually get around 40 people along, so it’s a really nice and relaxed place to meet people. There is something for everyone at CathSoc; whether you’d just like to attend a few events, or volunteer, or help run something - we are devoted to serving you! We are very responsive to feedback and suggestions, and so you individually can have a large influence! To keep up to date with what’s going on, please follow us on our social media platforms:  Facebook- https://www.facebook.com/groups/2221752921435591 Instagram- “Manchester CathSoc"    And please look at our website as well: https://www.manchestercathsoc.co.uk/?fbclid=IwAR1vwxkTw9KDtbgdHwN17IwlUqVm_VIDjAfbtO_nXnNnLOdjhLocwg1Qxxc   If you have any questions, please pop into the Chaplaincy (opposite the SU) or message us on the CathSoc Facebook page!   CathSoc committee members:  Theo McKeever- President Luca Colacino- Diversity and Inclusion Officer Celeste Coury- Social Media Officer Vincent Arciga- Volunteering Coordinator Annamária Križovenská- Secretary Zoe Ejiofor- Treasurer

name: Manchester Charity Fashion Show
description: Manchester Charity Fashion Show     We are a society and community dedicated to helping others within Manchester whilst providing a creative space for students through the medium of the Manchester Charity Fashion Show. As a member, you will have access to the early bird sale tickets of the fashion show, meaning you can avoid missing out on the best student event of the year! These tickets will also be the cheapest going, so definitely not one to miss out on.

name: Manchester Chinese Business Society (MCBS)
description: Welcome to Manchester Chinese Business Society (MCB Society)! MCB Society is a unique business-focused non-profit organisation for Chinese students and those interested in the Chinese business environment. Our mission is to inspire and encourage our members to participate in business activities, to be employed by top companies, or to start their own business in the United Kingdom or China.   FIND OUT MORE Email: team@uommcb.com Official Website: http://www.uommcb.com WeChat （微信） Official Account: mcbsociety Sina Weibo（新浪微博）: http://weibo.com/uommcb Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/uommcb Facebook group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/uommcb.info/ Also, join our mailing list http://groupspaces.com/uommcb/ to receive the latest society news!

name: Manchester Consulting Network
description: Manchester Consulting Network (MCN) is a student-led pro-bono strategy and management consulting society established in 2019. Our initiatives aim to create both a consulting presence in Manchester as well as gather students with a common interest in consulting, entrepreneurship, problem-solving and innovation.

name: Manchester Dental Students Society
description: Join your MDSS to keep up to date with all your dental needs, discounted access to all events and a say in how we are run! We host amazing socials, offer sweet dental merchanise, host talks and competitions and much more.

name: Manchester Energy and Environment Society (MEES)
description: Aims:  To bring more energy-related events to the university and bridge the gap between students and academics working in renewable energy and the environment. To provide ways for students interested in energy and the environment to meet other like-minded students, so that we can take effective interdisciplinary action against the challenges we face in energy and the environment. To organise events where students interested in working in the environmental and renewable energy industries can network with companies.  To promote a strong, science- and fact-backed argument for the use of renewable and low carbon energies.  Events: Throughout the academic year we will organise a range of inclusive events to cater to different interests:  Seminar series Debating sessions Pub quizzes Field trips Conferences Design projects Social events and many more!  Memberships: Membership is free and open to all students in The University of Manchester. Even though we are a science, technology and engineering based society, we welcome members from all disciplines who are passionate about the energy and environmental sector. We think that effective change can only be brought about by the collaboration of experts from a wide range of different fields. Website: http://uomees.weebly.com email: uomenergyenvironsoc@gmail.com Facebook: http://facebook.com/uomees Instagram: @uomenergyandenvironment Committee: President: Katja Eeckelers Vice President: Ugo Legendre Treasurer: Zakwan Mohtadza Head of Events: Akshay Amar Event Coordinators: Mohamed Hatem, Catherine Noonan Head of Marketing: Sarah Kashani Marketing Officers: Emma Kerrison, Zaid Hamoodi Design Officer: Jason Xiong Head of Sponsorship : Daniel Alejandro Choconta Bernal Sponsorship Officer: Chris Davies, Yutong Sun Media Manager: Claudia Agnoletti Those who sign up through this website will be invited through email to join our Facebook group and be part of our mailing list.

name: Manchester Entrepreneurs
description: Founded in 2008, Manchester Entrepreneurs was set up to create and educate a community of future business and society leaders. Today, the community has flourished and comprises over 5000 members, being one of the largest student societies in the UK. Our mission is to support students through a combination of advice, network and funding. Our community has produced more than 40 startups up to date and alumni founders went on to raise over £1.2M in funding. We provide our members with access to information, mentors and funds by working very closely with the local, regional and wider ecosystem of businesses and educational institutions. We organize a wide range of events such as speaker series and workshops focused on developing valuable skills and giving our members opportunity to gain practical experience - there is something we can offer no matter your background and interest. We provide the opportunity for you to develop in a welcoming environment, supported by our innovative community of bright minds. Want to start a business? Interested in working in startups? Open to come along, learn something new, get inspired, or just have fun? There is loads going on at Manchester Entrepreneurs, and always something to get involved in. In addition to our formal and informal events and workshops, our programmes include:   AccelerateME: pre-seed accelerator program welcoming all student and graduate founded business from idea stage to revenue generating entities. Click the link, find out more, and apply now!   HireME: innovative student recruitment platform that provides the mission link between students and startups. We aim to connect the brightest talent with the best companies, and support you in your career development.   What Next? Conference: our flagship event, one of the largest student-led conferences in the in the UK. Filled with inspirational presentations, interactive sessions and a great community of leaders.   Interested? Find out more and join our mailing list at manchesterentrepreneurs.co.uk Follow us: Instagram | Facebook page | Facebook group | Twitter | LinkedIn Email us: info@manchesterentrepreneurs.co.uk Awards:  Innovation Award, 2018, UMIP Entrepreneur Eco-system award, 2018, E2E Exchange Best Enterprise Society, 2015, NACUE Best General Interest Society, 2014, University of Manchester Best Enterprise Society, 2013, NACUE

name: Manchester Exchange Student Society
description: Manchester Exchange Student Society offers a unique opportunity for current, prospective and past exchange students to make global connections with incoming and outgoing exchange students.

name: Manchester Hindu Society - NHSF
description: Namaste and welcome! Manchester Hindu Society - NHSF is a student society motivated by the aim of creating a ‘home away from home’ environment for students. Each year our calendar is filled with enticing events, including a multitude of weekly, monthly and termly activities featuring sport, culture, education and socialising – not to mention THE Chandni Ball. This enables us to have a positive impact on the local Manchester community, including the wider Hindu and non-Hindu community, as well as raising awareness of Hindu beliefs and festivals – Diwali, Navratri, Holi...    We invite all to find out more and keep up to date with up-coming events by visiting our Facebook page:  https://www.facebook.com/manchesterhindusociety/  Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/manchindusoc  Follow us on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/manchesterhindusociety/  Add us on Snapchat: manchindusoc

name: Manchester Investment Fund
description: Welcome to the Manchester Investment Fund! Manchester Investment Fund is a student-led organisation that aims to give its members practical experience of investment management and a solid foundation of financial knowledge that can be applied to all asset classes. We strive to create value for all students around the world and we do it by interviewing representatives of leading financial institutions, lecturers and our team members. Join One of Our Teams!  Investment  Innovation  Interview  Marketing & Events   Why You Should Join Us?  Gain insight into Investment & Trading Industry  Gain experience in investing & portfolio management  Analyze, model and value companies to prepare equity research reports   Boost your employability in the financial sector  Make friends and have fun!   Contact Us: Email us: info@manchesterinvestmentfund.co.uk Follow us:  Facebook | Instagram | LinkedIn Website: manchesterinvestmentfund.co.uk

name: Manchester Marrow
description: Manchester Marrow is the student run arm of the charity Anthony Nolan, which signs students (or people aged 16-30yrs) up to the stem cell register. The register is needed to find matches for sufferers of leukaemia and other blood disorders for their life-saving stem cell transplants - find a match, save a life! Usually, a stem cell transplant is the patient's last chance of life. So we can help them out by widening the donor database.  This is where the society comes in:   STUDENTS - We encourage as many students as possible to join the Anthony Nolan register by attending recruitment events held throughout the year. If they are found to be a match for a patient throughout time on the register, they could save their life!  VOLUNTEERS - There will be several volunteer training sessions held throughout the year so if you would like to be a volunteer, like this page, and our other social media accoutns to keep updated. Our recruitment events are run by volunteers so we need as many as we can!    Being a volunteer will involve: talking to people about why they should sign up to the register; what donation involves if they are ever found to be a match; checking medical backgrounds for donor eligibility;  giving the potential donor a cheek swab for us to send off to Anthony Nolan;  and assissting them in filling out an application form. Certificates are awarded for volunteer of the month as well as Bronze, Silver and Gold Awards for the number of hours volunteered- so it's great for improving your portfolio.  The more people we have, the bigger difference we can make. So please spread the word. ONE OF THE PEOPLE YOU SIGN UP COULD GO ON TO SAVE A LIFE!  Marrow Manchester also hosts fundraising events to help raise the charitable funds needed to keep the register going- these are always great fun for our volunteers to attend. We often incorporate these events into socials too.  The society is a great way to meet people from university and have a laugh whilst doing a genuinely good deed.     How to get involved: Facebook group: https://www.facebook.com/ManchesterMarrow/  Email: manchester@ukmarrow.org

name: Manchester Mauritian Society
description: The Manchester Mauritian Society is a student-run organisation having as main role to ease the adaptation phase of young freshers in Manchester, to cater to the needs of Mauritians, and to share and promote our culture with others. A little about us... Mauritius is a tiny tropical island found in the Indian Ocean. The contrast of multiple tastes and colours compels visitors to return to its shores. And not to forget, being surrounded by warm turquoise lagoons and white soft sandy beaches, this oasis of peace and tranquility is definitely among the few things in the world that connects Earth to Heaven. The Manchester Mauritian Society is a student-run organisation having as main role to ease the adaptation phase of young freshers in Manchester, to cater to the needs of Mauritians, and to share and promote our culture with others. Founded in 2001, we are proud to boast our strong network of high-calibre individuals, both in the student community and industry. We have established ourselves as an official society at the University of Manchester since 2002.

name: Manchester Media Group (Fuse FM, Fuse TV & The Mancunion)
description: Your Students’ Union has one of the largest student media teams in the UK - and we are always on the lookout for new talent. Our student media wing is called the Manchester Media Group, and it’s made up of our student newspaper The Mancunion, radio station Fuse FM, online video content producer Fuse TV, and our Women In Media Conference team. The Mancunion is your weekly student newspaper, delivering you the latest campus news, culture reviews, and student opinion to your inbox, newsfeed, or in your hands. We recently won Best Student Publication in the North and are also home to the winner of the Best Student Journalist in the North! We’re made up of around 40 editors, and we welcome contributions from any student at UoM, regardless of experience. Simply join the Mancunion Writers group on Facebook and attend your chosen section meeting on either a Monday or Tuesday each week! Fuse FM is not just a 24/7 all-student radio station, we host all sorts of events – from comedy showcases to club DJ nights – as well as providing the platform for some great entertainment names like Matt Horne and Jack Whitehall to kick-start their careers. We can put you on your path to radio stardom, from presenting live shows, to producing podcasts, to interviewing artists, we can train you in it all. Join the Fuse FM Presenters Facebook group to get started and remember to pay your £10 membership fee for the year. Fuse TV has everything you need to get into the TV world. We have a dedicated team covering news, documentaries, drama, comedy, and even cooking. We’ll train you in everything from shot positioning and lighting to how to do a live broadcast. We’re a small and committed team located in our editing suite of the first floor of the SU - join our Fuse TV Manchester Creatives group on Facebook to get started or pop in and say hi. The Women In Media Conference is an annual event in March, organised and run by students from the University of Manchester to celebrate female talent in the media and empower new female voices into the industry. We meet weekly and welcome all genders in organising the conference - head to our site’s contact page to say hello and see how you can attend the conference.

name: Manchester Medical Education Society
description: Manchester Medical Education Society

name: Manchester Medical Journal
description: A medical journal run by Manchester University medical students

name: Manchester Medical Society (MedSoc)
description: MedSoc is the University of Manchester's largest student society with over 2,000 members. We are responsible for organising social events, merchandise, the annual ball and funding societies and sports teams for medical students in Manchester.  MedSoc is run by an annually-elected committee of medical students in all years.  Every year we try to make your student experience bigger and better than ever before and we have lots of exciting events lined up this year.  MedSoc supports a large array of societies (more than 48!!) run by students, from Netball to Orchestra, Panto to Marrow, there's a society to suit everyone.  In Stopford Common room we have our own MedSoc shop run by Phase 1 students, this shop is open daily 11-1pm (except Wednesdays). Here you can buy our exclusive merchandise, which includes hoodies and sweatshirts as well as our 'MedSoc card' which provides discounts on all our events and fantastic offers at various shops/restaurants around Manchester.  Be sure to take a look at our website at www.manmedsoc.com.  Don't forget to follow us on Twitter: @Manmedsoc. You can also like our facebook page by clicking on the link: www.facebook.com/ManMedSoc   You can also check out the latest updates of our student run magazine Pacemaker . Email: president@manmedsoc.com, vicepresident@manmedsoc.com, tech@manmedsoc.com Michael Glover - Co-President Seun Ikotun - Co-President

name: Manchester Medics' Revue
description: Manchester Medics’ Revue is a dramatic comedy society writing, directing and performing sketches to raise money for charity.

name: Manchester MedTech Foundation
description: Manchester MedTech, founded in February 2019, is a society which aims to inspire, engage and educate the next generation of medical technology innovators, to equip them with the skills to tackle serious unmet clinical needs, and to provide a platform through which they can collaborate and form essential interdisciplinary connections.  We will be running the Innovation Programme, an annual programme of educational and practical workshops that runs each academic year. The Innovation Programme is a 4 part series of workshops and is open to all students, trainees and early career researchers. Participants are tasked with taking real problems in healthcare today and working in small, interdisciplinary teams to design novel solutions. Participants will learn about the healthcare technology innovation cycle, how to concept develop, product design, market entry and how to translate new technology to improve healthcare for patients.  We will also run a MEDx series consisting of fascinating, intriguing, and thought-provoking talks on everything from ground-breaking medical innovation to essential entrepreneurship know-how for innovating within medical industries. We hope to run other events and collaborate with other MedTech Foundations. Manchester MedTech is a National Spoke for the National Institute for Health Research (NIHR) Surgical MedTech Co-operative. It is registered with the University of Manchester Students' Union and the University of Manchester Medical School.   Founder: Won Young Yoon Current Chair: Won Young Yoon   Email: medtechmanchester@gmail.com Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/manchestermedtech/

name: Manchester Metros Ice Hockey Club
description: Manchester Metros University Ice Hockey Club - representing all the North West universities, including Manchester Metropolitan and Salford University.  We compete in the British Universities Ice Hockey Association (BUIHA) Cup Competition every year. We welcome both new and experienced players with checking and non-checking (non-contact) divisions. At the moment we have A, B and C teams playing in the 3 Divisions of the Cup and can therefore cater for anyone from English Premier League standard down to absolute beginner! Do get in touch if you interested in joining us. We have a full programme to allow you to develop your ice skating and hockey skills.   Training We train between September and June at Altrincham Ice Rink, around 10 miles from the university. But getting there is not a problem as we car pool. Our current training slot is 22:45-23:45 on a Wednesday night.    Games Each squad plays between 8 and 12 games during the regular season in the BUIHA Cup Competition. We can play games against teams from as far afield as Edinburgh, Newcastle and Warwick/Coventry. Our home games take place at Deeside Ice Rink, near Chester. For our C team and development players, we also arrange friendlies against other University development squads during the season. At the end of the season in April, there are 5 Tiers of BUIHA Nationals which take place over weekends in Sheffield - for the last two seasons we have entered teams into 3 of these tiers.    Tour We have several opportunities for overseas play! In 2012 our A team took a trip to Zlin in the Czech Republic to take on Thomas Bata University, the current Czech University champions. They also had a chance to sightsee in Czech, including a trip to a distillery and a night out in Prague. Every summer Metros are also invited to a weekend tournament in Clermont-Ferrand in France, which is a good mix of hockey and socialising!   Contact Us Facebook - @ManchesterMetros Email - info@metroshockey.com Website - www.metroshockey.com

name: Manchester Momentum Students
description: Manchester Momentum Students are a socialist society advocating for increased student participation in the Labour Party and its affiliated trades unions. The society puts on a range of cultural events, from interesting talks and debates featuring leading lights in the youth and labour movements, to film clubs showcasing rare and avant garde movies, to club nights, including Manchester Momentum's very own Northern Soul Disco in Withington. The goal of the society is to offer a cultural programme which gets students interested and informed about left-wing politics, and encourage members to get active in their local Labour parties, Momentum branches, and student politics bodies.

name: Manchester nightline
description: We are a listening service run for students by students, open from 8pm to 8am every night during term time. Our number can be found on the back of your student card. For any volunteering or other enquires, please look at our website or drop us an email at communications@manchester.nightline.ac.uk

name: Manchester Outreach Medics AAA
description: To serve as a widening participation project, providing insight into life at medical school and the application process for medicine. Our audience are people aged 15-18.   We typically run events sizing from 25-100 attendees. Sixth formers are invited to attend. The events last from 9-5 and include group activities and presentations. http://bit.ly/2lbkOrV

name: Manchester Polo Club
description: Do you want to learn to play polo at University? Have you decided to try something new or have you always wanted to have a go but never had the chance? The University of Manchester Polo Club is a fantastic and accessible way to allow students from all backgrounds to get in to this exciting and highly addictive team sport. We are made up of beginners who are brand new polo, all the way up to those who have been playing since before they can remember—and everyone in between! We are a relaxed society with no obligation to attend weekly. Everyone who plays with us has the opportunity to represent Manchester University at a SUPA ( School's and universite's Polo Association) championship level with three inter-university competitions a year as well as other smaller matches and friendlies. It doesn't matter if you’ve never played Polo before—the  only entry requirements are to be able to confidently trot and canter a horse unaided. We train weekly with the wonderfull former international pro and award winning Glynn Henderson of Henderson Polo, and you'll be flying in no time!  For more infomation or to join in with one of our lessons please see either our Facebook page 'University of Manchester Polo Club' or contact our email uom.polo@gmail.com.      FAQs: https://www.hendersonpolo.co.uk/faqs        Find us on Facebook: facebook.com/groups/uompoloclub Email: uom.polo@gmail.com

name: Manchester Sikh Society
description: Vaheguru Ji Ka Khalsa Vaheguru Ji Ki Fateh! This is a society formed to unify the Sikh community and spread the message of Sikhism - love, compassion and humility being at its forefront.  Events range from socials to Gurdwara trips to talks and workshops - so there's a vast range of activities to get involved with and it gives you a chance to meet like-minded individuals! Membership is FREE so it is definitely worth signing up - we'll be able to add you to our mailing list and keep you updated with the latest events and socials!  For more information please contact/ follow us on : - Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/manchestersikhsoc/ - Instagram: Manchestersikhsociety  - Twitter: MancSikhSoc - Email: Manchestersikhsociety@hotmail.co.uk

name: Manchester Student Scout and Guide Organisation (ManSSAGO)
description: ManSSAGO Join us at a variety of events including camping, weekly socials and trips all over the country. Our weekly socials are on Thursday evenings and we also have camps and other activites throughout the year.  (after racing to put up our tents, we discovered that they are lot bigger than 3-man!) Who Are We? SSAGO is a national organisation of university students who want to be involved, or continue to be involved, in scouting and guiding. We are the Manchester branch. Many of our members have been scouts or guides, although this is not necessary, and wanted to continue doing fun activities such as camps, bonfires, pudding crawls, climbing etc. We can also help you volunteer locally with scout and guide groups if you are interested.   (last year's ball was in Bristol and we all got dressed up on a wizarding theme!) What Do We Do? We are mainly a social group, meeting on every Thursday evening for a social, which can be any of a wide range of activities (bowling, hiking, eating puddings, cooking challenges, craft evenings, eating cheese (and maybe drinking a little wine), ice skating,  and the occasional campfire), always somewhere around the union and easy to get to (either meeting in town, at the union, or at one of the nearby Scout huts). In addition, we often go camping. Sometimes this is camps that we organise ourselves, including Freshers camp in October and our week long summer camp (for difficult to explain reasons called Expo) just after exams in June, along with some others throughout the year. We also go on rallies, which are camps organised by national SSAGO and attended by all the student Scouts and Guides in the country. There are three of these each year, in November (which this year will be hosted in Lancaster, on a fantasy theme), February (hosted this year by Nottingham, with a outlaws theme) and June (just after Expo, and this year hosted by Edingburg).  (a traditional scouty exploit) National SSAGO also organises a ball each year. This year Aberystwyth is hosting an ABBA (Aber does Abba) ball. ManSSAGO also has a Christmas meal, which is another social highlight of the year. Finally, we are involved in other volunteering and fundraising events, both with our connections with the Scout and Guide Associations and on our own. So, if any of this sounds like the kind of thing that you are interested in, then you should join our society.  (enjoying our desserts on last year's annual pudding crawl) How you can find out more You can join us here on the Union website. This will add you to our mailing list, so you should hear about our weekly socials. Membership is not required until later in the year.  You can visit our National SSAGO page, which should have details of our club, a load of photos of us, and some other useful information. You can join our Facebook group for details of our weekly meetings.  You can also follow us on Twitter, @manssago, Tweets by @manSSAGO    If you want to volunteer with the Scouts, you can email our Scout Liaison officer. If you want to volunteer with the Guides, you can email our Guide Liaison officer. And if you want to ask us about anything else, you can email here  (national rallies are a great way to meet other SSAGO students from around the UK)

name: Manchester Thrift Society
description: Manchester Thrift Soc is all about second-hand sustainable fashion. We host trips to our local thrift shops, clothes swapping events and much more.    If you're a thrift-shop veteran or just dipping your toes into slow fashion Thrift Soc is for you!

name: Manchester Universities' Skydive Club
description: We are a skydiving club, giving students the opportunity to learn to jump out of planes by themselves; Allowing them to get involved with skydiving world and become a qualified skydiver. We also have regular socials and events every week within our society, for regular updates join our facebook page "https://www.facebook.com/groups/manchester.skydive/" we'll post most of our events through here.  You are guaranteed to have an amazing super fun time!

name: Manchester University Comic Art & Illustration
description: Manchester University Comic Art and Illustration (former Manchester University Comic Collective) is a University based society with the objective of forming a space for artistic expression and promote creativity, obviously, through comics and illustrations.    Our society is the ideal place for those of you with an interest in producing comics, whether you are a seasoned veteran or you can barely draw a stickman(yes, even you), whether you draw manga or something else, maybe you don't even draw comics but still like to draw, even if all you do is fanart...if you have ever held a pencil in your hand, you are more than welcome here!    We will run weekly workshops throughout the whole academic year, where we will explore and discuss different themes related to the comic making process: going from the basic of drawing to storytelling methods and techniques, behind the scenes of the comics industry and so much more. During these sessions you will have the chance to develop your skills, experiment with new techniques, materials, styles or anything you want, as well as sharing ideas and experiences and of course, meet like minded people and make friends!    For more information on what are we up to, check our social media or just drop in one of workshops and be part of the action.   Facebook               Instagram Email: mucaiofficial@gmail.com

name: Manchester University Dodgeball Society
description: You've seen the film, now play the game!  Dodgeball is fun, friendly and open to all! Whether you come to play competitively or just for fun, you're guaranteed to enjoy it.    NO MEMBERSHIP FEE. No commitment. Open to all abilities.   WHEN: (Starting Monday 1st October)  Mondays 5-6 PM, free women's only session. 6-7 PM, free men's only session.  Wednesdays 4-5 PM, (£1).  Fridays 7-8 PM (£1)   WHERE:  Active Lifestyle Centre  Denmark Road  M15 6FG   (By Whitworth Park)   This is the link to our 2018/19 Facebook group, where you can keep up to date with all our events and tournaments:  https://www.facebook.com/groups/217822642233411/ Can't wait to see you soon! :)

name: Manchester University First Aid Society

name: Manchester University Korean Student Society (MUKSS)
description: MUKSS (Manchester University Korean Student Society) is a non-profit organisation, providing all Korean students in Manchester with various types of welfare benefits. MuKSS also promotes Korean culture to many other cultures under the umbrella of The University of Manchester. To give full constructive support to students studying abroad in Manchester, MUKSS creates the best environment for students to communicate and expand personal networks through academic and cultural events. Furthermore, MUKSS attempts to play an active role in cultural exchanges among international students, while concentrating on spreading Korean culture.  It is not easy for students to study abroad, so we dedicate our best efforts to be an effective channel of communication between students. Additionally, we attempt to be a cultural ambassador of Korea to improve the reputation of Korea. Ultimately, MUKSS is an organisation that helps students to find their values and develop them through experiences found in Manchester.     Email: info.mukss@gmail.com Facebook Homepage: https://www.facebook.com/groups/37197083187 Instagram: @mukss_official

name: Manchester University Trading and Investment Society (MUTIS)
description: Bringing together people with a common interest in financial markets.  Provide a platform for learning and discussion of financial markets.  Create a forum for like minded individuals to network with industrys professionals.  To improve and advance our members' career prospects.  To facilitate development of business awareness and personal knowledge. For more information please email info@mutis.co.uk

name: MANSEDS
description: Manchester Students for the Exploration and Development of Space (MANSEDS) is a student society based at The University of Manchester that aims to bring space to the masses and organise an exciting combination of space education, high altitude ballooning, rocket and robotic rover design and manufacture. We have many exciting events coming out so please join our facebook page to hear all the latest news! If you have any questions please direct them to the president: President@manseds.co.uk

name: Marxist Society
description: Our aim is to educate ourselves in Marxist theory, campaign to build the forces of Marxism, and, ultimately, to struggle for socialism. We host weekly discussion meetings, lectures and debates on history, politics, economics and philosophy from a Marxist perspective, as well as reading groups, where we study classic works of Marxism, and film screenings.   As a student society, we aim to intervene in the political life of the campus and of the wider student movement. We are officially affiliated to the Marxist Student Federation, which unites and co-ordinates the Marxist societies on a national level. If you seek learn more or join the MSF, contact a representative of the Manchester Marxists or visit the Federation website: http://marxiststudent.com/   Everyone is welcome to our meetings, student or not, regardless of political views or affiliation. We meet every Tuesday evening for discussion meetings and lectures. Join the group to keep updated on the upcoming events.

name: Materials Society (MATSOC)
description: MÁTSOC: THE OFFICIAL SCHOOL OF MATERIALS SOCIETY  From Materials Science and Engineering to Fashion Management, all School of Materials students are welcome!  We aim to create a fun society to connect all students across the School's network by putting on regular nights out, day trips, events, creating sports teams and having guest speakers.  So join the group and become a member for £5 today    Like us on Facebook for all latest updates: www.facebook.com/MATSOCMCR   MatSoc Netball: www.facebook.com/groups/matsocnetball/?fref=ts   The Official School of Materials Website: www.materials.manchester.ac.uk/#video_3

name: MathSoc
description: The University of Manchester Mathematics Society Looking to improve your student experience exponentially? Well you're in the right place!  At MathSoc we organize social, professional and educative events for all students on Maths-related courses. From pub-crawls to student balls, guest lectures to careers fairs, we cover the range of interests in our diverse faculty. So whatever you're keen on, we'll have an event for you and your like-minded peers!    To join us and get in the loop, sign up on this site (it's free!) - you'll be notified of all our upcoming events on student mail. You can also shoot us an email at UoMMathSoc@outlook.com, join our Facebook page (University of Manchester MathSoc) or check out our Twitter or Instagram (both @UoMMathSoc) for updates and to ask questions. We hope to see you at our next event!  Once again, membership is absolutely free :)

name: MCR Global Health Society
description: The Manchester Global Health Society is a society open to all students interested in Global Health - the most multi disciplinary subject known to man!    What do we do? Since 2014 we’ve been raising the profile of Global Health at the University of Manchester. We work closely with the Office for Global Health, UK Faculty of Public Health and many others across the UK. It isn't just about medicine, as health inequalities affect us all, as do social and political issues which lead to international health crises. We welcome students with all interests and passion for any aspect of global health, and want to give you the platform to learn more and take part in volunteering opportunities for change!      Join us on our:   Adventures in Global Health: TEDx style series with leading experts on issues of global importance, in association with the prestigious Office for Global Health   Highly interactive lectures and workshops on climate change, disaster relief, the refugee crisis, health inequalities and much more   Competitions both nationally and locally - prizes available!   Blogs by world leading experts, front line health professionals and academics as well as students from across the world.   Exclusive application to summer health outreaches in Gulu, Northern Uganda   And much more!      Our events are attended by students from courses such as: medicine, maths, life sciences, geography, politics, business, nursing, law and engineering - Hang on! There’s no typical student group! We’re open to all!   Get in touch with us, say hi when you come to our events and spread the word!  mcrglobalhealth.com  | @GlobalHealthMCR  | Facebook.com/globalhealthmcr | admin@mcrglobalhealth.com

name: Mechanical Engineering (MechSoc)
description: We are a student-run body that aims to help our members get the most out of their time at university and offer opportunities to make them as employable as possible upon graduating. We run extra-curricular activities that aim to improve student’s link with industry, provide information on relevant events and talks and organise socials that allow members to meet other engineers that they may not have met in lectures. We have an active facebook group where you can keep up-to-date with all the latest information about events and activities which can be found by following the link below: https://www.facebook.com/MechSocUoM/ If you would like to get involved with the running of the Society or for any other information please contact: uommechsoc@gmail.com Our linkedin page is: https://www.linkedin.com/company/18186855/

name: Medical Debating
description: The Manchester Medical Debating Society aims to provide a platform for the debate of medical issues and the refinement of personal debating skills.

name: Medical Orchestra and Choir
description: Manchester Medical Orchestra and Choir (MMOC) rehearses weekly towards termly concerts to raise money for medical charities and play/sing a wide range of music, be it classical or contemporary. Both our orchestra and choir are non-auditioned and we welcome musicians of all standards and backgrounds. 🎵 👏   Our rehearsals are on Monday evenings in Stopford common room.    Orchestra - 6:50pm – 8:30pm   Choir – 8:30pm – 10:00pm   Our first concert of the year will be on 6th December.   Thanks!  MMOC Committee 🎶   If you are interested in taking part, just post on our Facebook group, or email us at mmoc.chair@gmail.com

name: Medical Research Students' Society (MMRSSoc)
description: The University of Manchester is a fantastic research institute, ranked 3rd in the UK in terms of research power by the latest independent Research Assessment Exercise. Despite this, there are few outlets specifically directed at students that showcase this work and aim to inform students on how to get involved with research at an early stage. The Manchester Medical Research Students' Society (MMRSSoc), founded in April 2012, is a student led organisation that hopes to bridge the gap between students and medical research.   Our aim is to foster a research culture amongst students and improve the research opportunities available to them. We also hope to encourage student involvement at conferences and meetings that allow students to showcase their research to peers and other academics on a local, national and international scale. We will host a number of inspiring and informative events throughout the year that will also provide the opportunity for students and academics to network. Some of our plans for 2016/17 include hosting a lectures series by leading academics, educational workshops/seminars, an national undergraduate medical conference and many more inspiring activities.   The patrons are Dr Adam Greenstein (senior lecturer in cardiovascular medicine), Professor Tony Freemont (former Head of School), and two of our founding members Dr Hydar Faruqi and Dr Danielle Nimmons.   Please LIKE our Facebook page to keep updated: http://www.facebook.com/MMRSSoc Email: mmrssoc@gmail.com

name: Medicine in Arts Society (MIAS)
description: - Explore the link between the arts and medicine, including art therapies.   - Explore the use of arts and humanities in the current medical curriculum and support the design and implementation of those artistic disciplines thought to be beneficial to medical students in the medical course.

description: No description

name: Medics and Dentists Women's Football Club
description: Hello, we are a relaxed and friendly society who meet once a week for football training (Monday evening) and compete in a women's 6-a-side league at the Armitage centre (Thursday evening TBC). One weekend a year we play in a national 11-a-side tournament with other student teams and go on a big night out together afterwards. Throughout the year we'll be having some socials with and without the men's team. We welcome people of all abilities and courses and understand that everyone has different schedules and may not be able to attend all sessions, so please get involved! For more info, find us on facebook: Manchester Medics Women's Football Club (Official)

name: Medics Badminton Club
description: To get medics of all ability levels to play badminton once a week, have fun and meet new people.

name: Medics Basketball
description: To provide a friendly environment where medical students can learn to play and practice basketball. Competitive games against other basketball teams at Manchester University are held weekly and we also provide the opportunity to compete against other medical schools around the country.

name: Medics Cricket
description: Regular cricket training or matches for medics of all years and intercalating medical students. Matches to be played against other university teams and other medical schools.

name: Medics Football
description: We aim to provide an open and welcoming club for footballers of all abilities. With 5 teams, we try to give everyone the chance to take part in 11 a side football matches on a Wednesday afternoon. This year we have 5 teams registered in the ISSL, with new players being recruited for every team. The first major event of the year is our Open Trial. This will be held on Wednesday the 20th. Meet us at 5 pm at Owens park, where we will then head to Fog Lane park for the trial. It will be on GRASS so bring studded boots.  If you have any further questions, contact Michael Haynes by email: michael.haynes@student.manchester.ac.uk

name: Medics Hockey
description: A mixed hockey club for players of all abilities. Training is every Wednesday at 9pm on the Armitage astro and games are sunday afternoon within the campus league, with entry into a national medical student league too. We have socials thoroughout the year, along with tours to UK tournaments.

name: Medics  in Primary Schools
description: Medics in primary schools (MIPS) is a society set up to help inspire primary school children about health and science, whilst also improving the outreach of higher education to areas around Manchester. We typically teach year 6 primary school children, with 5-6 particpants teaching a class. Sessions last for roughly an hour and taken place once every two weeks on a Wednesday afternoon. We cover a variety of topics ranging from basic health and science to thinking about higher education and what to do in an emergency. We use a variety of props and the teaching is never dull – with participants in MIPS expected to take a fun and interactive way of getting important facts across to the pupils. MIPS is a great way to get involved with teaching and working with children in a safe and friendly environment and is a very rewarding experience!   Contact us on: medicsinprimaryschools@gmail.com   Visit us at: http://www.facebook.com/pages/Medics-In-Primary-Schools/294532523895427

name: Medics Lacrosse
description: A mixed-lacrosse team within the medical school who will take part in campus league matches starting soon. We hold regular practices at times suitable for the busy schedule of a medic and provide a flexible training regime and an opportunity for medics to learn a new sport. With lacrosse now being a focus sport at the University, we are hoping for further expansion of the society which will hopefully lead to matches against other medical schools.

name: Medics Netball
description: We have 6 teams for all abilities from beginner to county level who compete in a range of leagues. We also have a great social side to the club to encourage all 5 years to mix.

name: Medics Original Plays
description: To direct and produce one piece of original work for stage once a year, written by medics and organised around their timetables.

name: Medics' Panto
description: A group of students who produce an adult pantomime each year, performing to sell out audiences at Manchester Academy. Join our Facebook group to find out more! https://www.facebook.com/groups/1699939160263804/

name: Medics Rugby Union (RUFC)
description: Organise the Rugby Teams of students from Manchester Medical School. This is done through a comprehensive playing, training and social schedule.

name: Medics Ski Club
description: To provide an opportunity for medical students to ski with a club. Great opportunity for students to share a passion and meet like minded friends. We hope to offer training sessions and a trip in April to the Alps.

name: MedLife UoM
description: MEDLIFE is a non-profit organisation working in different countries across the world to provide health care, education, and infrastructure to communities in need. MedLife University of Manchester is a part of a global movement of more than 200 societies throughout Canada, The United States, the UK and Europe that focuses on:  Local Volunteering International Volunteering Education  Fundraising  Our mission... To build a worldwide movement empowering the poor in their fight for equal access to healthcare, education and a safe home. Our vision... A world free from the constraints of poverty

name: Mexican Society
description: The Manchester Mexican Society (MMxS) was established on June 8th, 1995, and we are celebrating our 23nd anniversary. The aims of the Manchester Mexican Society are:  To share and promote our passion for Mexican traditions, customs and culture. To provide support for all Mexicans living in the Greater Manchester area, organising regular gatherings and events. To create and develop friendly links between Mexican, British and other foreign students, in an environment based on mutual respect for different cultures and customs.  We organize events for the Mexican and Mexican-loving community in Manchester. Give us a like in facebook: www.facebook.com/ManchesterMexicanSociety or follow us on twitter: www.twitter.com/MMxSUoM

name: MIDSOC (Midwifery)
description: No description

name: Mixed Martial Arts

name: Model United Nations
description: Welcome to The University of Manchester Model United Nations Society! Are you interested in international affairs or how the United Nations operates? Do you wish to enhance your public speaking and debate skills? If so, then this is the society for you.  The Manchester University Model United Nations (ManMUN) Society is committed to enhancing students’ understanding of the institutional and political in-working of the United Nations (UN) organisation. Through attending simulated UN conferences, students act as ambassadors, representatives, and national leaders of their assigned countries whilst debating a variety of issues in a manner consistent with the procedure of the real UN. Such conferences take place on a university, regional or global level amongst other prestigious universities world-wide, and provide forums which build international awareness and understanding as well as provide opportunity for educational and cultural enrichment. Participation in the Model UN enhances research, public speaking, debating and negotiating skills, while widening the network between students and professionals around the world. We welcome students from all courses and all levels of study. Voted Best Political Society 3 years running at the SU Awards!    Find out more at www.manmun.co.uk   Like us on Facebook  Join our Members' Group

name: Motion Picture Society
description: Do you have a passion for Film? Love cinema? Enjoy chatting with like-minded people? Then join us!   Hello and welcome to the Motion Picture Society!   We are the University of Manchester's key film screening society, showing a wide range of films from Hollywood classics to cult indie films to student made shorts.    We are an active group who love watching and discussing films. Our weekly screenings feature an introduction to the film by one of the committee or particularly enthusiastic member, the screening of the film, and then a discussion of the film. Our informal discussions focus on how we as the audience reacted to the film, looking at the impact of the direction, acting, cinematography, editing, sound etc. We love to hear everyone's opinion, and there is no wrong answer! You don't have to talk if you don't want to, we pride ourselves on being a very chilled society :)   We also take regular trips to local cinemas, including AMC, Odeon, and Manchester's key independent cinema HOME.   Our monthly film-based pub quizzes are an excellent way for our members to meet new people while having film-based fun! All drinks are bought from the SU bar, so there is no pressure to drink alcohol if you don't want to.   All the rooms we use have disabled access, and please let one of us know if you need any extra assistance and we will try to be as accomodating as possible :)   We have excellent links with both the Filmmaking society and the film section of the Mancunion, so there is lots of opportunity for creativity surrounding film.   Our membership is only £2 a year, and the money goes towards subsidising food for our screenings, advertising costs, and (hopefully!**) subsidising cinema screenings. **Dependent on our financial situation as decided by the committee. (Basically, if we don't have enough money we won't be able to do this, but if we do, we will!)   Facebook: Motion Picture Society - Manchester University

name: Muay Thai Boxing
description: Manchester Uni Muay Thai Boxing society is a society for the martial art and fighting style of Muay Thai - the art of eight limbs. We learn and practice techniques for self-defence, fitness and for recreation. Guys, girls, beginners, experienced, ALL WELCOME!      Please join the facebook page for details of training.

name: MUMPS - Manchester University Medics Paediatrics Society
description: MUMPS is a society that represents medical students interested in paediatrics and children's health. We endeavour to support students in all years of medical school to learn more about paediatrics and to develop relevant clinical skills, as well as supporting local child health initiatives through volunteering activitites and charity affiliation.    We host regular evening lectures on a variety of subjects in paediatric medicine and surgery, organise mock OSCEs and other revision events each semester, and have produced educational content that includes youtube videos ( and an iBook. We also organise an annual conference with speakers coming from eminent hospitals across the country, including RMCH, Great Ormond Street and Alder Hey.   Please like our Facebook page (https://www.facebook.com/MUMPSmanchester) and Twitter page (https://twitter.com/mumps_uom) for updates on events and society activity!    For more information please contact mumps.manchester@gmail.com

name: MUQS- Manchester University Quiz Society
description: MUQS- Manchester University Quiz Society

name: Musical Theatre Society (UMMTS)
description: UMMTS is now in its seventh year and has grown into an extreamly open, friendly and award winning society, passionate about all aspects of musical theatre. We provide a platform for aspiring musical theatre creatives to put on professional level productions as well as a safe space to socialise with other enthusiasts and convert the masses! We produce three large- scale musicals a year, numerous concept showcases with our reveue group, plenty of socials and unaudtioned performance opportunities. We’re always looking for new members to get involved with our productions, both on stage and off. If you’d like to join the society, simply sign up on the SU website and send an email to secretary@ummts.co.uk for more information. Membership is only £12 for the the year, a bargain when you consider all the fantastic opportunities UMMTS is offering - which includes discounts to shows, performances, workshops, socials and a free Revs card! To keep up to date please visit our facebook page: www.facebook.com/UMMTS

name: Music Society (MUMS)
description: Steps to Follow to Join MUMS:  Click "Join this group" Answer the questions that follow Wait to recieve your digital membership card and information pack via email in the next few days  If you want to audition for our auditioned ensembles, visit the "Auditions" section of our website (mumusicsociety.co.uk)   What is MUMS? Manchester University Music Society (MUMS) is a society whose aim is to bring together those across the University who are as passionate about music as we are! With over 400 members, we are one of the largest, most active and most ambitious student run music societies in the country. Our dedicated committee works tirelessly to provide our members with a huge range of concerts, chances to perform, socials and other opportunities both on and off campus, as well as working with other societies such as the University Chorus to provide even more exciting ways to get involved with music. MUMS is open to everyone. The only prerequisite for joining the society is a love of music. If that's how you feel then MUMS is the place for you. Whether to play or to hear, typically around 500 people join MUMS every year. The mission of the society is to bring together people who are passionate about music in a relaxed and friendly atmosphere and provide them with opportunities to hear and make music on a regular basis to a high standard. This is done through an established range of around 50 concerts through the year, a number of ensembles and social events. Making the most of MUMS With a MUMS Membership you can:  Join both our non-auditioned fixed ensembles and auditioned ensembles including  Big Band, Brass Band, String Orchestra, Symphony Orchestra and Wind Orchestra Access our 8 basement practice rooms (each fitted with an upright piano) Make use of our instrumental teaching scheme Get Free tickets to all MUMS concerts in the Martin Harris Centre for Music and Drama (No.42 on the Campus Map) Gain cheaper entry to our infamous socials Get involved in community outreach projects  Get a 10% discount on instrument hire from https://musicalinstrumenthire.com/ Perform in our yearly opera  Join us on our yearly tour!  If you would like to find out more about the society and see what we have been doing, check out our website (https://www.mumusicsociety.co.uk/) and facebook page (https://www.facebook.com/MUMusicSociety/).   Please fill out all the questions that follow when signing up- this information is a vital part of your membership.   Visit our website for details of our ensembles, have a look through their individual pages and for details about joining MUMS, booking tickets, coming to our concerts or for any other information. Information about auditioning for our auditioned ensembles is on the MUMS website.   Where is MUMS? We are largely based in the Martin Harris Centre for Music and Drama, holding almost all of our rehearsals within the building, as well as most of our concerts. However, we have other gigs and bandnights in pubs around Manchester and we also have a few events in Club Academy. Contact Us: For general inquires, please contact:  - secretary@mumusicsociety.co.uk If you have a more specific question for another member of the committee, find the committee list on the MUMS website Visit us at: Facebook - http://www.facebook.com/MUMusicSociety Twitter - https://twitter.com/MUMusicSociety1 Website - http://www.mumusicsociety.co.uk
