name: Optometry Society (OpSoc)
description: Welcome to the Official University of Manchester Optometry Society's Webpage! The University of Manchester Optometry Society is for all Optometry students studying at the University of Manchester, however students from other courses in the university are also welcome to join.  What does the Optometry Society do?  We as a society aim to support all Optometry students studying at the University. Whether that be peer support, putting on social events or relaying feedback to staff about the course. We are here to help make your experience at the University enjoyable and memorable.  The committee are all student volunteers who are passionate in doing their best to make sure students are content with their life at university. We have a wide range of resources and are happy to talk and signpost you to university services that may be beneficial, if required. Many students in the past have, at times, found studying Optometry at Manchester intense and overwhelming. We aim to put on events that can help students unwind, relax and maintain a good work-life balance. On the course, it is likely that you only get to know people in your Optometric Examination (OE) groups, Dispensing groups or maybe at lectures. A lot of students want to meet other people on the course but due to this reason, find it difficult to do so. We therefore aim to put on a wide range of events for members, in all years, to socialise. You’ll be able to meet other people on your course (and even in other years) that you may not normally meet or get to know. Some students have felt nervous coming to society events, especially if they don’t typically attend events or are not part of a social group that does. Members of the committee will be at events to support you and make you feel welcome, we want you to be comfortable attending, a lot of people are in similar positions and so are usually more than willing to socialise and make new friends, even in third year! What events do you put on? We organise a wide variety of social events, from going on nights out in Manchester to non-alcoholic socials such as film nights, bowling, eating out in restaurants and of course the Eyeball! We aim to make all our events fully accessible and inclusive.  If you are an international, postgraduate or a mature student or identify at LGBTQIA+, you are more than welcome to join! All our events are aimed to be welcoming and inclusive. We have students coming to events who have different cultural backgrounds, ethnicities, sexuality, gender identity, age and who are in different stages in university, there really is a mix! We also have had students attend who were redoing the year or are on interruption (taken a break from university). It can be difficult taking a break or returning to uni and suddenly continuing your studies with new people. The OpSoc events have been hugely beneficial with students in this position being able to socialise and make new friends. You are welcome to attend even if you're currently on interuption. We as a committee will do everything we can to support you, if you need it :) Overall OpSoc is what you make it! The more people that come and engage in the events, the better it will be for you! Is there a membership fee? We are part of the University of Manchester Student's union and are a non-profit society. Everyone on the committee volunteers their time to help oversee and run events.In order for us to put on these events and run the society as a whole, we do charge a membership fee. We understand, especially as students, this is not ideal but we have to do this in order for us to put on events and run the society to a high standard. We have two membership choices: 1 or 3 years. If you are interested and would like to find out more information, please click on the “Join Group” button above. Before joining, please read the Terms and Conditions, the link is below.   By joining the society, you agree to all the terms and conditions set out as part of the membership. University of Manchester Optometry Mental Health Wellbeing Support Group This is a peer support group run by the OpSoc Committee and supported by Optom Staff from SWAPS (Student Welfare and Professionalism Support).  This group aims to help Optom students, who are having psychological difficulties, receive support from other students who may be going through, or have gone through similar things. Many students find Optometry intense and stressful at times. The group is there for anyone from any year who needs it, you can come at any time to just vent/talk and it doesn’t matter if you’re late. We have strict rules in which those attending, must keep everything confidential within the group. We will talk about our wellbeing openly with the aim of helping each other find new ways forward. The group runs every two weeks (term time) on Wednesday’s from 14:00-15:00 in the Zochonis Common Room, unless otherwise stated. Please note: facilitators in the Optometry Support Group are not trained counsellors but are there to offer peer support and sign post you to relevant services if needed. How can I contact the society? The best way to contact us is via email: manchesteropsoc@gmail.com you are also welcome to message us on our Facebook page (link is below).  We aim to send out periodic updates via email (to your student email addresses) about society and career events, volunteer opportunities and more! UoM OpSoc Committee 2019/20:  President: Sachin Vice President: Meera Treasurer: Melissa General Secretary: Jade Social Secretary: Helen  Events Coordinator & Inclusions Officer: Armina Events Coordinator & Inclusions Officer: Divya Social Media Pages: Facebook:  www.facebook.com/manchesteropsoc Instagram:  www.instagram.com/manchesteropsoc Twitter:  www.twitter.com/manchesteropsoc From all the committee, we are excited to welcome you to our events this year! Please don’t feel worried if you are a returning student and haven’t been to any events before, we have had members who came in their later years at university and have been really glad they did!  You are also welcome to come any time throughout the year so don't be put off if you're coming towards the end of the academic year, it’s never too late!  We are here to welcome and support you, we hope to see you all at our events soon :)  University of Manchester OpSoc Committee

name: Other Sounds
description: Other Sounds - Manchester's alternative/DIY society.     We are a group of music lovers who come together to discuss, listen to and enjoy any and all kinds of music and art. We do cool stuff like gigs, zines, mixtape swaps, film screenings, getting over excited about music and generally supporting DIY music culture.    We’re now into our sixth generation, and we’ve brought together lots of people to participate in the great creative scene in the city. We have a monthly residency at Fuel in Withington to showcase live talents from the underground around the country.   We also have a very active internet presence - kee up to date by following our Facebook page, Instagram, Twitter, Soundcloud and our blog. You can also find links to our events and post interesting stuff in our Facebook group.   Sound good? Sign up (it's free) and join in.

name: Our Future Our Choice
description: We didn't vote for this mess Young people overwhelmingly voted to Remain in the EU.  Join us in the fight for a People's Vote and make your voice heard.  We believe that there is no good Brexit deal for young people. Brexit means less opportunity, a tougher job market and fewer rights for young people. Our generation must be given a say on a decision that will affect us or the rest of our lives.  We are the Manchester student branch of OFOC, a single-issue campaign group. Join us to engage in national and local protests and other forms of pressure politics. The coming months are shaping up to be the most critical period of politics our country has experienced for decades. You don't have to be over passionate to care about politics, regardless of your political knowledge, if you feel strongly about this issue your help is appreciated.  Protest politics is slow and the results are often intangible. But earlier this year 1 million people marched in London for a People's Vote. Every person counts equally towards that collective goal and, at such a volatile point in our domestic politics, more people on the streets will have an even greater impact.  Along-side protesting, we will hold letter-writing evenings to our MPs, QAs with leading political figures (rumor has it Corbyn will be visiting), and other social meetups to discuss the issues at play and, hopefully, persuade opponents of a second referendum to reconsider their view. https://www.ofoc.co.uk/ https://www.facebook.com/OurFutureOurChoiceManchesterStudents/?modal=admin_todo_tour

name: Out Loud - One World, Many Voices
description: -    Out Loud is a new university society/platform to give the voice to young people, tackle the polarization of the society and spreading fake and alternative news.   -    Its main aim is to create a constructive dialogue among young people with various opinions and ideas in a safe and friendly environment.   -    Young people will be led to share opinions and listen to each other despite their possible disagreements to inspire them to think outside of the box and escape their information bubbles.   -    Our intention is to gather people from all backgrounds and to help young people to communicate and listen to each other.   -    The main message is to allow, motivate and persuade young people to better understand and respect the stories and opinions of each other without making judgments which would further limit them in active listening to and understanding each other.   -    Moreover, Out Loud addresses the issue of misconceptions, misunderstandings and tackle the influence of fake and alternative news on people’s perceptions of reality.

name: Pakistan Society
description: The Pakistan Society at the University of Manchester aims to provide a platform of cultural exchange, social networking as well as relevant educational and professional opportunities for all current and prospective Pakistani students, at the University of Manchester.   Home to a multitude of diverse food spots, theme parks, shopping heavens and other student-friendly attractions, Manchester unlike many other places in the UK has a huge potential for easily becoming your home away from home. In the light of such exciting prospects and a guaranteed great upcoming three years for you, we at the Pakistan Society strive to ensure your experience does not go to vain in the face of a sense of alienation or because of cultural barriers.   We hope and strive to act as your platform, your voice and your little community away from home, and ultimately to provide you with that sense of belonging that every student away from Pakistan, whether temporarily or for good, craves. We also aim to bridge the gap between ourselves and other student communities, nationalities and societies, and hence share our culture, values and traditions, as well as remove misconceptions regarding these, with all those around us.  Make sure you do everything from your side to stay connected to know all about our events. Email us on: paksoc.manchester@hotmail.co.uk  Like our Facebook page - https://www.facebook.com/Paksoc.manchester  Follow us on Instagram: https://instagram.com/paksoc Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/uompaksoc

name: Palaeontology Society (PalaeoSoc)
description: Manchester Palaeontological Society is a student-ran University of Manchester academic society.  Our aim is to encourage interest in palaeo-fields, providing a fun educational environment for experts and beginners alike.    If you have an interest in dinosaurs, extinct animals, palaeontology and natural history then this is the ideal society for you. Manchester PalaeoSoc is a student-led academic society that specialises in these fields. Our activities, seminars and events are ideal for students just starting university, geologists-in-training, zoologists, biologists and general enthusiasts alike. During this semester we'll be planning to run the following events: - Interactive tutorials and seminars on the creation of accurate palaeontological art  - Informal sessions providing aid for students taking palaeontology-related courses (e.g. fossil recognition, palaeo-environmental interpretation) - Museum and exhibition trips (stay tuned for more info!) For society news and other palaeo-related content, like our facebook page:  https://www.facebook.com/uom.palaeosoc/ https://uom-palaeosoc.weebly.com/ Here are some stellar examples of work done by the group founders: By Matt Dempsey, who'll be running interactive courses on the creation, history and critique of palaeontological art: (See more at https://www.artstation.com/sketchy-raptor or @sketchy_raptor on Twitter)   Or Natalia Jagielska, our society chair/founder and digital artist:

name: Persian Society (UMPS)
description: Welcome to the University of Manchester Persian Society!   “Here with a Loaf of Bread beneath the Bough,  A Flask of Wine, a Book of Verse  and Thou  Beside me singing in the Wilderness   And Wilderness is Paradise enow."   ~ Excerpt from the Rubaiyat of Omar Khayyam (1st Edition). First translated by Edward Fitzgerald in 1859. Omar Khayyam (Persian mathematician, astronomer, philosopher and poet; born 18 May 1048 and died 4 December 1131).   We aim to promote the understanding and appreciation of Persian culture. We offer this in the context of comity, as in the mutual respect and cooperation between peoples.   We provide opportunities for participation in cultural events and activities on themes such as arts, architecture, calligraphy, crafts, cuisine, family, fashion, film, folklore, food, games, history, language, literature, music, mythology, painting, philosophy of gardens, photography, poetry, recipes, storytelling, and theatre.   The Persian Society is part of the University of Manchester Students Union and operates on a voluntary, not-for-profit basis. It is not affiliated to any political party and does not support any particular religion.   Visit us at our Facebook Page , Website (www.UMPS.org.uk), Telegram, Instagram.

description: The society is run by pharmacy students from the University of Manchester and welcomes all pharmacy students to join.  MUPS organises careers events which broaden and deepen your knowledge of various career paths, whilst we also run many social events throughout the year which aim to bring everyone closer together. Furthermore, we were nominated for the best academic society last year and are held in high regard not just within the school but across the university as well. If you are an MPharm student then joining MUPS is a MUST! name: Photography Society
description: Welcome to the Photography Society! Do you have an interest in photography? Have you got a camera that you're not sure how to use and want to have a go? Is there something new you'd like to try? Then come along to our events and you can learn skills that range from studio photography to night-time photography to darkroom techniques. All levels are welcome; from beginners to the more experienced, there will always be someone there to help you. If you would like to develop your own film, scan some negatives or make your own darkroom prints, then there is also a darkroom for you to use. All the chemicals and equipments are provided.  (But you need to be a member of the society!) We also provide photography-related job opportunities for our members.  Membership is £10.00 for the whole year!   Please check out our FAQs before signing up.    The Boring Bit ~Before being able to use our facilities you will need to register and pay online through this website. ~If you've never used the darkroom before you will need to have an induction before you're allowed to use it unless you are confident that you can operate a basic dark room, in which case you can quickly go over the basic settings in the darkroom with our darkroom masters. ~If you would like some more information of any of the things mentioned above or want to see our events please join our Facebook page at: www.facebook.com/UoMPhotoSoc or email us on: photosocmanchester@gmail.com

name: Pint of Science
description: DISCLAIMER:  This Society is predominantly aimed at POSTGRADUATES and ACADEMICS (PGRs, PDRAs etc.). There has been significant interest so far from undergraduate students. If you are an undergraduate student and would still like to register your interest for the society, feel free to do so, as we will be able to make you aware of upcoming socials and events to attend. However, be aware that it is unlikely that you will be offered a place on an organising group for one of the themes, as priority will be given to postgraduate students and PDRAs.   The Pint of Science festival aims to deliver interesting and relevant talks on the latest science research in an accessible format to the public – all in the pub! We want to provide a platform which allows people to discuss research with the people who carry it out - no prior knowledge of the subject is required. It is run mainly by volunteers and was established by a community of postgraduate and postdoctoral researchers in 2012. The main festival takes place annually over three days in the month of May simultaneously in pubs across the world. Pint of Science is a non-profit organisation.” – ‘What Is Pint Of Science?’, https://pintofscience.co.uk/about/   The society aims to organise wide-ranging public engagement events, showcasing the latest research from Manchester’s scientific institutions. We want to consistently expand our range of topics and speakers. We also aim to engage with other public engagement events and organisations, such as Manchester Science Festival, to better promote both Pint of Science and the scientific research being carried out in Manchester.

name: Planet Bee Magazine Society
description: PLANET BEE MAGAZINE — UoM’s Independent Science Publication   Whether you are interested in writing, art, graphic design, marketing, or editing, we are looking for any students who are passionate about science communication and interested in the opportunity to be part of a student-led science magazine with a circulation of 2,000 physical copies. This is a brilliant opportunity to improve your skillset with dedicated workshops to produce a physical product which you can use to impress in any job interview.   Our meetings are held in Simon 2.57 at 6:30pm on Tuesdays. The first meeting will be held on the 4th of February Find us on Facebook: www.facebook.com/PlanetBeeMagazine Website: planetbeemagazine.wordpress.com Twitter: PlanetBeeMag Instagram: PlanetBeeMag

name: Platypus Society
description: The Platypus society organises film screenings, reading groups, public fora, research and journalism focused on problems and tasks inherited from the old (1920s-30s), new (1960s-70s) and post-political (1980s-90s) Left, for the possibilities of emancipatory politics today. Everyone is welcome to join, come and learn more with us about philosophy, politics, history, Marxism, socialism and communism. At University of Manchester, we currently hold a weekly reading group on the history of the left, weekly social coffee breaks, organise panel discussions and reading groups, and group trips to radical/Marxist/socialist/anarchist events. We also distribute the Platypus Review, a monthly open-submission journal. Like our facebook page! :   Weekly reading group meets 6-8pm Tuesdays via Zoom. For full details please visit platypus1917.org/manchester-uk Weekly coffee breaks are at 5-6pm Thursdays, via Zoom. For up to date info on coffee breaks follow our facebook page on facebook.com/platypusmanchester To join either or both of our events, please write to london@platypus1917.org, or message us on facebook.com/platypusmanchester. These will both wrap up for the summer on the 4th June 2020. We plan to re-start both regular events in September 2020.   Don't forget to join the group (at the top of the page) to keep up to date on new events. It's all free!   Pick up a copy of the monthly Platypus Review: The Hive, 1st floor, Students Union, Oxford Road, Manchester M13 9PR:  Past Manchester Platypus event posters:  Sunday 16 December 2018, 12 noon: Cottonopolis, Capital of the Industrial Revolution: A Walking Tour

name: PLUMs (University of Manchester)
description: The Planning and Landscape University of Manchester Society 2017/18 First and foremost, we would like to express our warm welcome to those whom are new or returning to this 2017/18 academic year visiting the Student's Union webpage for the Planning and Landscape University of Manchester Society, otherwise known as PLUMS.   Who we are Society Chair - Michelle Graney Society Vice Chair - Jai Sidhu Society Secretary - Courteney Cox Society Treasurer - Ellie Young Society Ambassador - Alanna Mahoney   What we do The objective of the society is to provide an opportunitiy to those studying a planning, real estate or environmental related undegraduate or postgraduate degree in the School of Environment, Education and Development at the University of Manchester to come together as members and socialise with each other outside of contract hours.  The society has several organised events throughout the academic calender which provide a great opportunity to make friends within and across various student year groups as well as lecture and research staff.  We look forward to meeting and seeing you at our next event so be sure keep in touch with our media links below to find out all about it.   Facebook Search: "Official PLUMSociety (University of Manchester)" https://www.facebook.com/groups/1170934889645781/  Twitter Search: "PlumSocietyMCR" https://twitter.com/PlumSocietyMCR Instagram Search: "PlumSocietyMCR" http://instagram.com/plumsocietymcr  Email Plumsmanchester@hotmail.com or Michelle.graney@student.manchester.ac.uk   ______________________________________________________________________________________________ If you wish to put forward any questions or suggestions then feel free to contact us via any of the above media links.

name: Poker
description: The aim of this society is to allow people with an interest in poker to come together in a friendly and informal setting, and learn how to play poker / improve their existing poker skills. We will also aim to make learning and playing poker stress-free and fun.

name: Pole Fitness
description: ***JOIN OUR Facebook group TO SIGN UP FOR CLASSES and to stay up to date with events and socials!*** ***JOIN OUR Whatsapp Chat for other communications*** Our society is for anyone who loves, or would love to try pole fitness! We hold weekly classes for complete beginners to advanced dancers that will improve overall health, strength, and flexibility, whilst being a lot of fun and not feeling like a workout! Most people are total beginners when they come to our classes and they are always shocked at how quickly they progress! Our classes are held in Bodybarre Studio, 33-35 Thomas Street, Northern Quarter. Classes are booked as PAYG classes for £6.50 for members and £8.50 for non-members.  Membership is £16 for the year and or £10 for semester 2 only will get you discounts on classes, jams, workshops, hoodies and exclusive access to some socials, etc! :) We also offer Strech 'N' Snack session where you can work on your flexibility and Pole Jams where you can practice any new pole moves learned during the week! We hope to see you soon! Email - uofmpole@gmail.com Facebook -https://www.facebook.com/groups/2320701135646 Instagram - @polefitnesssoc_uom T's&C's  -You have to be in time for the warm-up to take part in the session, as it's part of the studio's policies.  -We are not obliged to refund your ticket if you are late for the warm-up.   To avoid this please turn up at least 5 mins early and ready in your gear. (preferably 15 mins early if you need to change)

name: Polish Students' Society (PolSoc)
description: Polish Student Society was set up to support the growth of interest in Polish culture. We wish to unite Polish students studying at  The University of Manchester as well as to engage non-Polish members to discover Poland and its culture. Our predominant aim is to create friendly environment where students can exchange their cultural experience, cultivate national traditions and enrich their perception of the world. When organising our events, we collaborate with the Consulate General of the Republic of Poland in Manchester.    We definetlely want to share our love for Polish food, music, literature and customs with everyone so join us today and have fun while eating pierogi.  For more information please contact: uompolishsociety@gmail.com Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/groups/polsoc.manchester/

name: Politics Society
description: Welcome to the Students' Union page of the University of Manchester Politics Society   The Politics Society acts as a medium to enhance the overall political awareness, engagement and understanding at the university. Delivering and discussing international issues as well as domestic political affairs, we cater our members with numerous events such as:  -Meet your MP series -Inside foreign affairs series (Ambassadors and diplomatic figures to the UK) -Debates about current political issues, internationally and domestically -Other speaker events and workshops with notable political figures, researches, alumni etc.   We do host socials as a way for all of us to get to know each other. Alongside career events for graduate prospects, we host these on a monthly basis.  Become a member of the Politics Society: It’s easy. Click the orange bar “JOIN THIS GROUP” at the top left of this section to be registered officially as a member of the society.   By joining as an official member, you are entitled to our monthly newsletters, which provide interesting updates, upcoming events, and shout-outs, by our partners. You are also entitled to discounts on our events (that requires payment) and first-hand priority to any of our activities that are open to the public. So what are you waiting for?! Get involved, Get interested, Get political!     From The University of Manchester Politics Society Executive Committee 2015/2016   Partners:   Cancer-Research UK: Ambassador   http://www.cancerresearchuk.org/support-us/campaign-for-us/our-ambassadors   Foreign and Commonwealth Office: Know Before You Go https://www.gov.uk/knowbeforeyougo   TeachFirst: Graduate Scheme http://graduates.teachfirst.org.uk

name: QTIPOC Society
description: Welcome to the University of Manchester's first QTIPOC Society!  QTIPOC stands for Queer, Trans and Intersex, People of Colour and this society aims to represent and support anyone who comes under this umbrella term. This society is comprised of LGBT BAME students of all sexualities, gender identities, disabilities and faiths, we hope to provide a safe space where QTIPOC students can socialise and meet other QTIPOC students around the campus, create useful dialogue between our racial and sexual intersections, provide volunteering opportunities within the university as well as local community and most importantly have fun in the midst of the chaotic university life! We are aware that for most of us it may be difficult and nerving coming to LGBT spaces because of cultural upbringing or religious reasons, however fear not! The group is extremely confidential and your personal information will not be shared outside the group. (See Terms and Conditions for more information)  Please do come along as you will not regret your decision. Our socials will provide QTIPOC students the chance to get to know others all around the campus AND QTIPOC STUDENTS FROM OTHER MANCHESTER UNIVERSITIES, just so you know that we are not alone! The socials will cater to all your interests, from casual dinner outings perhaps trying out cuisines from our members' cultures to nights out at Canal St. Please note that there will always be non-alcoholic events for those who do not drink and we take into account the dietary requirements that may be needed for our members such as halal and kosher options.  If you have any questions, please email us at uomqtipoc@gmail.com c: If you are a QTIPOC student, who is interested in joining our committee email us using the email address above  Follow us on Facebook -  https://www.facebook.com/uom.qtipoc Instagram - @uom_qtipoc Twitter - https://twitter.com/uom_qtipoc Snapchat - uom_qtipoc

name: Quidditch
description: Quidditch is a mixed-gender, full-contact sport based on the sport from the Harry Potter series. It is a mixture of elements from rugby and dodgeball and is a sport now played in over 30 countries worldwide. We have two teams so whether you've played sports all of your life or you've never played a sport before, there's definitely something quidditch can offer you!    Training - Platt Fields Park  Wednesday 1-3pm  Saturday 1-4pm  FAQs: Who can join? Anybody can join! Whether you've never played a sport before or you've played sports your entire life, quidditch can stretch you whilst also being a bit of fun! The sport is mixed-gender and recognises non-binary genders so anybody is welcome. The sport is very LGBTQ+ friendly and we welcome people from all backgrounds to come and join us! What should I wear to training? Comfortable sports clothes and football/rugby boots are highly recommended. You can come in trainers to begin with but the ground is not ideal for that. You may get a little muddy so be prepared for that! Also, remember to bring plenty of water. Do I need to bring my own broom? No, you don't need to bring any of your own equipment! We will provide everything from brooms to balls to hoops! Do you fly? No. No, we do not.   Get in contact! Email: manchester.quidditch@gmail.com Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/ManchesterQuidditch Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/manchesterquidditch/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/mcrquidditch

description: The Robotics Society is a student-led society which aims to encourage students of all levels to get involved in robotics.  It offers a great opportunity to develop your practical skills outside of the course curriculum; you’ll be able to build exciting projects with state-of-the-art technology in a relaxed environment.  More importantly, it’s a great chance to meet others who are interested in robotics. The society is open to students from across the university, at all study levels. We have members studying the Foundation Year through to Postgraduates, from a range of Schools such as EEE, MACE, Computer Science,Physics, and more.

name: Rock, Metal and Alternative Society
description: To provide a large, active community for members of Manchester's 'alternative' subcultures, such as Punk, Metal, Goth and Rock. • To engage in a variety of activities throughout the year, such as taking part in city trips, running entertainment events, producing compilation CDs, and creating gigs for local bands in order to help preserve and strengthen the diverse subcultures across Manchester, and help new students become more easily integrated into them. Objectives for the New Academic Year • Establish a regular club night in association with the society. • Create gigs for local and other small bands. • Review the society name. • Reaffirm the importance of the committee in governing the society. • Graphics: Introduce a new text-based logo and relevant background, ensure aesthetic consistency between different forms of media. • Create a mailing list. • Work closely with other relevant societies. • Compile a CD of various local artists. • Find a suitable venue for use as a regular meeting point each week and build rapport with other venues around the city. • Produce a variety of physical material including leaflets, merchandise, and visual advertisement, such as a sign. • Create financial transparency by publishing monthly account overviews, records of expenses, forecasts, etc. with appropriate reference material included. • Retain records of all business proceedings, from contracted work to venue hire, including relevant financial information, contact details, and details of society members responsible. • Carry out events throughout the year, including city trips, Christmas and end of year events, films, quizzes, etc. as well as charitable and fundraising activities.

name: Romanian Society
description: We are Romanian Society Manchester! The activity of the Romanian Society started in 2009 and has ever since grown, having members from all around Romania as well as foreigners interested in the Romanian culture. As a team we are working together to help integrate freshmen at the University of Manchester as well as connecting Romanian students and entrepreneurs, both in Manchester and the UK. SOCIALS     We organise a variety of events and socials that promote and celebrate the Romanian culture! Some of them may be parties, pub crawls, small events or even conferences!     MEMBERS Our members come from different countries and backgrounds. We care about our members and try to make their experience with us an amazing one!      -Enable our members to interact and share ideas.   -Provide insight into Romanian cultural, social and political environment.   -Organise exhibitions, cultural festivals and other events.   -Act as a voice for the concerns and ideas of our members.   -Provide support and guidance for our members.   -Entertainment in forms of social events, sports events and different activities.   Interested? Follow us:  Facebook page | Facebook group  Email us: rosocumsu@gmail.com

name: Rotaract Manchester International
description: Rotaract is a unique international service organisation for people aged 18-30, offering a wide range of activities that will enable you to try something new, whilst having a great time and meeting others. The purpose of Rotaract is to provide an opportunity for young men and women to enhance the knowledge and skills that will assist them in personal development, to address the physical and social needs of their communities, and to promote better relations between all people worldwide through a framework of friendship and service. The goals of Rotaract are:  To develop professional and leadership skills; To emphasize respect for the rights of others, and to promote ethical standards and the dignity of all useful occupations; To provide opportunities for young people to address the needs and concerns of the community and our world; To provide opportunities for working in cooperation with sponsoring Rotary clubs; and To motivate young people for eventual membership in Rotary.  Originally founded in the United States in 1968, Rotaract came to the UK and Ireland in the early 1970s. There are just currently over 60 clubs in the Great Britain and Ireland (GB&I), and more than 7,500 clubs across 155 countries worldwide. History of Rotaract Rotaract originally began as a Rotary International youth program in 1968 at Charlotte North Rotary Club in Charlotte, North Carolina, USA. Since that point Rotaract has grown into a major Rotary-sponsored organisation of over 9,500 clubs spread around the world boasting in excess of 200,000 members. “Rotaract” stands for “Rotary in Action”, although the name originally comes from a combination of “Rotary” and “Interact” (International & Action), the high school level program created by Rotary International in 1962. To be eligible for membership, prospective members must be 18–30 years of age and show that they are committed to Rotaract and helping in their community. After being approved by the club, prospective members are ‘inducted’ to become members, also known as ‘Rotaractors’. https://www.rotaract.org.uk/ Meetings held on Wednesday's at the University of Manchester Students' Union  Time: TBC

name: Royal Naval Unit
description: The aim of the URNU is to broaden Naval understanding and develop undergraduates who show the potential to become the leaders of tomorrow, through maritime experience and exposure to the values and ethos of the Royal Navy. The main aspect we use to achieve this is HMS Biter, our P2000 Patrol Ship. Crewed by full-time Royal Naval staff, she is used to give students experience of being at sea, as well as hands-on training in navigation and seamanship.  Beyond this, we hold weekly training nights at the University Barracks, alongside a huge range of sports and social events.    Membership of this page does not constitute membership of the URNU. To join the unit, either attend our Open Evenings in Fresher's week, or contact us on Facebook; https://www.facebook.com/msurnu.

name: Run Wild
description: Run Wild Manchester is a free weekly running society open to all abilities! We are first and foremost a community. We encourage one another to live a healthy lifestyle and reap the benefits of feeling energetic. To keep upto date with everything Run Wild we encourage you to like and follow our Facebook Page: https://www.facebook.com/RunWildMCR  Regular Sessions:  ★ Saturday - parkrun    Location: Platt Fields Park, by the Boat House   Time: Arrive at 08:45. Run starts at 09:00   Distance: 5km   We run at our own pace, and then meet at the end for a warm down. Afterwards we all get breakfast together!    You can register here: https://www.parkrun.org.uk/register/   If you want a time you will need to bring a printed barcode with you.   If you already regularly parkrun please add Run Wild MCR as your club on your profile, you can do this by editing your profile here: https://www.parkrun.com/signin/   ★ Sunday Great Run Local Birchfields    Location: Birchfields Park, Birch Grove entrance.    Time: Arrive at 10:55. Run starts at 11:00   Distance: 2 or 5 km   Pace: We run at our own pace, then meet at the end.   Register here: https://www.greatrunlocal.org/events/north-west/manchester/birchfields-park-5k   ★ Races    We encourage members to take part in races, as it offers a good goal to train for.    The Manchester Relays: https://www.facebook.com/events/372619230285428/   Wilmslow 10K: https://www.facebook.com/events/749185195508843/   ★ Merch Link to Bulk Order Page (Far Cheaper than the Team Store): https://manchesterstudentsunion.com/groups/run-wild/events/run-wild-merchandise-order Link to Team Store: https://serioussport.co.uk/teamwear/stores/run-wild-mcr/ ★ Awards   Sports & Recreation Society of the Year 2019   Committee of the Year 2019   3rd Place Student Group - The University of Manchester Volunteer of the Year Awards 2019   Sports & Recreation Society of the Year 2018   Sports & Recreation Society of the Year 2016   ★ FAQs WHO CAN JOIN? Anybody. Whatever your speed, there is a place for you. WHAT SHOULD I WEAR? Comfortable clothes and well-fitting trainers that provide you with a suitable level of grip.  CAN I LISTEN TO MUSIC? We ask that members don't wear headphones. This is so that you can hear the instructions by the leaders, and be aware of any traffic. Headphones also discourage conversation! HOW CAN I GET MORE INVOLVED? Submit new running routes, lead training sessions, greet new faces, enter a race with other members, or simply come along each week...the list is endless. Drop us an email or talk to us in person about your ideas! Social Media Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/RunWildMCR Instagram: https://instagram.com/runwildmcr/ Email: runwildmcr@live.com

name: Saudi Scientific Society
description: الجمعية العلمية السعودية بجامعة مانشستر  Saudi Scientific Society (SSSTUOM) Our Vision To be the best in creating and providing an integrated and distinguished environment for the Saudi students in Manchester. Our Mission To contribute in developing and honing the skills of Saudi students in Manchester in all scientific, academic, and training fields.   Contact us Twitter: @SSSTUOM    Facebook: @SSSTUOM                  Email: SSSTUOM@gmail.com All Saudi and non-Saudi students are eligible for membership; whether from inside or outside the city of Manchester.

name: Save Our Staff MCR
description: We originally formed in 2017/18 to fight job losses & defend pensions. Since then we have worked on building discussions around workers rights & marketisation. We want to support the fight against casualisation, discuss free education, focus on the causes of mental health at uni and link up with other univeristies and causes around Manchester and across the UK, As a group we feel that the UCU strikes in 2018 has revitalised the importance of unionisation and solidarity between students and staff across the UK, and this in tow has inspired the student movement to fight against the continual marketisation of our education system.  If you would like to get involved these are links to our facebook page, group and twitter: https://www.facebook.com/groups/454646654869098/ https://www.facebook.com/SOSMCR/ twitter: @sos_mcr If you do not have social media then you are welcome to contact us on email on: saveourstaff.manchester@gmail.com Solidarity Forever!

name: Scalpel Surgical Society
description: Scalpel is the University of Manchester’s Surgical Society, which represents and hopes to further medical student interest in surgery, and a partner of the Royal College of Surgeons of England.   Scalpel was originally formed in 2001, but it was not until 2006 that a core group of Manchester medical students re-formed the society under guidance from the Royal College of Surgeons, creating Scalpel as we know it today. Since this re-invention of itself, Scalpel has gone from strength to strength and currently has approximately 900 members.   As an undergraduate surgical society, Scalpel has three key aims:    To organise events that showcase surgery and all of its specialties, To excite and enthuse students about surgery, To provide students who are interested in surgery with relevant careers information and advice.    Scalpel hopes to achieve these aims by organising talks and workshops delivered by charismatic surgeons from each and every surgical specialty. We want to get students excited about surgery early on so that they can start to consider whether they want to choose surgery as a career. With competition for surgical jobs becoming more and more fierce, students are being forced to consider their career options earlier than ever before. Therefore students hoping for a career in surgery must start to think about how to make themselves more competitive and Scalpel hopes to help these students by organising surgical careers events and by providing students with surgical role models.   Scalpel also seeks to encourage students from minorities into surgery, whether those minorities are ethnic, gender or otherwise by inviting role models from all walks of life as speakers at Scalpel events. Women in Surgery (WinS) events are a frequent feature of Scalpels events calendar, and a diverse range of speakers ensures the calendar remains of a high calibre and continues to be interesting and relevant.   In 2009 Scalpel held their first ever national conference providing delegates with the opportunity to present their case reports and original research to an audience of esteemed clinicians and students. The conference proved to be a resounding success and it has now become a major annual event which is attended by medical students from all across the UK and beyond.   We are delighted by your interest in our work and look forward to meeting you!   Make sure you check our website for more details about us; like us on facebook and follow us on twitter to keep up to date with all our events. Send an email if you have any queries or want to find out more!   WEBSITE: http://www.scalpelmanchester.com/   FACEBOOK: https://www.facebook.com/scalpel.manchester   TWITTER: @scalpel_mcr   EMAIL: info@scalpelmanchester.com

name: School of Biological Sciences Society (SoBSS)
description: Welcome!   We are the School of Biological Sciences Society, SoBSS for short. We invite undergraduate and postgraduate students of all disciplines in Biological Sciences to join us:   Anatomical Sciences, Biochemistry, Biology, Biology with Sciences and Society, Biomedical Sciences, Biotechnology, Cell Biology, Cognitive Neuroscience and Psychology, Developmental Biology, Genetics, Life Sciences, Medical Biochemistry, Microbiology, Molecular Biology, Neuroscience (BSc and MNeuroSci), Optometry, Pharmacology, Pharmacology and Physiology, Physiology, Plant Science and Zoology. This includes the courses with a Foundation Year, with Industrial Experience and those with a Language (German, French, Spanish, Italian, Japanese, Mandarin Chinese).   While there are smaller societies for the individual courses, we cover the wide range of Biological Sciences at the University of Manchester. Membership is available for one year or the duration of your course, 3 or 4 years. It includes:  Discounts on our socials including the SoBSS lab coat pub crawl, general nights out and SoBSS quiz nights Discounts on our big events, such as the bi-annual SoBSS Ball Free access to academic events such as lecture series Support from the society throughout your time at University Discounts on day trips and activities Ability to purchase SoBSS merchandise such as our hoodies!  Find us on online:  Facebook https://www.facebook.com/groups/776915199109788/  Any questions, please email sobssoc@gmail.com

name: Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics Society (STEMSoc)
description: We aim to encourage more students to pursue a career in the STEM subjects, acting as a platform, connecting potential volunteers with volunteering opportunities. We also aim to bridge the gender imbalance in the STEM subjects.   We conduct many outreach activities in science subjects by visiting libraries and primary schools. We provide these students with an opportunity to interact with current STEM students, which will encourage them to pursue a career in the STEM subjects.  What does STEMsoc do?   Code club: code club is a nationwide network of free after-school computer programming clubs for children aged 9 to 11. Once a week, we help run an after-school club, teaching the children the basics of computer programming starting from 'scratch' to HTML.  Travel Lab: We visit libraries on weekends and run interesting table-top activities. Student-led lectures on STEM: Organise STEM-based introductory lectures in a local library. All students enthusiastic about science and any particular topic in science are encouraged to give short talks to young students. Tabletop science (one-off events): Run activity based stalls at science fairs or schools. For example, last year we made musical instruments out of vegetables and programmed Arduino with primary students!   We also do other STEM outreach events, if there are any outreach events you are interested in doing let us know and we can help you set it up.  For more information please email our society chair Soumya Shreeram on committee@stemsoc.org.uk or find us on facebook.

name: Scuba Diving (Sub Aqua Club)
description: We are the Scuba Diving society for the University of Manchester. We are branch number 9197 of BSAC (the British Sub Aqua Club), the leading UK diving club and the sport's national governing body. We operate as a club as opposed to a diving school/tour operator but we still run dive training and trips for our members, who join us at all levels of diving ability from novice to instructor! We run many non-diving club activities throughout the year and for many the social side of the club is just as rewarding as the diving side!   Our active members range from students to staff, alumni and those who are unaffiliated to the university.    Social meet-ups are on a Tuesdays at The Students Union on Oxford Road from 8.00pm.  Information on the various training options can be found by asking on our facebook page: http://www.fb.com/musacdiving If you're qualified with another diving association then you are still more than welcome to join, for more information about crossing over visit: bsac.com/already-qualified If you would like to ask a question via email: manunisac@gmail.com

name: Sexpression Manchester
description: Sexpression educates young people in sex and relationship issues and aims to empower them to make informed choices about their reproductive health. Students deliver interactive and informal sessions in local schools and youth groups, creating a relaxed environment to learn about sexual health and broach sensitive topics. Sexpression MCR also delivers STI testing thoughout campus through the RUClear service and run sex-positive events. We are a part of Sexpression:UK a nationwide organisation.  To be notified about events and volunteering opportunities, join us online at: https://www.facebook.com/groups/734121699943707/?fref=ts (It's a closed group - don't worrry you will be added in!)  Like our Facebook page:- https://www.facebook.com/SexpressionMCR For more information contact: manchester@sexpression.org.uk

name: Shakespeare Society
description: Hello and welcome to the University of Manchester's Shakespeare Society! We are a performance based society that aims to create an outlet for students interested in the works of William Shakespeare and other contemporary Elizabethan and Jacobean writers, as well as how Shakespeare has been portrayed and adapted in contemporary theatremaking. We aim to put on three productions a year and hold showcases, where students can give a go at writing, directing or acting without the stress of a full show. Through our productions, workshops and general ethos we seek to keep exploring new ways in which students can discover and appreciate the works of these authors. Follow us on facebook to keep uptaded with all latest news about auditions and shows at https://www.facebook.com/UoMShakeSoc 'We are such things as dreams are made of'.

name: Shooting Club

Our aim is to work with schools to train teachers and to provide them with a set structure of teaching. With the help of our resources we are aiming to build a set standard of testing a pupils literacy age. Volunteer for us in our quest for a better world.

name: Sing It!
description: Love singing? Shower singer or seasoned chorister? Experienced performer or complete newcomer? Want to develop your voice and have a break from the stress of Uni with a bunch of lovely people?    As long as you love singing, this is your choir!  Sing It!  is a 4-part mixed a cappella choir that welcomes anyone and everyone to make the most of the mental health benefits of singing with a group, whilst making some beautiful harmonies and music!   We're an inclusive, happy and passionate bunch who sing for the absolute love of it and don't audition, so everyone can make the most of the mental health benefits of a choir. We do, though, have opportunities to perform, compete, and get top-level coaching if you want to take them, and you'll love the sound we make, even if rehearsal is all about relaxing!   We sing a whole range of styles, from jazz to folk to barbershop to pop to more classic choral stuff, and the diversity of our group and what we do is a big part of what makes choir, for us, so fun.   For more info, to drop us a question, or to see us in action, check out our:  Website Instagram Facebook  Youtube​​​​​  Or drop us an email at singit.chair@gmail.com   So come along to a rehearsal to chill out, meet people, sing some beautiful music, and see what we're all about: Where? ~ Dance Studio, UoM Students' Union When? ~ Wednesdays 6-8pm   First rehearsal and social event Wednesday 18th September, followed by the official 'Give It A Go' the following week, and then a 'Learn To Sing' course! (First rehearsal is always free)        We welcome people of all ages, gender identities and orientations, whether a UoM student, a non-UoM student, or not a student at all. If there is something we can do to be more accessible, please let us know! You aren't required to read music but we do provide sheet music and MP3 tracks for all of our songs.

name: SMART Combat
description: Scientific Martial Arts (SMART) – a systematic and modern approach to martial arts. We emphasise self defence from day one, but within our foundation is a much deeper level of martial arts. Our system We develop people both mentally and physically. The sessions work by starting small and building up progressively. The classes are a mixture of simple exercises to build up your basic skills (timing, balance, structure, flexibility, power) and practising realistic self defence situations. There are also smaller intensive group lessons where we delve deeper into the system. Our classes Our main classes are on Mondays and Thursdays from 6.30 - 8.30pm in the Trinity Sports Hall (<5 minutes from the University). You can come to classes once a week or twice, it's up to you. Periodically we also run women's self defence courses - information on the next course will be posted on our facebook page, stay tuned. Accessibility Our classes and events are open to anyone of any ability and we do not discriminate based on age, gender, sexuality, race, religion or other. Our training venue is wheelchair accessible, and has free car and bicycle parking. If you have any queries regarding accessibility please contact us primiarly via our facebook page or alternatively email manc@smartmartialarts.org. Seminars and socials Our society runs seminars and workshops in addition to the regular classes we offer. These will usually focus on a more specific aspect of self defence, such as weapons defence or multiple assailants. We also organise regular socials, ranging from pub visits to paintballing. For the most up to date info on these socials, visit our facebook page. We are a very open and friendly group with a good mix of people, and as always, everyone is welcome! Pricing and contact The first week is of training is completely free, so come along and find out exactly how fun it is; whether you want to learn for self defence, to try out an new martial art, make new friends or just want to get fit, all are welcome!   Visit us: www.facebook.com/SmartMartialArtsManchester

name: Socialist Students
description: Socialist Students organises in universities, colleges and schools all over the country. We have groups on over 40 campuses – which meet regularly to discuss and debate the politics of changing the world . But Socialist Students does more than just discuss. We are active in the struggle to change things. We organise and mobilise students to defend education, fight war and racism and to campaign on a wide range of other issues relevant to our members. We organise democratically, and hold regular national meetings and events. Join us and get involved!   Visiti us at:- http://socialiststudents.org.uk/wp/ http://www.facebook.com/groups/331020466948730/

name: Socialist Worker Student Society
description: SWSS is the student group of the Socialist  Workers Party.  We are a revolutionary socialist group who actively campaign against all forms of oppression, imperialism and attacks on our living standards.  We hold weekly meetings on a broad range of topics and help build a variety of campaigns. We stand: - Against Tory cuts and for free education - For the liberation of Palestine - For a radical solution to climate change - Against the racist BNP and EDL - For LGBT and Women's Liberation

description: The Spanish Society aims to share the Spanish culture among the University community. It is not exclusively targeted at Spaniards, but rather at anyone interested in culture, language, traditions and food! We host a wide variety of events throughout the year where you can have a taste of the Spanish culture. We hope you are as excited as we are, and are looking forward to seeing you in many of our events!! name: Speech & Language Therapy
description: Hello and welcome to the Speech and Language Therapy Society!  Speech and Language Therapists play a vital role in many people's lives who live with speech, language, communication and swallowing impairments. Meeting these needs is of vital importance and we wish to highlight how SLTs can help!  Who are we?  The SLT society is a student led organisation with a predominate focus to ‘give voice’ and raise awareness for those with communication and swallowing needs.  Our society welcomes membership from everyone who is passionate about promoting the need for inclusive communication and supporting those with speech, language and swallowing needs. We are free to join so it couldn't be easier to get involved!  Our Aims:  - By campaigning and supporting related charities we wish to raise awareness for those with communication and swallowing difficulties, and be a force for positive change!  - We wish to increase awareness of the work speech and language therapists undertake and the valuable role they play in the healthcare profession.  - We aim to enhance your university experience by creating a group of likeminded students who can socialise and support each other throughout this year. Socials will be inclusive and we will plan events to cater for everyone.  - We aim to run a variety of events which you will be informed about in advance through our monthly newsletter. In addition to campaigning we will welcome guest speakers and there will be opportunities to visit stammering support groups which are held at the university. However, this is YOUR society if there are certain events you would like us to run don't be scared to let us know! We want to work for you!  Get Involved…  We would love everybody to be involved as much or as little as you like! Look out for information about:  Society Meetings– we would love to hear what you want out of the society.  Socials–we will be releasing information about socials our first one will involve tea and cake! Newsletters– we will send out emails and newsletters to our members about upcoming events.

name: Speleology Club (MUSC)
description: MUSC is a group of friendly faces who have a habit of going underground. Be it weekend trips, day trips or socials, a MUSC gathering is bound to be fun.  We have weekly socials on Wednesday evenings, and usually five or six weekend trips a term, as well as a number of day and evening trips. You don’t need to have been caving before to join us, we take people of all abilities. The underground world is a spectacular place and we’d love to share it with you. We look forward to seeing you around! Website: https://sites.google.com/site/musccaving/ Facebook group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/2420950125/ Email: committee.musc@gmail.com

name: Sports and Exercise Medicine Society (SEMSoc)
description: SEMSoc (The Sport and Exercise Medicine Society) SEMSoc was re founded in 2010, by a group of medical students at the University of Manchester, after its original formation in 2008. Over the past few years.   The society has sought to educate and inform undergraduates through monthly lectures, seminars, educational resources and contacts to other SEM professionals.   Open to all undergraduates with an interest in sports and exercise, including medical students, physiotherapists and sports therapists, it encompasses the same multi-discipline team approach as the specialism as a whole       To keep up to date with our latest news and events follow us on Facebook:  SEMsoc www.facebook.com/pages/SEMSoc-The-Sports-and-Exercise-Medicine-Society/167067519975604?ref=h Twitter: @semsocuk Website: www.semsocuk.com

name: Student Action for Refugees (STAR)
description: Student Action for Refugees is a society dedicated to improving the lives of refugees and asylum seekers in this country. We are part of a network of 35 university groups across the country with this same vision.  Within this society there is the opportunity to meet individuals from a myriad of cultures whose presence here is testament to their determination to hold strong to their values and flee unwarranted persecution. Joining this society will open your eyes to the hardships people undergo and the surprising barriers to integration into our society. Asylum seekers are especially vulnerable to discrimination and mental unrest due to their precarious status until proclaimed refugees. As STAR members we strive to make this country and this city as welcoming as possible and support the campaigns to change attitudes within government, media as well as the British people towards asylum seekers. Destitution, detention and barriers to higher education for asylum seekers are just a few of the consequences of policies and negative attitudes. Volunteering We run two conversation clubs to help refugees and asylum seekers to improve their English. These take place in Stockport, on a Saturday morning, and in central Manchester, during the week (TBC). Campaigning Last year, we successfully campaigned with the Still Human Still Here network by sleeping out against destitution. Two weeks later, Manchester City Council unanimously passed a motion against destitution. This year, building on past campaigns, we will be campaigning for Equal Access to higher education for asylum seekers. We will be asking the University of Manchester to create two fully funded scholarships for asylum seekers. This campaign's Facebook page:https://www.facebook.com/pages/Equal-Access-MCR/180521355476778?fref=ts       Contact us on: star-manchester@hotmail.com   Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/groups/29431783319/   Twitter     -  STARManchester

name: Student Action Volunteering
description: We're the community volunteering society at the Students' Union.  We run a huge number of student-led weekly volunteering projects and one off events helping people in the local community. From supporting refugees and asylum seekers in improving their English, to providing Manchester’s homeless rough sleepers with a hot drink and a friendly chat in the winter months, Student Action offers something to fit everyone’s interests. We also run projects involving the environment, vulnerable women, adults with accessibility needs, elderly people, and children. For more info, click here.  When you find a project that interests you, all you need to do is sign up to the volunteer hub and start volunteering! You can also like our facebook page for any updates throughout the year!   Email us at info@studentaction.co.uk with any questions you might have :)

name: Student Inspire Network
description: DON'T KNOW WHAT YOU WANT TO DO AFTER UNI? Watch our videos of students who have been through the process and secured: Work experience, internships and graduate jobs and be inspired! We aim to educate, motivate and inspire students to start thinking about their career and start working towards it by creating informal videos by students who have been through the process and secured internships, apprenticeships, graduate jobs, societies, exchange programmes, startups or any work experience. We want to help students currently trying to achieve their goals to feel motivated, inspired and educated to take action. The idea is to create inspiration FOR students BY students.  Current ONS statistics show that over 65% of 16-25 year olds do not know what they want to do in life. As well as other factors, we believe that lack of tangible, relatable information on careers is unavailable, and if available, it is usually tied up in lengthy online articles and other written pieces that often make relevant information too difficult to be accessible. We believe that in order to help OUR generation, we must adapt to changes in technology and be in line with how our generation consumes information. This is mainly through short snappy informal videos on social media.   WANT TO FEATURE IN ONE OF OUR VIDEOS? Have you been through the process and secured: Work experience, internships or a grad job? Want to improve your personal brand? Share you story and inspire others! Drop us a message on our Facebook page, DM us on twitter or send an email to Mils@studentInspireNetwork.com and we'll arrange a place and time to record. INSPIRE SESSIONS We organise networking events with employers ranging from Banking and Finance to Marketing and Advertising. This gives from all degreee disciplines an opportunities to find out more about the opportunities these employers offer and ask questions about applying and securing internship and graduate positions. These sessions will allow you to find out exactly what these employers look for in students and give you the best opportunity for success when applying.   Keep an eye on your email, we'll soon send you an invite to sign up to our website where you'll have access to all our videos and all the information on how to feature in one of our videos.   Follow us on social media! Facebook page - Student Inspire Network (https://www.facebook.com/StudentInspireNetwork/) Twitter - @Student_Inspire Snapchat - Student_inspire   STUDENT INSPIRE NETWORK! EDUCATE. MOTIVATE. INSPIRE

name: Swing Dance Society
description: Hello, and welcome to Swing Soc! We are based in the University of Manchester and we welcome everyone!   WHAT IS IT Swing Dancing is a partnered (improvised) social dance, dating back to the great Swing Era of the 20s, 30s and 40s in the USA. It developed among the African American community – most famously in Harlem – and was danced to the big bands of Duke Ellington, Count Basie, and others.   WHERE We normally hold lessons in the Dance Studio of the SU. Sometimes the venue may change so make sure to check the Facebook event first! Our fortnightly social, Tipple Step, runs every other Sunday in Revolution Oxford Road. It is completely free and we get food and drinks discounts!   WHEN Every Friday 6:30-7:15 – Improvers lesson 7:30-8:15 – Beginners lesson 8:30-Late – Social dancing Pub afterwards!   HOW MUCH Single class: £3 3 classes: £5 10 classes: £15 These do not need to be used consecutively, if you have a pass, you can pick and choose what lessons you come to!   WHAT TO BRING No partner or experience needed! Just bring yourself and a comfy pair of shoes, preferably ones that don’t have too much grip. Water will be provided but we recommend you bring your own water bottle.   OUR COMMITTEE Co-chairs: Lauren Forrest, Diana Espirito Secretary: Helen Mortimer Treasurer: Tyler Bryce Safety and inclusion officer: Cassie Cox Social media: Kat Wójcik And many more!   SOCIAL MEDIA Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/groups/MUSDS/ Instagram - https://www.instagram.com/swingdancemcr/?hl=en

name: Team Pangaea
description: Pangaea Festival organising group, comprised of Decor and Theme Team, Bookings Team and Promotions Team. Make Pangaea Great Again Pangaea Festival began in 2006 when an ambitious bunch of students from The University of Manchester decided to throw an all-night party off their own bat, which had real variety and great value for money. At its peak, Pangaea was Europe’s largest student festival, featuring incredible artists such as Clean Bandit, Mr Scruff and Wiley, as well as having over 15 individual rooms every festival. Since then, we feel Pangaea has forgotten where it came from, progressively having fewer and fewer students involved in every aspect of the festival. It’s time for students to take back control, and curate a festival for students by students. It’s time to Make Pangaea Great Again. It's time to join Team Pangaea Now.  ___________________ Join the Facebook Group to stay in the loop: https://www.facebook.com/groups/367290374186989/ ___________________ www.facebook.com/pangaeafestival www.twitter.com/pangaeafestival www.youtube.com/pangaeafestival

name: Tedx Society
description: The content and design of each TEDx event is unique and developed independently, but all TEDx events have several features in common. TED's celebrated format: A suite of short, carefully prepared talks, demonstrations and performances (live, or just TEDTalks videos from TED.com) on a wide range of subjects to foster learning, inspiration and wonder -- and to provoke conversations that matter TEDTalks videos: A minimum of two pre-recorded talks from the acclaimed TEDTalks video series (these talks are available free on TED.com) Bias-free programming: Lack of any commercial, religious or political agenda

name: TEDxUniversityofManchester
description: TEDxUniversityofManchester puts on conferences throughout the year that aim bring together bright minds to give talks that are idea-focused, and on a wide range of subjects, to foster learning, inspiration and wonder – and provoke conversations that matter.  TED is an annual event that brings together the world's leading thinkers and doers to share ideas that matter in any discipline — technology, entertainment, design, science, humanities, business, development. The talks at the conference, called TED Talks, are then made available to watch for free on TED.com. In the spirit of "ideas worth spreading," TED has created TEDx, a program of local, self-organized events that bring people together to share a TED-like experience. At a TEDx event, TED Talks video and live speakers combine to spark deep discussion and connections. Our TEDx eventss are not organized by TED Conferences, but is operated under a license from TED. For any queries, e-mail: uomtedx@gmail.com. Keep up to date with us on our Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/tedxmanchesteruniversity Founders: Emrana Khatun and Liz Tiong Li Chen

name: Thai Society
description: We aim to gather the Thai community of the Thais in Manchester. We will provide various activities, as follows: - Regular Social Events -Educational Support -Recreational and Sporting activities We are also part of the Samaggi Samagom, which is a society that includes all the other Thai societies throughout the UK. We take part in their annual sporting event (Samaggi Games) every year, in which we aim to broaden the links and network of our society. Most importantly, we would like to promote and share our culture to those who are interested.

name: The Arts and Crafts Society
description: The Arts & Crafts Society (TACS) A lot of us have had hobbies growing up that we might have dedicated less and less time to after entering the busy academic  periods of our lives. The Arts and Crafts Society (TACS) is a society that aims to provide a fun, easy-going space for people to  practice their own thing, experiment with new mediums and interact over their favourite artists.    We actively welcome people from all different skill levels and media, whether it’s painting, sketching, photography, crocheting,  embroidery, sculpture, calligraphy, journalling and more. Even if you just want to come along and socialise or watch others  work that’s totally fine too!       The details: Over the course of the year, we will organise weekly art jamming sessions in cafes/SU rooms that will also act as our socials  because we know you’re all busy bees. We will also invite local artists, from a variety of mediums, in to conduct workshops  every other month, as well as occasional group visits to art galleries or exhibitions.  At the end of the academic year we will hold a charity art sale where students can create their own merchandise like t-shirts, prints and other bits and bobs, as well as a collaborative year-end, mini art book to commemorate one years worth of hard work!   It might sound like a lot, but participation is totally optional, especially if you want to participate in only one of these events.  At the end of the day, all’s good as long as you’re having fun!    Membership: We charge a small membership fee, but don’t let that turn you away! The benefits you get is access to our communal art  supplies (which we use this membership fees to buy, so the more members, the better the supplies :9) and also discounts  to all the workshops that will be held over the year. You’ll also get a cheeky discount at a couple cafes and art stores (TBC).   Weekly Art Sessions: Our weekly art sessions are running every Saturday 2-4PM @ Room 2.5 in Students Union, UoM. The sessions are FREE for members and 2 pound for non-members, so if it's your first session feel free to come and try it out first!   If you have any questions, or just wanna give us a wee stalk: Email:  tacsuom@gmail.com Facebook Page: @tacsuom https://www.facebook.com/tacsuom/ Instagram: @tacsuom https://www.instagram.com/tacsuom/

name: The Big Change
description: The Big Change campaign is about working collaboratively to help to end homelessness, focusing on the long term. The Big Change campaign promotes alternative giving , encouraging the public to give to The Big Change fund rather than directly to beggars on the street. This is because giving money to beggars on the street often worsens the issue, and makes it harder for charities to form relationships.  Therefore The Big Change society wants to get students involved in working to end homelessness in the long run, rather than replicating services already available. We want to encourage students to work to address the long-term issues, filling gaps rather than replicating existing services. Therefore we have four objectives as a society:  1.    To fundraise for The Big Change campaign,  2.    To signpost students towards the best ways they can get involved with ending homelessness  3.    To campaign to raise awareness about areas causing homelessness, e.g housing issues,  4.    To promote responsible giving amongst students Join the Facebook group: https://www.facebook.com/thebigchangesociety/

Anyone is welcome to join, either you are an advanced or a first-time ‘cuber’！   Follow us on: Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/cubinguom/ Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/thecubingsoc_uom/

name: The Devil's Advocates
description: “The man of knowledge must be able not only to love his enemies but also to hate his friends.”   ― Friedrich Nietzsche     Welcome to The Devil's Advocates Society.  We want to bring people together by allowing them to talk and by listening carefully to their every argument.  We are tired of people labelling each other and calling the other side names such as racist, snowflake and alike.  All sides need to be heard, no matter how unreasonable they are perceived by today's society - and that is the purest definition of a cooperative free country, a way of life too often taken for granted.  Here we want to understand the other side. And what better way to do exactly that than to engage in a debate on their behalf.  Come and debate for both sides of an argument, and you are sure to get closer to bridging the current divide - and to make some good friends along the way.     Remember, we are the real many and we love the few too... Advocatus Diaboli §. Committee @ The Devil's Advocates      Contact us Email:  info@devilsadvocates.co.uk  Facebook:    Twitter:  @d_advocatesmcr  Instagram:  @devilsadvocatesmcr #WeAreMany

name: The Language Society
description: The Language Society exists to encourage the exchange of language knowledge between students of different cultures, ethnicities and nationalities. To scale the wall that stands in the way of a simple international relationship whether business or diplomatic. To make language learning free, accessible and fun to all students who have their own language to share.  This society is open to current University of Manchester students only, from all courses and countries. Our primary activity is the language exchange, done by volunteer tutors who are students whose native language is the one they are teaching. No requirements or experience are required for tutoring, so this serves as the perfect platform for tutors to gain experience and practice. Students can join us for only £1.00, and learn all the languages we have for free once you are a member! We aim to conduct classes in demand twice a month, and our primary means of communication is via Facebook. Once you become a member, please send a screenshot of your membership confirmation email to https://www.facebook.com/LanguageSoc/. Then, send a request to join our closed Facebook group (https://www.facebook.com/groups/langsocmembers/). If your name on the student system is different to your Facebook name, please let us know.  Currently, our language bank consists of the following languages, Arabic, Cantonese, French, Danish, German, Greek, Hindi, Urdu, Japanese, Malay, Mandarin, Polish, Portugese, Spanish, Thai, Turkish, Korean, Russian! For further enquiries or reporting, please send us a message at https://www.facebook.com/LanguageSoc/

name: The PPE Society
description: Open to all and free to join, the PPE Society aims to create a PPErfect community for all.  Throughout the year we run a range of acadmeic, social and charitable events including bar crawls, a speaker series, and networking events. The best way to get involved is by joining our facebook group PPE Society University of Manchester and coming along to one of our events!

name: The University of Manchester UAV Society
description: From foundation to final year, Fashion to Engineering students - UAV Society is for you! Based on North Campus, we design, create and compete our very own aircraft. From remote controlled aircraft to hexctopers (a helicopter with 6 propellers!) we cover all the bases. Expanded from 6 to 60 members within 6 months, we are becoming more and more accustomed to new faces from different educational backgrounds. Whether you love planes or want a new challege, nothing looks better on the CV or in a job interview than some real life design and hands on manufacturing. It doesn't matter if you know nothing about aircraft, our experienced leaders are here to help you become comfortable outside your comfort zone! So far we have competed against UK, Turkish and German Universities and hope to go abroad in 2014! For information please contact: artur.placha@student.manchester.ac.uk   Please join us on facebook at https://www.facebook.com/groups/336120023190642/ for latest news and updates regarding society!
