name: Tutor Trust
description: We support the charity 'The Tutor Trust' which works in over 200 schools across Greater Manchester to tutor children from disadvantaged backgrounds. We promote the charity, advertise for the recruitment of new tutors, organise socials, and fundraise for other children's charities. This year, we aim to host talent shows for tutors and students to raise money for children's causes.

name: Tutor Trust Society
description: The Tutor Trust Society is for all tutors that currently work with The Tutor Trust, any students from the UoM who would like to go into teaching in the future, any individuals who support our missions at The Tutor Trust and also anybody who wants to socialise and interact with us.    As a new society having started in UoM in 2014, we aim to hold various social events, careers workshops and fundraising events.   Your degree/discipline is not an issue for our society, the more diverse our society is, the more we will benefit and learn from each other, so please join!  We look forward to meeting you and welcome you in our society.

name: UNICEF On Campus Manchester
description: UNICEF on Campus is a society that aims to raise funds and awareness for the work of UNICEF UK which supports children by upholding their rights to childhood, education and healthcare. We do this through organizing various events and campaigning.   For more information please contact: unicefuom@gmail.com For more information, please visit: www.unicefuom.weebly.com

name: UniCS
description: UniCS is a society that ensures you enjoy and make the most out of your time at the University. Our aim is to break the stereotype that Computer Scientists don’t have fun at all. UniCS will enhance and support your evolution in the computer science field. We started out running GreatUniHack (a 24-hour hackathon in the first semester), weekly python classes, numerous talks and workshops throughout the year from companies and lecturers.   We celebrate many social events like pub crawls, pub quizzes or bowling nights. We also celebrate more technical events such as talks with professionals coding competitions and hackathons. All our events are free and open to anybody to participate so feel free to join us in any event!    Social media and other links to stay updated with cool events we do: https://www.unicsmcr.com/ https://www.instagram.com/unics_uom  https://www.facebook.com/unicsmanchester  https://www.facebook.com/groups/unicsmanchester  https://twitter.com/unics_uom

name: University of Manchester Beauty Society
description: Welcome to the Official University of Manchester Beauty Society's Webpage Thank you for taking an interest in our society!   Who are we?  We are a group of beauty lovers looking to raise awareness in the usage of cruelty-free beauty products and choosing sustainable methods to achieve the same make-up look.    What does the Beauty Society do?  We provide collaobrations with local beauty brands that are cruelty-free or have sustainable practices. We also provide workshops on all things beauty from skincare to make-up brushes care.    Who are we looking for? We are looking for enthusiastic beauty lovers to be part of our team! In fact we are expanding our executive committee team and hope you would join us! Not to fret if you think the exec committee is too big of a role. We are also looking for Beauty Ambassadors to help us run workshops throughout the semester. If you are super duper knowledgeable of cruelty-free beauty brands or knows how to create make-up looks then don't be shy and message us on our FB page or IG. We would love to hear from you. After all, a society is all about learning from one another.    Follow Us on our Social Media Pages Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/uombeautysociety/ Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/uombeautysociety/   Terms & Conditions By signing up to the University of Manchester Beauty Society you agree and consent fully to your name and details being on our register in line with the new data protection and GDPR rules. You are entitled to a copy of the information the University of Manchester Student's Union holds on you under the Freedom of Information Act. Your information will not go anywhere other than the Student's Union, if you are concerned please contact the Student's Union separately. Upon signing up with us, you agree to be put on our mailing list and are happy to recieve periodic emails from us. If you would like to opt-out of receiving emails, there will be a link on the emails you will recieve, to do so. Please be aware that the University of Manchester Beauty Society is fully aware of the need to keep details private and will not share any of your details to any third parties. In the extreme (rare) case that we have to (e.g. when the university or law requires us to) we will ask for your consent/notify you first. Please also note that while allies are welcome to our events, they must be respectful and understanding with all members and we expect all  members to be accepting and understanding of each other.

name: University of Manchester Fashion Society
description: If you have a passion for fashion, then this is the society for you! Fashion Society is based on connecting people through the use of fashion and style.  Our main aims are as follows:  To educate, inspire and connect students through the industry and history of fashion.  To allow members to not only express their love for fashion, but also voice their opinions on several topics in the fashion industry and even introduce new views to students.  To respect all views and different backgrounds, both in fashion and culture. To make sure every member feels valued, equal and enjoys their time in the society. To help build fashion networks, experience and portfolios To provide students with opportunities to attend different fashion events  There are several events to get involved in this coming year including fashion shows, trips to fashion weeks, socials, creating magazines, photoshoots, campaigns, guest speaker and the end of year fashion show  Join UoM Fashion Society and celebrate the world of fashion! Contact: Chairperson Feya Mattis - feya.mattis@student.manchester.ac.uk President  Nicole Lloyd - nicole.lloyd@student.manchester.ac.uk Vice President  Deborah Adeniyi - deborah.adeniyi@student.manchester.ac.uk   Facebook  www.facebook.com/fashionsociety.uom/

name: University of Manchester Folk & Ceilidh Society (UMFCS)
description: A society for all things folk and ceilidh related. We have weekly socials including music sessions, ceilidhs, nights out to local folk gigs, and trips on the folk train. To find out more, join our Facebook group or like our Facebook page! We're always happy to hear from members, so if you have any questions please contact us on manchesterfolkandceilidh@gmail.com, message us on our Facebook page, or post your question in our Facebook group. Everyone is welcome regardless of your university or college! Details of future socials and events will be sent to all members via email and advertised through Facebook.

name: UOM Motorsports Society
description: UoM motorsports socitey runs many motorsports related events, from free F1 screenings, to local and national karting races. F1 Screenings: For every Formula one race we hold screenings at the Turing Tap, a popular pub on Oxford road, the events are a good laugh and free for everyone. Teamsport events: We hold discounted time trials and races at local indoor karting tracks, these are great fun and practice for the BUKC. BUKC: We compete in the British University's Karting Championship (BUKC), a national chamionship with some of the best young drivers in the country. We race in 125cc 2-stroke rotax karts, ran by club 100, which can reach 70mph. We have an A team which competes at the highest level of BUKC, the premier class, who in 2019 managed to pick up a couple of class wins. Aswell as the A team, the B and C team race in the intermidiates class and is a fantastic way to gain experience of high level karting. Northern Karting Challenge (NKC): The NKC is a championship held at Northern tracks by local unis, these are held in hire karts which is a good stepping stone between indoor karts and the BUKC rotax karts. Last year we placed 2nd overall and this year we're looking to go one better! Join our group on facebook: https://www.facebook.com/groups/242938695904410/ Follow us on instagram: https://www.instagram.com/uommotorsports/

name: UoM Powerlifting
description: Powerlifting involves three main movements: squat, bench and deadlift. This society aims to allow individuals to train these movements at their own pace with appropriate guidance and support.  We are proud to be affiliated with North West Powerlifting. This means you can expect plenty of opportunities to compete both within the society and beyond (all optional, of course)!  All abilities welcome! We currently have a range of members, from novice lifters to experienced lifters competing nationally. Find us on Facebook at UoM Powerlifting Society Instagram @uompowerlifting or drop us an email at uompowerlifting@gmail.com Happy lifting!

name: Urban Lawyers North
description: Urban Lawyers North assist Black, Asian and ethnic minority students attain the skills needed to successfully access the legal profession. The society aims to establish strong relationships with similar societies at other northern universities as well as northern law societies, chambers of commerce, and business networks.  Our activities include:  Arranging talks, workshops and seminars regarding attaining a career in law.  Hosting networking events for University of Manchester students. Facilitating mentorship networks between students and legal professionals.

name: Vinyl Frontier
description: Welcome to Vinyl Frontier. Here, we're all about music. The society works like a book club, but with albums in place of any literature. We're going to listen to as broad a spectrum of music as possible so people can get into stuff they might've thought they wouldn't like. Also, it's the place to find people to go to gigs with if you can't persuade any of your mates to go. For updates, join the Facebook group here and check out our page here.

name: Warped (Manchester Science Fiction and Fantasy Society)
description: Manchester's Science Fiction & Fantasy Society. Whether you're a casual fan who doesn't know their Asimov's from their Adams' or you're an avid comics & movie fan, you'll be welcome at Warped. We meet on Monday nights and hold quizzes, pub crawls, film screenings and more, all with our unique approach. When we're not doing those things we meet for regular socials in Sandbar, to discuss a wide range of topics like: criminally underrated TV and Cult movies, the greatest fantasy novel of all time, or even just this week's Doctor Who. Whatever it may be you're into, you'll always find somebody else who is excited about the same things as you are and can recommend similar things. We aim both to be an environment that promotes fun discussion of Scifi & Fantasy and to further the SF & F community in Manchester and the North West, be it through joint events with other societies or city trips.  To keep up to date with our events and weekly meetings join our Facebook group.

name: Welsh Society
description: Welcome to the UoM Welsh Society!   Shwmae! We are a new society dedicated to the Welsh culture and lifestyle, who aim to get together and have fun!  This community was started as a way to meet new people, Welsh or otherwise. You don't have to be Welsh to join, and you definitely don't have to speak the language (however Welsh lessons are optional), all you need is a friendly personality and a desire to join in. You're here to enjoy yourself, so do it with the Welsh Society!   If you're interested, you can also take a look at our Facebook page here.

name: Wilderness Medicine Society
description: Aimed at students interested in medicine in out of the ordinary environments including: Expedition Medicine, Prehospital Care Medicine, Military Medicine, Extreme Environment Medicine (sub-aquatic/high altitude/space),Tropical Medicine, Disaster Relief Medicine, Humanitarian Aid Medicine, Search and Rescue Medicine. MWMS makes a concerted effort to be the 'practical society', giving attendees at its lectures and training sessions real skills which they could apply themselves if the need arose. This covers things like the use of items of equipment, to practising carrying an injured casualty. We also hold several lectures each year, usually based around areas which it is hard to give hands-on experience in.MWMS events are open to any student at Manchester University with an interest in the event subject (though a level of healthcare knowledge may be presumed).MWMS is not a profit making organisation. Any monies raised are used to purchase new equipment to increase the training opportunities we can offer.

name: Wine and Spirit Society
description: To educate and enhance members' knowledge and appreciation of spirits and other fine alcoholic beverages, in safe, fun and enjoyable settings, bridging new networks and building friendships. To explore expressions, old and new, in good spirited company via masterclasses and tours, creating memorable experiences. To be a welcoming, inclusive, cross-cultural, outward and forward looking society, very open to new members, ideas, tastes and complementary collaborations, whether within the broader industry, city, university, students union and halls bars or other societies.

name: Women in Business
description: To encourage and inspire women who aspire to enter a career in business.  To discuss, debate and educate around issues surrounding women in business.  To aid and support each other with workshops, motivational speakers and job/internship opportunities.  To meet like minded people through socials and networking events. Your membership will include: - Free and priority access to all future events  - Added to the private members only facebook group  - Exclusive employability workshops   - Socials (Including day trips, nights out, discussion/dinner parties)  - Being part of a society of like minded individuals  - Newsletter including unique networking opportunites with businesses and students

name: Women in Medicine Society
description: The Women in Medicine (WinM) Society is a society aimed at medical students, but open to everyone. The society has two main aims, these are: 1. To promote the personal and professional development of women in medicine. 2. Improve the health of women in society. We put on events throughout the year based on our key themes, which are education, careers and support.  To stay up to date with what the society is doing, please follow us on social media! Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/WinM.Manchester/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/womeninmedicin3 Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/womeninmedicinemanchester/?hl=en

name: Women In Science and Engineering (WISE) Society
description: We would like to represent Women in Science and Engineering (WISE) in a spectrum ranging from career services to socialising.  We aim to create a more close knit community providing women in male dominated fields of study with academic and career orientated support and social activities.

name: Women's Theatre

name: Young Greens
description: Manchester Young Greens organise students and young people to fight for a fair economic system, for good and free education and to stop global warming.  We set up campaigns, workshops, training sessions and speaker events as well as host casual socials. We also work with the official Young Greens branch of the Manchester Green Party and get involved with party events.     Join us to meet other people interested in Green issues, find out more about what the Green Party stands for and get involved with local and national campaigns. To get involved, follow us on: Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/UoMGreenSoc/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/ManchesterYGs You can also email us at: younggreens@manchester.greenparty.org.uk

name: Young Liberals
description: To function as a local branch of the federal Young Liberals. To promote the Liberal Democrats to young people and students.  To further the values and ideals laid down in the Preamble to the Liberal Democrats Federal Constitution. Like our Facebook page to keep up to date with upcoming events: http://www.facebook.com/ManchesterYL/

name: Zoology Society (ZooSoc)
description: Zoologist or not, if you are a lover of animals or nature and studying at the University of Manchester we welcome you to join our society!   We are an ambitious, friendly society with big plans and lots to offer. We aim to unite different students with common interests in biology and science in general, and provide opportunities for people to discover more about the natural world. Whether you love working with nature, learning more cool animal facts or just enjoying the social side of ZooSoc with like-minded people then this is the society for you.   Becoming part of the ZooSoc group is a great way to make contacts that could help develop your career in the future at the same time as providing opportunities for extracurricular work and learning. We will be organising many seminars, conferences and lectures throughout the year to supliment and expand your academic knowledge as well as workshops in the Manchester Museum and working with other uniersities to gain an insight into a broad spectrum of current research. Meet new people and socialise with other budding zooologists, biologists and other at our animal-themed socials, pub quizzes and film screenings! We want you to have a great time whilst learning about animals and research that interests you and encourages your learning. We have lots of fun events planned for the year so stay tuned! We will also be running competitions throughout the year as well as offering some trendy merch. For the first time this year we are setting up ZooSoc sports teams so please let us know if you are interested! Upcoming Events:  Biweekly Seminar Series with both internal and external speakers on a range of topics - last year included 500-year old Greenland Sharks and newly-discovered Tropical Frogs! Freshers Pub Crawl, with Pub Quizzes later on in the Semester Weekly Animal Handling Table in the Manchester Museum at 3pm - with Snakes, Salamanders and a very chubby Gecko!  Please click on the link to join or to renew your membership (It's FREE!). You can also join our facebook group, and follow our blog which has a range of interesting articles, a stunning display of students' photography, and details of upcoming events.    https://www.facebook.com/groups/UoMZooSoc/ http://uomzooblog.blogspot.co.uk/    Please note that you can only join ZooSoc via this page or the QR code system at Welcome Fair, being part of our facebook group alone does not make you a member of the society.
